loans.name: Deni

texts.en:
Deni runs a small stall that sells mobile phone airtime credits and services bill payments. He lives in Garut, a semi-urban area about five hours from Jakarta. Deni is single.

Deni began working with Ruma one month ago because he wanted to increase his income and business by selling mobile airtime and servicing bill payments. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. 

For the last month, he has had around $20 per day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). From his last loan with Kiva he bought a printer, now he wants to continue expanding his business and will use his printer to support his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments (household electricity payments.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone airtime credit transactions and bill payments using a printer

loans.name: Ani

texts.en:
Ani lives west of Bandung, about three hours from Jakarta. She manages a small shop selling mobile accessories and mobile phone airtime credits.  Ani is married and lives with three persons in the family home.

Ani joined Ruma 4 months ago because she was interested in selling mobile phone airtime credits. With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Ani sees improvements in her shop. 

For the last 3 months, she has earned an average of $30 per day in mobile phone airtime credit sales. She hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions.  

Her goal for her business is to expand and have more new business in the future.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone airtime credits on weekends.

loans.name: Rasullan's Group

texts.en:
Rasullan is a 36-year-old woman. She lives in Taxila, Pakistan, with her five children. Her husband has been working in a public sector organization for many years; he is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the family. Rasullan is providing sewing services and earns income to contribute with her husband to manage the household.
 
She needs different kinds of goods, e.g., needles, thread, pieces of cloth, machine oil and so on for her business, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these items. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva group loan with another member from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan. 

This loan will enable her to purchase the above supplies and will be helpful for her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Rasullan is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her sewing business.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is married and has four children. She sells food in their village to support her family. She has been doing this for six years, and she earns a better income for the family. 

Recently, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC Microfinance for additional capital. She used this loan to buy raw ingredients to prepare food for sale. 

She hopes she will expand her business and have a better living with her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to prepare food.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia has been helping her husband, working in their own farm to make a living. For more than twenty-one years, the couple has earned well for the family, and Alicia successfully repaid her previous loan used for farm inputs. After joining GDMPC, she gained access to micro-finance services and  it helps increase her ability to engage in business  through training provided to members. 

To improve the farm, Alicia has taken a new loan to buy organic fertilizer. Alicia wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family in the future.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Melquiades

texts.es: El señor Melquiades vive en una zona rural de la provincia de Tiraque, en el lugar trabaja en su actividad agrícola y pecuaria, para cubrir los gastos de su familia, cuenta con cuatro dependientes económicos que son sus hijos quienes se encuentran estudiando, el señor está casado y alcanzo estudiar hasta la primaria, su casa está construida de adobe, tiene un acabado rustico y le falta obra fina por dentro; como segunda actividad económica  presta servicios de albañil, para la primera actividad tiene que contratar personal eventual que son sus vecinos para la siembra y cosecha de sus productos agrícolas, trabaja utilizando sus yuntas de forma tradicional, todavía no usa la tecnología agrícola, razón por la cual se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un crédito para la compra de una mezcladora y vibradora además de abono orgánico, lo que le favorecerá para aumentar sus ingresos y así podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Sr. Melquiades lives in a rural district in Tiraque Province. It is here that he works as a farmer and rancher in order cover his family’s expenses. He has four financial dependents who happen to be his children who are in school. Sr. Melquiades is married and has a primary school education. His house is made of adobe and has a rustic finish, but the interior lacks in detailed work.

His second source of income is providing his services as a bricklayer. For his main business of farming, Melquiades has to hire seasonal workers, which include his neighbors, in order to handle the planting and harvesting of his crops. He works in the traditional method by utilizing his oxen. To this day, he does not take advantage of farming technology.

Melquiades is applying for a loan so that he can buy a cement mixer and a concrete vibrator. In addition, he will purchase organic fertilizers. This will help to increase his earnings so that he can improve the quality of life for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy a cement mixer, a concrete vibrator, and organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Muco Group

texts.fr:
Augustin  fait parti du groupe Muco  et habite  à Gitega. Il a 53 ans et est marié à Antoinette, une enseignante. Ensemble ils ont  6 enfants, tous  étudient.

Il fait le commerce de tuyaux,de fils électriques, de lavabos,… depuis 23ans.

Il est à son cinquième crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit Kiva qu’il obtient, il va augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de tuyaux, de fils électriques, de lavabos,…    à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Augustin is a member of the Muco group. He lives in Gitega. He is 53 years old and married to Antoinette, a teacher. They have six children together, all of whom are in school.Augustin has been selling faucets, electric wires, sinks  etc for 23 years.
He is on his fifth loan with Turame. Thanks to the Kiva loan, he will bolster his capital and stock up on faucets, electric wires, sinks etc for resale, so as to increase his earnings.

loans.use: to stock up on faucets, electric wires, sinks  etc for resale.

loans.name: Sreythea Hy's Group

texts.en:
Sreythea, 30, is a citizen of Battambang province. She is married and a young mother of three kids; all of them are in school. To cover the daily cost of living for her family, she does rice farming and runs a small stall selling grocery items. She has been with this business for 11 years. Now, she is the group leader of two, and both of them are in their second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).

The past loan, which Sreythea has repaid completely, has helped her to upgrade her family's living conditons. She is seeking a loan in the amount of 1,000,000 KHR and her co-borrower is applying for 1,200,000 KHR. Sreythea will spend her entire loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her farmland. She hopes her rice will produce more yield, better than last year.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide for her farmland

loans.name: Horn Ben's Group

texts.en:
Horn is 43 years old and a mother of four dependent children; three of them are in school and the remaining one is too young for schooling. She can make a living to support her entire household via her rice cropping business and producing handmade beds. She has been supporting her family in her current business making almost 45,000 KHR per day to meet the family's need. 

This is the first microloan for Horn's group consisting of four borrowers. She and two other co-borrowers are seeking for 1,000,000 KHR each while the remaining borrower is applying for 400,000 KHR. Horn is the leader, and she will spend her entire portion to buy palm sugar for resale. She hopes her new business will gain good income in return.

loans.use: To buy palm sugar for resale

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Burlay

texts.ru: Бурлай 37 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 детей. У Бурлай - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Бурлай занимается полеводством и животноводством, стартовав 20 лет назад, с 7,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Бурлай, на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, также имеется 0,52 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает огурцы, помидоры для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации, имеется парник на дому. Ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Бурлай обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом для закупа семян огурцов и помидоров для посевных работ. Бурлай намерена получить хороший урожай, что непременно приведет к увеличению капитала семьи. Доходы от кредита Бурлай планирует вложить в приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее образование детей.
texts.en: Burlay is 37 years old, married, and together with her husband, is raising five children. Burlay has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, Burlay practices livestock breeding and crop farming. She started this business 20 years ago with 7,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Burlay's hard work, she currently has 3 milk cows on her farm, as well as a 0.52 hectare plot of land on which she annually grows cucumbers and tomatoes for personal consumption and sale. She has a hothouse at her home. Her joint income is 10,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Burlay turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy cucumber and tomato seeds for sowing. Burlay is determined to receive a good harvest which will fundamentally increase her family's capital. Burlay plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money to for her children's future education.

loans.use: to buy cucumber and tomato seeds.

loans.name: Kan Kak's Group

texts.en:
Residing in Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district, Kan is 49 years old and a mother of five children. To sustain her entire family, she grows rice on one hectare of farmland, with the support from her husband who works for others for a fee and catches fish for sale, to supplement the family’s income. 

Kan has involved in current business for more than ten years. She has been with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner) for ages. The past six loans that she has repaid completely helped her to stabilize her living situation in a good condition. 

Kan is seeking KHR 1,000,000, while her co-borrower is applying for KHR 500,000. As the leader, Kan will spend her entire loan to pay for plowing fees for her farmland. She hopes that her business will upgrade her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to pay for plowing fees for her farmland.

loans.name: Edelyn

texts.en: Edelyn, a 27-year-old mother of two, helps to operate their farm while her husband works in their municipality as a utility worker. For many years of growing and harvesting corn and other crops, the couple was able to provide for the family. She had to be determined in her work to give a better education to her children. In order to enhance her farm, she is borrowing a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy new varieties of seeds and fertilizers. She wants to improve the general living situation of her family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy new varieties of seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Ruos

texts.en:
Ruos is 50 years old and has been a farmer for more than 20 years. He serves his family with the income from growing and selling rice in his village, a rural area of Prey Chhor district, Kampong Cham. He has four children, two of whom still depend on his income while the other two are married and have independent lives.

Recently Ruos has applied for a loan which will be used to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for the sake of his family members. Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Ruos is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, to safeguard the health of his family and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for the sake of his family members.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
This is Wilma, 45, resident of Caloocan 5, Philippines. She is a widow and she has children. She and her children manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Wilma operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for each item in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

Wilma is requesting a PHP 25,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Wilma dreams that her business will continue to expand and she hopes to have a better living. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 48 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Myrna's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Myrna has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

She has taken a PHP 7,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Myrna is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future, would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is 49 years old and married with one child in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Emelia's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. 

She has taken a PHP 5,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Emelia is is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future, would like to save enough to money to put up a new business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en:
Madelyn works hard to support three children. She is married and has a buy-and-sell coconut business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 1800 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to provide her children with bright light when they study at night.

Madelyn is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 20 years old and married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Mary Jane's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and is committed to regain what she lost. Mary Jane is taking out a PHP 9,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Mary Jane has been with NWTF since 2013 in her pursuit of rising out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Mary Jane would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Twizerane Iii Group

texts.fr:
Josué  fait parti du groupe Twizerane III  et habite  à Cibitoke. Il a 23 ans et est marié à Bénite. Ensemble ils ont  1 enfant de 2 ans 6 mois.

Il fait le commerce de bidons et de sacs en plastique depuis 9 ans.

Il est à son deuxième crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit Kiva qu’il obtient, il va augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de bidons, et de sacs en plastique  à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les années prochaines, il voudrait  avoir une belle maison et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Josué is a member of the Twizerane III Group and lives in Cibitoke. He is 23 years old and is married to Bénite. Together they have one child who is 2 and a half years old. 

He has been trading cans and plastic bags for 9 years. 

This is his second loan cycle with Turame. He will use the credit he obtains through Kiva to increase his capital and buy lots of cans and plastic bags that he can sell to increase his earnings. 

In the coming years, he would like to have a nice home and see his children study.

loans.use: increase his capital and buy many cans and plastic bags for resale.

loans.name: Sokna Hin's Group

texts.en:
Sokna is 30 years old and the mother of three dependent children.  Two of her children attend school and one is too young for school.  To earn a living, cassava farming and rubber tree planting are the main sources of her family’s income.  In addition, working for others for a fee provides supplementary income. She has been involved in the current business for seven years and it generates almost 32,000 KHR of income per day.  

This is the fifth loan for Sokha and her joint borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) with a successful repayment history. She has managed to fertilize her past loan wisely to improve her lifestyle. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay the plowing fee for her cash crop. She does believe that she can increase her yield and improve upon last year’s yield.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay the plowing fee for her cash crop.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Xi

texts.en:
Xi is a 41-year-old woman. She has one child. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband have been running a business selling second-hand clothing for ten years. 

Xi would like to take a loan to buy a greater quantity and variety of clothes to sell. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and to attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity and variety of clothes to sell

loans.name: Raset Kao's Group

texts.en:
Roset, a father of five children, is a borrower from the Kampong Cham province, where growing cassava is the popular business in the area among his neighborhood, as it is for him. 

Besides agribusiness, he can supplement his income via his paid-working job during his spare time. He has been involved in the current business for 27 years, and it has generated him about 31,000 KHR per day. 

This is the first time loan for Roset with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner); he forms a group of two to get a new loan. 

As the leader, he will spend his entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for his cassava. 

He hopes that this purchase will boost his cash-crop in a timely manner, so he can gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his cassava

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Loeurm Set's Group

texts.en:
Loeurm, 25, is single and a resident from Moung Russey district of Battambang Province. To cover his daily cost of living, he farms rice and plants sesame as the main source of income. He has been with this business almost ten years and he can earn about 40,000 KHR per day. 

Loeurm has been with VisionFund(Kiva’s partner) for the past two loans with a successful repayment, and it has enabled his to improve his lifestyle better than before. Now, he leads the group of five borrowers together to get a new loan with total of 6,000,000 KHR, which 1,400,000 KHR is his loan portion. As a leader he will spend his entire loan portion to buy seeds and to pay the plowing fee. He hopes that his business will triple his income better than before.

loans.use: to buy seeds and to pay the plowing fee

loans.name: Zaenal

texts.en:
Zaenal lives in West Bandung, about three hours from Jakarta. Zaenal manages a small shop selling snacks and mobile phone airtime credit.  Zaenal is married and lives with four persons in the family home.

Zaenal joined Ruma 3 months ago because he was interested in selling mobile phone airtime credits. With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Zaenal sees improvements in his`shop.  For the last 3 months, he earned an average of $15 per day in mobile phone airtime credit sales. He hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions.  His goal for his business is to expand and have more new business in the future

loans.use: to have working capital to process more mobile phone airtime credit transactions on weekends

loans.name: Shavkat

texts.ru:
Шавкат молодой, добродушный и жизнерадостный парень в возрасте 23 лет. Он женат, и имеет 1 маленького ребёнка. Всю свою душу он вкладывает в воспитание своего ребёнка. Шавкат  живёт со своей женой в небольшом доме в сельском посёлке. Чтобы прокормить свою семью он занимается своим бизнесом.

Шавкат занимается деканством и животноводством. У него имеется земельная площадь. Из общей площади земли, некоторая часть земли составляет богарные земли, а остальная площадь это поливные земли. На этой земле Шавкат занимается выращиванием моркови, картошки и зерновых культур. А его жена помогает ему ухаживать и растить скот. Бизнес животноводства приносит хороший доход, поэтому Шавкат хочет расширить этот бизнес, увеличив поголовье своего скота. Для этого он обратился в Арванд, чтобы получить кредит на покупку скота. Шавкат заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку и очень надеется на положительный результат.
texts.en:
Shavkat is a young, good-natured and cheerful 23-year-old guy. He is married and has one young baby. He has put his heart into putting aside money for his child's upbringing. Shavkat lives with his wife in a small house in a village. In order to feed his family, Shavkat has his own business.

He practices collective farming and livestock breeding. He has a plot of land. From the general plot of land, a certain portion of the land is left as non-irrigated land, while all the rest is irrigated land. On this land, Shavkat grows carrots, potatoes and grain crops. His wife helps him look after and raise the cattle. The business of livestock breeding brings in a good income, which is why Shavkat wants to expand this business by increasing the size of his herd. This is why is he is requesting a loan from Arvand to buy a cow. Shavkat thanks Arvand in advance for their financial support and really relies on a positive outcome.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Enang

texts.en:
Enang lives west of Bandung, about three hours from Jakarta. Enang manages a small shop selling snacks and mobile phone airtime credit.  Enang is married.

Enang joined Ruma four months ago because he finds it interesting selling mobile phone airtime credits. With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Enang is seeing improvements in his shop.  For the last three months, he has earned an average of $15 -16 per day  in mobile phone airtime credit sales.  He hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions.  His goal for his business is to expand and do more new business in the future.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en: Josefa is applying for a loan of $800 to improve her business. She is married and she has two children She is running ​​a garden in the back of the house and she will use the loan to buy a cleaver, chopper and powder. She is making a good income from her business and she wants to buy more stock with the loan. She is living in a town near the main road, so many people come to buy and she is selling every day. She started her business a year ago with her own working capital.

loans.use: To buy a cleaver, chopper and powder

loans.name: Unión Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “UNIÓN” iniciará el décimo segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por diez  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Faustina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de verduras, venta de enaguas, venta de ropa, venta de periódicos, venta de carne, venta de cosméticos, venta de fibra de vidrio, confección y venta de tejidos, venta de batidos

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Faustina es integrante, ella indica que hace seis años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su cuñada que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de batidos (bebida boliviana); da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendio de su hija quien le enseño la técnica de elaboración, con un poco capital ahorrado decide emprender un negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de azúcar y bicervecina por mayor) que adquirirá de las tiendas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "Unión" communal bank is entering its 12th cycle in Pro Mujer as part of its Santiago II regional office.  The group is made up of 10 members, and is led by a board of directors whose president is Faustina.  The business that the members of the communal bank take part in are varied and include: selling vegetables, skirts, clothing, newspapers, meat, cosmetics, fiberglass, making and selling fabrics, and selling smoothies.

The loan that they are requesting will help the small businesses of which Faustina is a member.  She states that six years ago she joined Pro Mujer, after being invited by her sister in law who is a member of the institution.  Currently, she has a business selling smoothies.  She learned this business from her daughter who showed her the techniques to make them.  With a little money that she had saved, she decided to start her own business.  

The loan that she is now receiving will be used to increase her capital by purchasing sugar and bicervecina in bulk from stores in the city of La Paz.  After making the smoothies, she will sell them in her store.  This line of work allows her to generate an income to support her family, as she is married and has four children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded by saying that she likes that loans offered by the institution.

loans.use: purchase sugar and bicervecina (a malt beverage) in bulk.

loans.name: Khouv

texts.en:
Khouv, age 45, is a farmer who works hard to manage her two hectares of farmland for growing rice and cassava in Baray, Kampong Thom province. She has been doing this for more than 15 years now and has the support of her husband. She is married with five children, four of whom still depend on her income; only the oldest child is employed to finance the family.

Khouv would like to obtain a loan which she will use to buy a used motorcycle for her employed son as the lack of a personal vehicle makes a great expense. This purchase can prevent her son from paying for daily taxi service and allow him to save more for his future needs.

loans.use: to buy a used motorcycle.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en: Loreta helps her husband operate their farm, planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for six years and earns well from this activity. In 2010, Loreta joined GDMPC. She gained access to financial services and ways to help improve her living situation through her business activities. Loreta is requesting a new loan, which she will use to buy organic fertilizer and new seedlings. In the future she wants to provide a good education to her children and improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and new seedlings

loans.name: Hòa's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hòa has a service business, tailoring clothes. She is requesting a loan to purchase a sewing machine to do a clothes repair service.

Hòa is 38 years old and she is married, with one child. She is the group leader of the Hòa's solidarity group, which consists of three members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with one dependent.

In 2011, Hòa joined the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women to improve her  business. Hòa has successfully repaid five loans from the Fund for Thanh Hoa Fund Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Hòa faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hòa hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine to do a clothes repair service.

loans.name: Angel Segundo

texts.es:
Ángel tiene 35 años de edad, de estado civil casado, vive con su esposa y su hijo de 13 años, en la comunidad Manzana pamba perteneciente al cantón Guaranda, Provincia de Bolívar. 
Es integrante de la ventanilla Manzana pamba está formada por 10 socios que son de la misma comunidad los cuales se dedican a la agricultura, se encuentra ubicada a 30 minutos de la oficina operativa Guaranda.
Ángel se dedica a la carpintería. Solicita el crédito para comprar material para la carpintería con lo cual desea mejorar su negocio. La compra la realiza cada 45 días y la venta de su producto cada mes en Guaranda. Su meta es mejorar su negocio. Su desafío son los clientes no cumplidos. En su tiempo libre le gusta dedicarse a la agricultura y escuchar música,  la costumbre que más le gusta son las fiestas de la Virgen.
texts.en:
Angel is 35 years old, single, and lives with his 13 year old son in the Manzana neighborhood of the Guaranda settlement in the Bolivar province.

He is a member of the Manzana Pamba group made up of 10 members from the same community and who are farmers.  The community is located 30 minutes from the Guaranda office.

Angel is a carpenter and is asking for this loan to buy carpentry supplies because he wants to improve his business.  He makes his purchases every 45 days and his sales every month in Guaranda.  His goal is to improve his business.  His challenges are the customers who don’t pay.  He likes to farm and listen to music in his spare time.  His favorite tradition is the Virgin Mary festival.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Irene works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store. Irene is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 59 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living  by raising pigs in the Philippines. Susan is borrowing PHP 8000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Susan has been raising pigs for twenty-five and also earns additional income from general store

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en: Phalla (pictured here) lives about 10 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has four children--one son and three daughters. One of her children is married and lives in a separated home, one is a cashier, one is a garment factory worker, and another one attends school.  Phalla has full-time employment, while her husband is a motor taxi driver. She wants to buy a motorcycle for her daughter to get to work; hence she has decided to apply for a loan to make the purchase.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her daughter to get work.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 34 ans, et 5 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de DOSSOUMA, commune de Falako, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font de la restauration, le commerce de condiments, de céréales, de gâteaux, de sel de cuisine, de la pâte d’arachide, et du sucre. Les femmes du groupe BENKADI sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente SETOU la deuxième personne à partir de la droite dans le rang assis est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de sel. Elle compte acheter, 125 kg de sel de cuisine et des paquets de sachets pour servir d'emballage, chez les grossistes à Fana. La vente de ce sel mis dans des sachets se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle, et au marché du village à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 10. 000Fcfa, qui sera injecté dans l’élevage de chèvre.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group is comprised of married women. On average, they are 34 years old and have five children. They all live in traditional families in the village of Dossouma, in the town of Falako, in the Dioïla prefecture, and in the Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They know one another through relatives, neighbors, and friends. They work in restaurants and sell condiments, cereals, cakes, salt, peanut butter, and sugar. This is the second loan for the women of the Benkadi group. With the goal of satisfying the enormous demand of their clients, they are turning to Soro Yiriwaso. 

The amounts will be used to buy the aforementioned goods. The client, Setou, the person seated second from the right, is illiterate. She sells salt. She would like to buy 125 kg of salt in bags and packets used for packaging from the wholesalers in Fana. 

She sells for retail prices and for cash, both out of her home and in the village market, and to a mixed clientele. She would like to earn an average monthly profit of 10,000 FCFA that she'll use to raise goats.

loans.use: buy salt and bags for packaging

loans.name: Oliva

texts.es: Oliva mayor de edad casada con cinco hijos todos mayores de edad, originaria de uno de los municipios de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable y con muchos deseos de superación personal, es una microempresaria que se dedica a la compra venta de plátanos al por mayor, los cuales compra en fincas plataneras aledañas a su localidad los cuales después vende en mercados de otro municipio, negocio el cual lo inicio hasta tiempo atrás el cual al inicio fue con poco pero hoy en día vende al por mayor que le compra a pequeños productores de esa localidad y distribuye en su propio vehículo, no solamente compra ella misma tiene una pequeña plantación de 1.5 manzanas y las produce también. uno de sus sueños es poder terminar de construir su casa de habitación. el objetivo de este crédito es para invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra de plátanos al por mayor. Oliva agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.-
texts.en:
Oliva is an adult who is married and has five children who are all adults.  She is a native of the municipalities of Chinandega, located in the western area of the country.  She is known for being a hardworking and responsible woman with many dreams of personal improvement.  She is a small business owner who works buying and selling plantains in bulk.  She buys them from plantain farms near her location, and then sells them in markets in other cities.  She started this business a while back.  When she started, she had very little, but today she buys in bulk from small, local producers, and distributes them in her own vehicle.  However, she doesn't only buy them, she also has a small plantation of about 3.5 acres where she grows them.

One of her dreams is to be able to finish building her home.  The goal of this loan is to invest in working capital by purchasing plantains in bulk.  Oliva is grateful for the support that the Kiva lenders offer people of little means.

loans.use: invest in working capital by purchasing plantains in bulk.

loans.name: Rafaela Emilia

texts.es:
Rafaela, madre soltera con un hijo menor de edad, es originaria de Malpaisillo, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar una carrera y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad, para ayudar en los gastos del hogar. En la actualidad lucha día a día para brindarle un futuro mejor a su hijo.

Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de mercadería cosméticos en general, como crema, perfumes, labiales, Ella dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias, ofreciendo su producto a clientes fijos y eventuales. Ella realiza su negocio de forma ambulante. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Rafaela is a single mother to one son. She is originally from Malpaisillo, in the west of Nicaragua. Rafaela is hard-working, responsible and has a desire to do better. Unfortunately, due to a lack of money, she could not study and university and was forced to work from a young age in order to help with household costs. Rafaela now fights every day in order to offer her son a better education.

Thanks to her efforts and her desire to get ahead, Rafaela has a business selling cosmetics, such as creams, perfumes and lipsticks. She works some ten hours per day, offering her products to regular and one-off customers as a street vendor.  This loan will be used to invest in working capital and to stock up her business so that, in the not-too-distant future, she can earn a higher income.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and buy stock for her business buying and selling cosmetics, such as creams, perfumes and lipsticks.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 44 years old and single.

Lorna runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock to sell.

Lorna has been in this business for four years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Lorna aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Baktygul

texts.ru: Бактыгул 36 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Бактыгул- среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается полеводством и животноводством, стартовав 10 лет назад, с 20,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Бактыгул, на сегодняшний день имеется: 5 дойных коров, также имеется 1,30 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает огурцы, помидоры и дыню для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Бактыгул обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом для закупа семян дыни, огурцов и помидоров для посевных работ. Бактыгул намерена получить хороший урожай, что непременно приведет к увеличению капитала семьи. Доходы от кредита Бактыгул планирует вложить в приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку мебели.
texts.en: Baktygul is 36 years old, married, and together with her husband, is raising four children. Baktygul has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, she practices livestock breeding and crop farming. She started this business 10 years ago with 20,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Baktygul's hard work, she currently has 5 milk cows on her farm, as well as a 1.30 hectare plot of land on which she annually grows cucumbers, tomatoes, and melons for personal consumption and sale. Her monthly cumulative income is 10,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Baktygul turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy melon, cucumber and tomato seeds for sowing. Baktygul is determined to receive a good harvest which will fundamentally increase her family's capital. Baktygul plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money to buy furniture.

loans.use: to buy melon, cucumber and tomato seeds.

loans.name: Hun

texts.en:
Hun, 50, is widowed and lives with her family in a village of the Kampong Siem district. She has five children. To make a living, she has been farming rice and working for others for a fee. Having been in this business for 32 years, she can earn about 50,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.

Hun has been with VisionFund for two cycles. Hun has successfully used the past loans to better support her family. She is now applying for a new loan. Hun is going to buy cows to help her better support her farming. She hopes to make more crops so as to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy cows to help her better support her farming

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Agueda De Jesus

texts.es:
Agueda de 58 años de edad, madre soltera con un hijo bajo su responsabilidad, el cual estudia en la universidad, es originaria de Leon, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente no pudo estudiar, y desde muy joven ha tenido que trabajar para salir adelante en la vida, y aportar con los gastos de hogar.

Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de tiste en su casa de habitación, el tiste es una bebida típica de la región, elaborada a base de maíz y cacao, ella dedica a su negocio unas ocho horas  diarias ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y compra maíz, cacao, leña, para poder elaborar el tiste. Águeda agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Agueda is a 58 year old single mother, with one son, who is currently in college, under her care.  She is a native of Leon, a place located in the western region of the country.  She is known for being a hardworking and responsible woman with a desire for personal improvement.  Unfortunately, she was not able to attend school, and has had to work from a very young age in order to get ahead in life and afford her household expenses.

Thanks to her efforts and desire to get ahead, she has a business selling tiste in her home.  Tiste is a traditional drink from the region made from a corn and cacao base.  She devotes about eight hours a day to her business, offering her product.  The goal of this loan is to invest in working capital and purchase corn, cacao and wood to make the tiste.  

Agueda is thankful for the help that the Kiva lender give to people of few resources in poor countries such as Nicaragua so that they may have a dignified source of work.

loans.use: invest in working capital and stock her business by buying raw materials to make tiste such as: corn, cacao, and wood.

loans.name: Khadiyakhon

texts.ru: Хадияхон 55 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Хадияхон - среднее образование. Вместе с мужем Хадияхон занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 19 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Хадияхон, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, также обрабатывает 0,45 ГА земли, где в основном выращивает хлопок. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). Полученный урожай реализуют оптовым поставщикам. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Хадияхон обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум"  за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. После закупки коров, они будут находиться в собственном хозяйстве. Летом скот будет под присмотром пастуха. Доходы от кредита Хадияхон планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство нового сарая для скота.
texts.en: Khadiyakhon is 55 years old, married, and together with her husband, is raising three children. Khadiyakhon has a secondary education. Khadiyakhon and her husband practice livestock breeding and crop farming. She started this business 19 years ago, with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Khadiyakhon's hard work, she currently has 1 milk cow on her farm as well as a 0.45 hectare plot of land on which she mainly grows cotton. Her monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS). The gathered harvest is sold to wholesale distributors. For the purpose of further developing her business, Khadiyakhon turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy cows to increase the size of her herd. After purchasing the cattle, they will be located on her farm. In the summer, they will be under the care of a shepherd. Khadiyakhon plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money to build a new shed for her cattle.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Sari Madu Group

texts.en:
This is the Sari Madu group located in Melaya, west Bali. After the last loan period, most of the members have a sow and breed for piglets. Breeding a sow needs more expertise to help the piglets grow well and healthy. That’s why they need a loan to purchase high quality feed and to renovate the pens.

Ni Luh sold all of her piglets and earned a satisfactory profit. She only needed to maintain them for two months. The profit was used to purchase a sow. Ni Luh and her husband plan to become piglet sellers. Ni Luh and all the member of Sari Madu said "thank you" for the loan and support they had. This program has proven to increase their standards of living.

The Sari Madu group has decided to continue their loans. Having sows now, they need a loan to purchase feed and to renovate the pens. Some of the members will also use the loan to purchase better piglets. They want to breed for more piglets. The business goes well, the sow births safely, and the piglets grow healthy. 

Ni Luh will use her loan to purchase superior feed and to renovate the pen. She plans to sell the piglets outside her village in order to earn more income. She hopes her plan goes well. All of the members also expect the same. Ni Luh will use her profit to support her children's education and to support her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase superior feed and to renovate the cage

loans.name: Dios Con Nosotros. Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal Dios con nosotros está conformada por diez integrantes ocho mujeres y dos hombres, madres y padres responsables con veinte hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Es originaria de Malpaisillo lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región. Se caracterizan por ser trabajadores, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudieron estudiar, y por la necesidad de aportar a los gastos de su hogar comenzaron a trabajar a temprana edad. En la actualidad luchan día a día para brindarle un futuro mejor a su hijo.
Gracias a su esfuerzo  y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es María y tiene por actividad económica una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles y en cantidades pequeñas como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, huevos, sal, jugos, galletas, gaseosas. Ella dedica a su negocio unas doce horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en a compra y venta de productos comestibles, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Dios con nosotros agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The "Dios con Nosotros" (God is with us) communal bank is made up of 10 members (8 women and 2 men) who are mothers and fathers with a combined 20 children under their care.  They are natives of Malpaisillo, a place located in the northern area of the region.  They are known for being hardworking and responsible, with a desire to get ahead.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of resources, they were not able to attend school, and because of the need to cover their household expenses, they started working from a very young age.  Currently, they fight day to day to provide their children with better futures.

Thanks to her effort and desire to get ahead, Maria has become their coordinator.  As a business, she has a small grocery store where she sells food products in small quantities such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, salt, juices, cookies, and soda.  She devotes about 12 hours a day to her business.

The goal of this loan is to invest in working capital and to stock her business of buying and selling food products so that in the near future she can increase her earnings.  

"Dios con Nosotros" is thankful for the help that the Kiva lenders give to people of few resources in poor countries, like Nicaragua, so that they may have a dignified way of earning a living.

loans.use: invest in working capital and stock their business of buying and selling food products such as: rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, salt, juices, cookies, and soda.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: La Vista Del Angel Group

texts.es: La coordinadora del grupo es la señora María tiene de  edad de 40 años madre soltera de dos hijas de las edades de 20 y 18 años y dedicada a la venta de ropa nueva de adulto y venta de cajetas, el negocio sólo está a cargo de ella, sin ayuda, lo que la motiva a prestar en la institución para aumentar la variedad de ropa entre ellas de mujeres y así implementar la venta de ropa para jóvenes y vender  en la comunidad. Este crédito lo invertirá en la compra de ropa nueva como pantalón de varón,  pantalón de dama, camisas de varón, camisas de damas, shores, blusas, etc.  También está conformado por las señoras Aura de 59 años de edad, dedicada al destace de cerdo y venta del mismo en su casa de habitación, y Mercedes de 61 años que comercializa ropa de cosméticos.
texts.en:
The group coordinator is Sra. María. She is a 40-year-old single mother with two daughters (ages 20 and 18). María sells new clothing for adults, as well as candy. She is the only one responsible for her business. Not having any assistance, María was motivated to apply for a loan from ADIM so that she could increase the variety of clothes that she offers, including women’s garments. She will also add clothes for young people to her inventory and sell these products in her community. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of new clothes such as men’s trousers, women’s trousers, men’s shirts, women’s shirts, shorts, blouses, and other items.

The other members of the group are as follows:
• Sra. Aura is 59 years old and has a business of butchering pigs and selling the meat out of her home.
• Sra. Mercedes is 61 years old and sells clothing and cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. Jocelyn has been in this business for 30 years.

She requested a 9,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy a fishing net for her business.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net for her business

loans.name: Zebuniso

texts.ru: Эту умелую мастерицу зовут Зебунисо. Ей 31 год. Она работает швеей. Зебунисо одна воспитывает детей. У нее две дочки в возрасте 7 и 4 лет, и трехлетний сын. Зебунисо со своими детьми живет в районе Хуросон. Она на протяжении 13 лет занимается шитьем. Зебунисо берет заказы на шитье женских таджикских платьев и фасоны для них она придумывает сама. Зебунисо работает усердно, чтобы ее дети не знали нужду. Для продолжения деятельности Зебунисо нуждается в кредите. Она хочет закупить ткани и нитки для шитья. Ваша поддержка ей очень важна.
texts.en: Zebuniso is a skilled craftswoman. She is 31 years old. She works as a seamstress. Zebuniso is raising her children alone. She has two daughters who are 4 and 7 years old and a 3-year-old son. Zebuniso and her children live in the Khuroson District. She has been working as a seamstress for 13 years. Zebuniso takes orders for sewing Tajik-style women's dresses. She comes up with the styles for them herself. Zebuniso works diligently so that children want for nothing. Zebuniso needs a loan to continue her business. She wants to buy fabric and thread for sewing. Your support is very important to her.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread for sewing dresses.

loans.name: Ruperto

texts.es: Ruperto tiene 44 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos. Ruperto es un hombre trabajador quien trabaja como empleado en una empresa cercana a su localidad. Para él lo más importante es su familia y es por ella que cada día se levanta muy temprano para ganarse el pan de cada día. Ruperto solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada y polines para cambiar el techo de la vivienda dado que se encuentra deteriorado.
texts.en:
Ruperto is 44 years old and resides in his own home along with his life companion and his children. He is a hardworking man who is employed at a company near his town.

What is most important to him is his family. For this reason, he wakes up early each day so that he can make a living. Ruperto is requesting this loan from FUSAI so that he can invest in the purchase of galvanized sheets and beams. This will enable him to replace the roof of his house, which has greatly deteriorated.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheets and beams so that he can replace the roof of his house.

loans.name: Dúo Alejandrina De Vista Hermosa Group

texts.es: Dúo Alejandrina de Vista Hermosa la señora Alejandrina  quien tiene una tienda de consumo diario desde hace 5 años.  Esta muy agradecida con Dios por las ventas de todos los días, ya que los clientes siempre la visitan para comprar cada día.  Tiene que comprar varias cosas como pastas, jabón, gaseosas, granos, pero el dinero que tiene ahorrado no le alcanza.  Por eso necesita hacer un préstamo para poder comprar lo que le falta y no quedarles mal a sus clientes.  Cuenta incondicionalmente con el apoyo de su esposo y sus hijos y se siente muy feliz por su negocio.
texts.en:
“Alejandrina de Vista Hermosa” Group

Sra. Alejandrina has owned a grocery store for the past five years. She is very grateful to God for the sales she makes every day. Her customers always come to visit her in order to make their purchases.

Alejandrina needs to buy various products such as pasta, soap, sodas, and grains, but the money she has saved is not enough. For this reason, she needs a loan so that she can buy what she is lacking and keep her customers happy. Alejandrina has the unconditional support of her husband and children. She is very pleased with her business.

loans.use: to buy various food products to sell.

loans.name: Julio Marcelo

texts.es:
Julio de 43 años de edad, padres soltero, con un hijo menor de edad, es originario de Leon, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de  occidente del país. Se caracteriza por ser trabajador, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar ingeniería automotriz. El a la actualidad lucha día a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos. 
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante, tiene por actividad económica un pequeño negocio venta de accesorios para vehículos, como calcomanías, cascos, neumáticos, aceites. El dedica a su negocio unas  ochos horas diarias, ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de accesorios, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  Julio agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Julio is a 43 year old single father with one young son.  He is a native of Leon, a place located in the western region of the country.  He is known for being a hardworking and responsible man with a desire to get ahead.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources, he was not able to attend college although he would have liked to study automotive engineering.  

Currently, he fights day to day to provide his children with a better future.  Thanks to his effort and desire to get ahead, he has a small business selling accessories for vehicles such as: stickers, helmets, tires and oils.  He devotes about eight hours a pay to his business.

The goal of this loan is to invest in working capital and stock his business of selling accessories so that in the near future, he can increase his earnings.  Julio is thankful for the help that the Kiva lenders give to people of few resources in poor countries, like Nicaragua, so that they may have a dignified way to earn a living.

loans.use: invest in working capital and stock his business of buying and selling accessories for vehicles such as" stickers, helmets, tires and oils.

loans.name: Saba

texts.en:
Saba is a 27-year-old married woman. She is a mother of two children. She adores her family and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. 

Five years ago, her husband started his own business selling welding materials. Saba is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, for her husband. Her husband will use the loan amount to increase his supply of welding products including iron rods, iron sheets, soldering rods, and welding rods so that he can respond quickly to customer needs. 

He plans to expand his business with the additional income he earns. Saba hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy welding products including iron rods, iron sheets, soldering rods, and welding rods.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita is 27 years old and married with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

She has a business buying and selling fruit and root crops in the Philippines and has been in this business for two years. 

Jovita requested a 7,000 PHP loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional stock to sell.

In the future, Jovita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additonal stock to sell

loans.name: G.s. Dios Es Amor Group

texts.es:
El g.s Dios es Amor, está conformado por tres integrantes madres solteras con siete hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarios de Nagarote, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país, y se caracteriza por su comida típica como el quesillo. Se caracterizan por ser trabajadores, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente no pudieron estudiar y se vieron obligadas a trabajar desde temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos de hogar.
Gracia a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es  Yessika y tiene por actividad económica la confección y costura ubicada en su casa de habitación, y consiste en elaborar prenda de vestir como pantalones, blusas, camisas, short, capri, sobre de camas, fundas, etc. Ella dedica a su negocio unas ocho horas diarias, ofreciendo sus servicios. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra de materia prima como: tela, botones, encajes, cedinas, agujas, broches, alfileres, carretes, bobinas, forros, centímetros para que en un futuro no muy cercano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.   El g.s Dios es Amor agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The "Dios es Amor" group has three members, all of whom are single mothers with a total of seven children under their responsibility. They members are from Nagarote, in the west of Nicaragua, a place known for its typical foods such as cheese tortilla. The "Dios es Amor" members are hard-working, responsible and have a desire to get ahead. They were unable to to study as they were forced to work from a young age in order to help with household costs.

Thanks to her efforts and her desire to get ahead, Yessika is the coordinator of this group. She makes a living producing and selling clothes from her home. She makes items such as trousers, blouses, shirts, shorts, bedsheets, pillowcases and more. Yessika works some eight hours per day. This loan will be used ​​​to invest in working capital and stock up her business with basic supplies, such as material, buttons, springs, needles, broaches, pins, rolls, bobbins, lining and measuring tapes. She is taking out this loan so that, in the not-too-distant future, she can earn a better income.​
​
The "Dios es Amor" group is grateful to Kiva investors for supporting poor countries, such as Nicaragua, and giving people the opportunity to have a decent job.​

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock up her business with basic supplies, such as material, buttons, springs, needles, broaches, pins, rolls, bobbins, lining and measuring tapes.

loans.name: Meyling Fatima

texts.es:
Meylin de 38 años de edad, casada, con un hijo menor de edad, es originaria de  Nagarote, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país, se caracteriza por ser trabajador, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudo estudiar una carrera y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.

Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante, tiene por actividad económica el servicio de serigrafía, que consiste en reproducir una imagen en cualquier material, como camisetas, etc. Ella dedica a su negocio unas diez horas diarias, ofreciendo su producto. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y compra materia prima como: tintas serigrafía al agua, papel, cartón, vinil, pantalla de serigrafía, telas, para que en un futuro no muy  lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Meyling agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Meylin is 38 years old, married, and has a young son. She is a native of Nagarote which is located in the western part of the country. Meylin is known as a hardworking, responsible person with a great desire to get ahead in life. Sadly, because of a lack of money, she wasn’t able to take any professional training courses as she was obliged to work from a young age to help with household expenses.

Thanks to hard work and commitment, Meylin has a job doing silk-screen printing. This entails reproducing an image on various types of fabric (on shirts for example). She spends some ten hours daily at her place of work which is located in her home.

Meylin is seeking a loan to buy supplies such as silk-screen watercolours, paper, card, vinyl, silk screens, and fabric so that in the not-too-distant future she can increase her income. She is grateful for the help provided by Kiva donors to poor people from poor countries like Nicaragua so they can improve their work situations.

loans.use: buy supplies such as silk-screen watercolours, paper, card, vinyl, silk screens, and fabric for her business

loans.name: Reodina

texts.en:
Reodina, 58 years old, is a forceful and determined woman. For 14 years of her life, she has dedicated herself to working independently in her business. 

For four years, she combined this work with other activities, but after that she decided to throw herself fully into her business and got started in her own welding shop. She works with her spouse every day from 9 a.m. to 6 p.m. She has managed to generate the income needed to help her spouse with household expenses and to support her children.

Reodina's goal is to move her workshop outside of her home which would improve her working conditions and allow her to increase her production. This would guarantee better profitability so that she can provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase iron

loans.name: Martha Jacoba

texts.es: La señora Matha Jacoba tiene una pequeña venta en el municipio del viejo en su casa de habitación, es casada, madre de tres hijos ninguno depende de ella, es una señora trabajadora le gusta mantener el sustento de su hogar, trabaja de lunes a domingo desde las seis de la mañana hasta las seis de la tarde, solicita el financiamiento para compra de mercaderia para su negocio para comprar joyería de fantasía, verduras y otros productos.
texts.en: Mrs. Matha Jacoba has a small store in her home in the municipality of El Viejo. She is married and is the mother of three children, who no longer depend on her. She is a hard-working woman, who enjoys supporting her household. She works from Monday to Sunday from six in the morning until six in the evening. She requests this loan to buy merchandise for her business, including costume jewelry, vegetables and other products.

loans.use: to buy costume jewelry, vegetables, and other products

loans.name: Darling De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
La Joven Darling de los Ángeles habita en el municipio de Santa Rosa del peñon departamento de león, una ciudad donde existen diversas actividades comerciales.

Darling Es una joven de 32 años de edad Madre soltera con 1 hijos bajo su cargo, con lo poco que ella gana a duras penas ayuda a mantener el sustento diario a su hijo que tanto ama y estima. 
Desde hace dos años ejerce el trabajo como Secretaria en una de las instituciones del estado, pero son de sus sueños tener una vida mejor con su hijito. 
Es de su gran necesidad que Ceprodel y Kiva le financie un crédito, para la compra de: Zinc, Arena y Cemento esto lo ve de gran importancia para poderle llegar a brindar una vivienda donde vivir a su hijito. 

Se siente a gusto con este tipo de empleo porque le ha ayudado mucho con su familia y a podido ir comprando materiales para la construcción de una pequeña vivienda. 

Agradece con el apoyo que Ceprodel y Kiva le ha brindado y espera en Dios seguir recibiendo este privilegio, de estos pequeños créditos que le ayudan mucho.
texts.en:
Darling de Los Angeles lives in the municipality of Santa Rosa in the Department of León, a city with much commercial activity. She is 32 years old, a single mother of one child who she is responsible for. With the money she makes she can barely cover the daily expenses for the son who she loves and esteems.

For the past two years she has been working as a Secretary in one of the State Institutions but she dreams of having a better life with her son. She likes her work as it helps her a lot with her family and she is able to purchase materials for the construction of a small house. She greatly needs the help of a loan from Ceprodel and Kiva  to buy zinc sheets, sand and cement. She feels that it is very important to be able to offer a house for her son to live in.  She is grateful for the support that Ceprodel and Kiva offer and hopes to God that she continues to get this support as these small loan help so much.

loans.use: to buy zinc sheeting, sand and cement.

loans.name: Carlos David

texts.es:
el señor Carlos david originario de la ciudad del municipio de jícaro a unos 45 km al este de Ocotal en el departamento de nueva Segovia, soltero y de profesión obrero tiene unos 15 años de habitar en ese municipio siendo una persona muy conocida por los pobladores.

Ese señor en la actualidad se desempeña como obrero en las oficinas de la empresa de agua potable del municipio donde el recibe, él tiene unos 6 años de labrar en dicha empresa siendo esta su principal fuente de ingreso de donde el costea sus gastos personales.

este cliente se presentó por segunda vez a las oficinas de ceprodel con el fin de hacer una nueva solicitud de crédito para poder mejorar las condiciones de una parte de su casa de habitación, el necesita comprar una madera y láminas de zinc y componer el techo de unos de sus cuartos, él se muestra positivo de que el crédito le será otorgado y lograr componer su casa y así tener un techo más digo y tener mejor condición de vida, este es el segundo crédito que él solicita para la mejora de su casa ya que el crédito anterior le fue de mucha utilidad y se muestra agradecido con ceprodel y kiva.
texts.en:
Carlos David is originally from the city and municipality of Jícaro, some 45km to the east of Ocotal in the Nueva Segovia department. He is single and is a workman. He has lived in this municipality for 15 years and is well-known by the locals. Currently he is employed in the offices of the municipal drinking water company where he works on reception. He has been working for this organization for 6 years and this is his main source of income which he uses to cover his personal expenses.

Carlos David applied to the Ceprodel offices for a second time to take out a new loan so he can improve part of the house where he lives. He needs to buy wood and zinc sheets and fix the roof of one of his rooms. He is optimistic that the loan will be approved and he will be able to repair his house and so have a better roof and better living conditions. This is the second loan he has asked for to carry out home improvements, since the previous loan was a great help to him. He is grateful to CEPRODEL and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy wood and zinc sheets.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Rosa tiene la edad de 49 años, es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos de los cuales nos comento es madre y padre para ellos, ya que no cuenta con el apoyo de su padre, ella habita en un pueblo llamado Posoltega el cual esta ubicado a 7km de la ciudad de chichigalpa.Labora en la Alcaldia de Posoltega desde hace 8 años en calidad de permanente y se desempeña como obrera ( barrido de calles)iniciando su labor a las 3.00 am y culminando a las 9.00 am, ya que ella se encarga de barrer las calles que le son asignadas. Ademas de tener un trabajo fijo nos comenta que tambien se dedica en su tiempo libre a vender cosmeticos por catalogos ya que este le permite obtener mas ingresos y asi darle una mejor vida a sus 3 hijos, los cuales aun estan en edad escolar.
Los creditos que ella a obtenido han sido para mejorar su casa de habitacion y como podran ver en su fotografia la casa que esta atras de ella esta cerrada unicamente con Zinc y que es precisamente para compra de Zin nuevo y usado que ella utiliza los creditos, aunque su mayor sueño es llegar a construir su casa de habitacion de ladrillos y tener mejores condiciones de vida para ella y sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rosa is 49 years old and is the single mother of three children.  She is mother and father to both of them because she receives no support from their father.  She lives in a village called Posoltega, located 7 km from the city of Chichigalpa, and works as a laborer (street cleaner), beginning her shift at 3:00 am and ending at 9:00 am and sweeps her assigned streets.  Besides having this steady job, she also sells cosmetics via catalog because it allows her to have more income and provide a better quality of life for her school-aged children.

She has used her previous loans to make home improvements and as one can see in the photograph; her house is only sealed with zinc metal sheeting and she wants to use the money from this loan to buy new and used zinc metal sheeting, although her greatest dream is to build a brick home so she can have better living conditions for herself and her children.

loans.use: to buy zinc metal sheeting.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: La señora Nelly tiene la edad de 45 años, es casada y tiene una hija la cual esta en la universidad. ella nacio y crecio en el ingenio san Antonio que es donde esta establecida la empresa azucarera y desde hace 8 años Habita en un reparto llamado Marvin Salazar. Doña Nelly labora como personal de limpieza desde hace 7 años en una microfinanciera y su esposo es trabajador activo de una empresa de seguridad. Doña Nelly nos comento que el credito ha sido de gran ayuda precisamente en este momento que se encuentra un poco enferma, ya que tenia que realizarce examenes y comprar medicina (sueros, vitaminas y examenes) para poder mejorar su salud, ya que ella es apoyo de su esposo y ambos poderle dar una mejor vida a su hija.
texts.en:
Nelly is 45 years old, married and has a daughter who is at university. She was born and grew up on the Ingenio San Antonio sugar plantation, and for eight years has lived in a development called Marvin Salazar.

For the past seven years, Nelly has worked as a cleaner for a microfinance institution, and her husband is actively employed by a security company.

Nelly is not very well at the moment and had to undergo tests and buy medicine (serums, vitamins and tests). She tells us that the loan has been a great help just now in improving her health, since she supports her husband, and for both of them to give their daughter a better life.

loans.use: to buy medicines (serums, vitamins and tests)

loans.name: Lida

texts.en:
Lida is 28 years old and single. She works very hard to help her parents. Lida runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 3,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc. Lida has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Lida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Emel

texts.en:
Emel, a father of two children, provides transportation services in their village to make a living. For more than a year, he earns well to provide for the family.  

He needs repairs and maintenance of his motorcycle to improve the services to his customers. His wife vends snacks in their village in order to earn more income. 

Emel borrowed a loan from Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) to cover motorcycle maintenance costs. 

In the future, Emel wants to become successful in his business and be able to acquire another unit for expansion.

loans.use: to cover motorcycle maintenance costs.

loans.name: G/s Gracia De Dios Group

texts.es:
G.S Gracia de Dios está conformado por cinco integrantes cuatro mujeres y un hombre, con ocho hijos bajo su responsabilidad los cuales están estudiando en primaria. Son  originarios de San marco Carazo, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Se caracterizan por ser trabajadores, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfruta de la compañia de sus hijos. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudieron cursar sus estudio. Y en la actualidad luchan día a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos. 
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante, la coordinadora es Sandra y  tiene por actividad económica la venta la cosecha de verduras y frutas, la cual después comercializan de forma ambulante y en el mercado de la localidad. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo su producto como plátanos, limones, guayabas, melones, sandias. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de frutas y verduras, para que un  futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El g.s. Gracia de Dios agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a  personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
There are five people, four women and one man, in the Gracia de Dios group. Between them they are responsible for eight children who attend primary school. They are natives of San Marco Carazo which is located in the western part of the country. All are known for being hardworking, responsible people with a great desire to get ahead in life. They like to spend their free time with their children. Sadly, because of a lack of money, they weren’t able to take any professional training courses. Now they work hard every day to provide their children with a better future.

Sandra, a hardworking and committed person, is the coordinator of the group. To earn her living she grows and sells vegetables and fruit in the local market. She spends ten hours daily walking around selling produce such as bananas, lemons, guavas, melons, and watermelons. She is seeking a loan to buy more fruit and vegetables for her business so that in the not-too-distant future she can increase her income. 

The Gracia de Dios group is grateful for the help provided by Kiva donors to poor people from poor countries like Nicaragua so they can improve their work situations.
