loans.use: buy bananas, lemons, guavas, melons, and watermelons for her business

loans.name: Hernando

texts.es:
Hernando es un hombre pujante, activo y trabajador de 52 años de edad, 20 de ellos, dedicado a trabajar en el campo de la confección, inició laborando como empleado en una sastrería, allí obtuvo el conocimiento y la experiencia que le permitieron emplearse en otros talleres y empresas, hasta que, luego de ahorrar el dinero suficiente, pudo comprar sus máquinas y abrir su propio taller, en el que presta el servicio de confección a terceros y cuenta con el apoyo de dos empleados directos; así logra generar los recursos suficientes para solventar los gastos familiares.
Con el crédito que solicita comprará una máquina de doble aguja, lo que le permitirá optimizar el tiempo de trabajo y aumentar la producción, logrando entregar el producto terminado a sus clientes en el momento oportuno y con excelente calidad, esto le abrirá las puertas para obtener mayor cantidad de producción y mejorará el nivel de ingresos por la prestación de sus servicios.
Hernando manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es fortalecer su taller, aumentar el volumen de producción obteniendo más maquinaria para generar oportunidades de empleo y así mejorar los ingresos familiares, con los que podrá brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su esposa y todo su grupo familiar.
texts.en:
Hernando is a vibrant, active, and hardworking man. He is 52 years old and has worked as a tailor for 20 years. Hernando started out as an employee at a tailoring shop. The knowledge and experience he obtained has allowed him to work at other shops and businesses. Later on, he saved enough money to buy machines so that he could open his own workshop.

Hernando provides third-party tailoring services and has the help of two employees who report directly to him. He is able to generate enough income to pay for his family’s expenses. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy a double-stitch machine. This will help to maximize his work time and increase his production. Hernando will also be able to deliver a finished product of excellent quality in a timely fashion. This will open doors that would allow him to produce in larger quantities and increase the amount of revenue from the services he provides.

Hernando says that his greatest wish is to strengthen his workshop and increase his production volume by obtaining more machines. This would allow him to create job opportunities and increase his family’s income, which would give him the ability to provide a better quality of life for his wife and the rest of his family.

loans.use: to buy a double-stitch machine.

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus is a farmer living in Nyamira, a very productive area especially for banana production. He lives with his wife and four children, and has been doing farming for the past 16 years. His income comes from selling milk, eggs, bananas and maize. He also has a retail business. What he enjoys most about farming is crop farming, while his biggest challenge is getting sufficient water for farming.

Justus joined Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because he saw his friends benefit from the Juhudi loans and he wanted to grow. During the training, he learnt about proper loan use. This loan will enable him to get a water tank that will help with water storage. He will therefore produce more and therefore get more income. This will ensure that he is able to pay school fees for his children, and take care of his family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank.

loans.name: Safia's Group

texts.en:
Safia is a 60-year-old woman. She lives in Taxila, Pakistan with her three children. One of her sons is a rickshaw driver by profession: he has been driving a rickshaw for many years. Safia is also providing sewing services and earns income to contribute, with her husband, to managing the household. 

She is in need of different kinds of goods, for example needles, threads, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc. for her business purposes, but due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore, Safia has applied for a Kiva loan from the field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these above accessories, and will also also help her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Safia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy some accessories for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.en: Being a responsible housewife, Lorenza runs a small variety store within her community. She is 31 years old and has four kids. Due to financial hardship, she aims to strengthen her business in order to meet the necessities of her family. She wants to increase her product offerings but she has limited capital. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy rice, soft drinks, canned goods, snack foods, noodles, beverages and seasonings to sell. Being a kind and industrious mother, she believes that she will be able to make her business grow.

loans.use: to buy rice, soft drinks, canned goods, snack foods, noodles, beverages and seasonings to sell.

loans.name: Deiny Xiomara

texts.es:
La señora Deiny  es una persona  muy  emprendedora vive con  su esposo y sus   hijos en una comunidad al sur de Honduras. Su negocio es pulpería desde hace más de 5 años. 
Doña Deiny  préstamo lo necesita para la compra de maíz, frijoles, arroz, refrescos, carne, queso, mantequilla, etc. Con el crédito  espera  el aumento de sus ventas debido a que contara con más capital fresco y  que ofrecer a los clientes que la visitan a diario y así cubrir sus necesidades.
Doña Deiny así mismo espera que mejore su situación económica en el hogar y que se vea reflejado con esta inversión. En unos años sueña con que su negocio  este posicionado como el más grande y  conocido de la zona y poder seguir apoyando a  su familia  a que se convierta en personas de bien.



Choluteca, Honduras – Febrero   del 2013
texts.en:
Sra. Deiny is an enterprising individual. She lives with her husband and children in a community in southern Honduras. Her business is a grocery store that she has been managing for more than five years.

Doña Deiny is in need of a loan so that she can buy corn, beans, rice, soft drinks, meat, cheese, butter, and other products. This loan will help to increase her sales since she will have more merchandise available to offer to her customers who visit her daily, thus giving her the ability to meet their needs.

Doña Deiny hopes to improve her financial situation at home, which should be reflected with this investment. Within a few years, she expects her business to be positioned as the largest and most well-known establishment in her neighborhood. She will continue supporting her family so that they can become good people.

Choluteca, Honduras – February 2013

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, rice, soft drinks, meat, cheese, butter, and other products.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith works hard to support her family. Judith is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell. Judith has been in this business for two years now. In the future, Judith would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Begum

texts.en:
Begum is the age of 38. She is the mother of six children and lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a housewife and looks after her family at home. 

Her husband works selling dairy products like milk, curd and butter. He owns a small dairy farm, which consists of buffaloes and cows. He sells milk daily to different tea stalls. He is an honest man. He manages his household necessities with his earnings from milk sales. He speaks with a monotonous tone, which is impressive, and he easily wins the trust of his clients. He was in need of one buffalo to increase his income. So, Begum demanded a loan. In this way, she can support her husband's business. She thanks Kiva and the field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo for milk.

loans.name: Dúo Mirada En Jesus Group

texts.es: Dúo Mirada en Jesus el joven Sergio Giovanni quien a sus 28 años, se dedica a la confección de blusas para damas en diferentes tallas y colores.  Tiene su negocio desde hace 6 años y es un joven totalmente independiente.  El necesita comprar botones, adornos, aplicaciones para la elaboración de las blusas, pero el dinero que tiene no le es suficiente.  Por ese motivo necesita hacer un préstamo para poder cubrir la necesidad de comprar las cosas que le faltan y así no estancarse en los pedidos que tiene que entregar ya que en rollos de tela él tiene lo necesario.
texts.en:
“Mirada en Jesus” (Look to Jesus) Group

Sergio Giovanni is a young man who is 28 years of age. He makes women’s blouses of different sizes and colors.

Sergio has been in this business for six years and is totally independent. He needs to buy buttons, accessories, and appliqués for making the blouses but the money he has is not enough. For this reason, he is applying for a loan so that he can buy the things he is lacking. This will prevent him from falling behind on the orders he has to deliver. He already has the rolls of fabric that he needs.

loans.use: to buy buttons, accessories, and appliqués for making blouses.

location.town: Aldea Vista Hermosa, San Pedro Sacatepequez

loans.name: Khalida's Group

texts.en:
Khalida is 45 years old and an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is a mother of three children. Her husband is responsible for providing for the needs of the entire family. Khalida has also been doing her business of selling clothes for the past three years and combines her income with her husband's to manage the household.

Khalida needs to buy different types of clothes for reselling. Due to insufficient financial means, she is not in the position to buy these clothes for her business. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva group loan with another member from field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan she can purchase the clothes to fulfill her business needs, so that she can earn more income to support her family and business. Khalida is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance.

loans.use: To buy different types of clothes in bulk

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher is a 38-year-old hardworking married man living in Kagadi, Uganda. He has two children, ages 4 and 1. Neither of his children attends school. He farms and operates a retail shop to earn money to provide necessities for his family. He hopes to grow his retail business and start selling wholesale, in spite of the competition. Christopher is asking lenders to give clients a grace period and is requesting a loan to buy sugar, soap, and bread for selling in his shop.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap, and bread

loans.name: Maria Eddy

texts.es: Maria Eddy mayor de edad madre soltera con hijos mayores e independientes, originaria de uno de los municipios de chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable y con muchos deseos de superación personal, Maria es una microempresaria que se dedica a la compra venta de cerdos, destace donde ofrece una vez a la semana: pepena, frito, charrasca, chorizos, costillas de cerdo, carne, nacatamales entre otros sus compras las realiza en comarcas aledañas a su localidad y tiene una pulperia,sus compras las realiza al contado en mercados y camiones distribuidores. uno de sus sueños es poder mejorar mas su vivienda y ampliar mas sus negocios. el objetivo de este crédito es para invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra de cerdos en pie, y algunos productos de consumo para el hogar como: arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite entre otros. Maria Eddy esta muy agradecida con el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.
texts.en:
Maria Eddy is a single mother whose children have now left home. She is a native of one of the Chinandega municipalities located in the western part of the country. She is known for being a hardworking, responsible person with a great desire to get ahead in life.

Maria has a small business buying and selling pigs. Once a week she also sells tripe, fries, grilled meat, sausages, pork chops, meat, tamales etc. She also has store. Maria buys the supplies she needs on credit from markets and distribution trucks in nearby communities.

One of Maria’s dreams is to make improvements to her home and another is to expand her business. She will use this loan money to buy live pigs, and also to buy some items for the home such as rice, sugar, beans, and oil.

Maria Eddy is very grateful for the assistance that Kiva donors provide to poor people.

loans.use: buy live pigs and food items for the home

loans.name: Gil

texts.en: For two years, Gil has been in his service-based business, providing transportation in his village. His perseverance gets stronger for the sake of his growing child.  He has been separated from his wife and now, he solely provides the needs of his child. For that, he applied for a loan at GDMPC micro credit for an additional working capital to purchase new tires in order to improve his services. In the future, he aims to improve the general living situation of his family.

loans.use: to purchase new tires.

loans.name: Sayda

texts.es:
.                                                                                                                          
La señora Sayda de 31 años de edad es madre soltera con tres hijos dependientes que están estudiando, actualmente viven en la comunidad de Huancuni hacia el norte de Colomi. Su esposo le abandono hace 2 años con sus tres hijos desde que se fue a otro pais no volvió más, la señora se dedica a la producción agrícola, sus ingresos económicos provienen de la venta de papa, haba y oca de esta forma mantiene a sus hijos y se encarga de todos los gastos. Actualmente solicita un crédito, para la compra de insumos agrícolas como abono orgánico (gallinaza) y semilla de papa, así podrá aprovechar el precio bajo ya que el ahorro que tenía lo invirtió en la construcción de su vivienda, con la inversión que hará tendrá todo listo para la siguiente campaña agrícola y así lograrán vivir más cómodos y podrá proporcionales a sus hijos un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Sra. Sayda is 31 years old and a single mother with three dependent children who are in school. She currently lives in the community of Huancuni, which is north of Colomi. Her husband abandoned her and their three children two years ago. He left the country and hasn’t returned since.

Sra. Sayda is a farmer who generates her income from selling potatoes, beans, and “oca” (a tuber that is grown in the Andes). This enable her to sustain her children and pay for all of the expenses. Sayda is currently requesting a loan so that she can buy farming supplies, such as organic fertilizer (poultry manure) and seed potatoes. This will enable her to take advantage of low prices. The money she has saved up will be invested in the construction of her house.

This investment will allow her to have everything she needs for the next farming season. As a result, she can live more comfortably and provide a better future for her children.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies, such as organic fertilizer (poultry manure) and seed potatoes.

loans.name: Heriberto Estanislao

texts.es: Heriberto Estanislao, mayor de edad casado originario de una de las comarcas del municipio de Chinandega, ubicado en el occidente del país, Heriberto se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador, responsable, y con muchos deseos de superación personal. Heriberto es un microempresario que se dedica a la compra venta de cerdos en pie, realiza sus compras al contado en comarcas aledañas a su comunidad, los cuales después vende al contado a comerciantes de este municipio, inicia su negocio desde muy joven el cual lo aprende de sus familiares y luego  se independiza con fondos propios, como un medio digno de salir adelante, uno de sus sueño es poder mejorar sus ingresos y tener mas clientes, el objetivo de este crédito es para invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra de un  lote de cerdos en pie.
texts.en: Heriberto Estanislao is an older, married man who comes from one of the districts of Chinandega town, in the west of the country. He is hard-working and responsible, and really believes in self-improvement. He is a micro-entrepreneur who works in the buying and selling of live pigs. He buys in cash in surrounding districts of his community, and then sells in cash afterwards to traders in the town. He started in the business, which he learnt from family members, when he was very young. Later, he set himself up with his own money, as a decent way of getting ahead. One of his dreams is to be able to improve his income and have more customers. The aim of this loan is to invest in working capital to buy a herd of live pigs.

loans.use: to invest in working capital to buy a herd of live pigs.

loans.name: Roselyne

texts.en:
Roselyne is a 40-year-old hardworking woman married with children. She lives in Hoima, Uganda.

She deals in a juice business alongside produce selling for extra income. She ventured in these businesses to improve her welfare and educate her children.

Her vision is to expand her business and pay the fees for her children, however much she is faced by the challenge of seasonal variations and high transportation costs. Roselyne intends to use the loan to pay for school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay for school fees for her children.

loans.name: Julia Petrona

texts.es: Julia Petrona mayor de edad casada con dos hijos menores de edad, originaria de uno de los municipios de Chinandega, ubicado en el occidente del país,Julia es una microempresaria la cual se dedica a la compra venta de mercadería en general como: variedades estilos de zapatos, ropa, cosméticos, productos plásticos, planchas de cabello, juegos de sabanas,pantalones entre otros, realiza sus compras al contado en mercados de mayoreo de otro departamento y en este mismo municipio, sus ventas son al contado y al crédito el cual recupera semanal y quincenal lo invertido, las cuales distribuye de forma ambulante y por encargo,tiene cliente fijos y eventuales, hoy en día Julia lucha día día para salir adelante y de esa manera brindarle un mejor futuro a sus dos pequeños hijos, el objetivo de este crédito es para invertir en capital de trabajo, en la compra de mercadería como: variedades estilos de ropa, zapatos, cosméticos, entre otros accesorios mas, Julia agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.
texts.en:
Julia Petrona is a married adult with two dependent children. She is from one of the municipalities of Chinandega, located in the western part of the country.

Julia is a small businesswoman who makes her living buying and selling general merchandise, such as various styles of shoes, clothing, cosmetics, plastic products, hair straighteners, sets of sheets, and pants among other things. She makes her purchases in cash in wholesale markets in a different region and in this municipality her sales are in cash and in credit, which she collects weekly. She invests her money biweekly and makes her sales in street markets and on commission. She has regular and occasional customers.

Now Julia fights day by day to move forward and this way she can provide a better future for her two small children. The objective of this loan is to invest in working capital in the purchase of merchandise like different styles of clothing, shoes, cosmetics, and other accessories. Julia is very grateful for the support that Kiva lenders offer to people with few financial resources.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock her inventory of clothing, shoes, cosmetics, and plastic products among other things

loans.name: Juana Doribel

texts.es: Juana Doribel soltera originaria de Chinandega,ubicado en el occidente del país, zona productiva y comercial, se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora con muchos deseos de superación personal y en el ámbito comercial, Juana es una microempresaria de un pequeño negocio ( Pulperia ) donde ofrece productos de consumo básico para el hogar como: arroz, azúcar, detergentes, frijoles, productos congelados, golosinas, gaseosas, cosméticos, huevos, papel higiénicos, leña entre otros. sus compras las realiza en mercados y distribuidoras que les ofrece sus productos en la puerta de su casa, al cuales son al contado, tiene clientes fijos y eventuales, inicia su jornada diaria desde muy temprano para asi brindarle una mejor atención a sus clientes, gracias a la buena atención y calidad de productos que les ofrece a sus clientes su demanda ha crecido mas, es por lo tanto que Juana nuevamente solicita un financiamiento para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir aun mas su pulperia, y de esa manera lograr brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Juana agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.
texts.en: Juana Doribel is single and a native of Chinandega, which is located in the west of the country.  It is a productive and commercial area.  Juana is known for being an enterprising woman with a great desire for self-improvement.  In the commercial arena, Juana is a small, micro-entrepreneur of a small business (a general store) where she sells basic household goods such as: rice, sugar, detergents, beans, frozen goods, sweets, sodas, cosmetics, eggs, toilet paper, firewood and other items.  She makes her purchases from the markets and distributors that deliver to her home.  She pays cash for those purchases.  Juana has both regular customers and walk-in customers at her store.  She starts work early in the morning each day to be able to offer better service to her customers.  Thanks to her good customer service and the quality of the products that she offers for sale, her customers' requests have increased.  And so, Juana once again is requesting a loan to invest in working capital to use to stock up her store even more.  In this way, Juana will be able to offer better service to her customers.  She is very grateful for the help that the Kiva investors offer to low-income people.

loans.use: to invest in working capital to use to increase her inventory by purchasing household goods for re-sale.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph, who lives in Kagadi, Uganda, used the previous loan to buy beer, sodas, and spirits to sell. 

To supplement his income he also deals in buying and selling produce, a business he started with the previous loan. He now feels he needs to concentrate on his produce business, though challenged by price fluctuations and bad roads that affect his service delivery. 

Joseph hopes to construct a good house and he is asking for a loan to buy more maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize to sell.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 48 years old and has three children. She is married, and one of her children is in school.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Nida requested a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy additional sacks of feed.

Nida has been raising pigs for 13 years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of feed.

loans.name: Margot Deisy

texts.es:
Margot es una mujer pujante y emprendedora de 30 años de edad, que lucha incansablemente para generar recursos que le permitan apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar y brindar educación a su único hijo. Desde hace algún tiempo, comenzó a vender productos por catálogo de una marca muy reconocida a nivel mundial y también realiza jornadas de salud en diferentes empresas de la ciudad, eventos en los que promociona los productos que ofrece por sus características naturales.
Con el crédito que solicita desea comprar surtido al por mayor (cremas corporales y faciales, suplementos dietarios, vitaminas, entre otros), esto le permitirá tener disponibilidad suficiente de inventario para ofrecer variedad y satisfacer las necesidades y gustos de su clientela, logrando incrementar los ingresos.
Margot manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es tener un local propio en el que pueda ofrecer sus productos y dictar las charlas de vida saludable, así aumentará la rentabilidad y la capacidad económica para brindar una mejor educación a su hijo y disfrutar una mejor calidad de vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Margot, age 30, is a vibrant and enterprising woman. She strives tirelessly to earn income so that she can help her husband with the household finances and providing an education for their only child. Some time ago, Margot began selling products through catalogs. The products are of a well-known brand that is recognized worldwide. She also conducts health seminars for different companies throughout the city. These events allow her to promote products that have natural qualities.

With the loan she is requesting, Margot will buy merchandise in bulk such as body and face crèmes, dietary supplements, vitamins, and other products. This will allow her to have a sufficient inventory so that she can offer variety to her customers and satisfy their needs and tastes. As a result, she will be able to increase her earnings.

Margot says that her greatest wish is to have a shop of her own where she can offer her products and conduct healthy living seminars. This would increase her profitability and financial capacity, thus giving her the ability to provide a better education for her son and to enjoy a better quality of life with her family.

loans.use: to buy body and face crèmes, dietary supplements, vitamins, and other products in bulk.

loans.name: Jyldyzbu

texts.ru: Жылдызбу 58 лет, вдова, после смерти супруга одна воспитывают сына. У Жылдызбу - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Жылдызбу занимается животноводством, стартовав 33 года назад, с покупки скота на 6,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Жылдызбу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 6 дойных коров, 1 лошадь,15 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 9,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жылдызбу обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Жылдызбу планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство нового дома.
texts.en: Jyldyzbu is 58 years old, a widow, and after the death of her husband, is raising her son alone. Jylduzbu has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, Jyldyzbu practices livestock breeding. She started this business 33 years ago, with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 6,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Jyldyzbu's hard work, she currently has 6 milk cows, 1 horse and 15 sheep on her farm. Her monthly income is 9,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Jyldyzbu turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy cows to increase the size of her herd. Jyldyzbu plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money to build a new house.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Guiselda De La Concepcion

texts.es:
Guiselda de 24 años de edad, casada con dos hijos menores de edad, es originaria de León, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Ella se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos  económico no pudo cursar una carrera y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. En la actualidad lucha día a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos, y poder formarlos en profesionales el cual es uno de sus sueños más anhelados.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de ropa en un tramo de unos de los mercados de la localidad,  ropa como: bóxer, biquinis, camisas, calcetines, camisolas, short, ropa de niño, toallas. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias, ofreciendo su producto, el objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y  surtir de mercadería nueva, para aprovecha la temporada de semana santa la cual ya se acerca.  Para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Guiselda agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a  personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Guiselda, 24, is married and has two children who are minors. She is originally from León, which is located in the western area of the country. She is characterized as being hard-working, responsible, and having the desire for self-improvement. Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources, she was not able to study for a degree and was obligated to work from a young age to help with the home expenses. She currently fights day-to-day to provide her children with a better future, and be able to train them to be professionals, which is one of the dreams she most longs for.

Thanks to her effort and desire to get ahead, she is able to make a living selling clothing such as boxers, bikinis, shirts, socks, camisoles, shorts, children´s clothing and towels, in a lot at one of the local markets. She works ten hours per day in her business, offering her products. 

Her goal with the loan is to invest it in working capital and stock up on new merchandise to take advantage of the "semana santa" (Easter) season that is coming up, so that in the not-too-distant future she can obtain a better income. Guiselda is thankful for the help offered by the Kiva investors to people with scarce resources and from poor countries such as Nicaragua, in order to give them a source of decent work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock her business (in which she buys and sells merchandise such as boxers, bikinis, shirts, socks, camisoles, shorts, children´s clothing and towels).

loans.name: Abdulhakim

texts.ru:
Абдулхаким жизнерадостный и трудолюбивый мужчина  в возрасте 38 лет. Он женат и имеет 4-х детей. Он обратился в Арванд впервые, когда узнал, что есть возможность получить финансовую поддержку.  Сам Абдулхаким живёт со своей семьёй в небольшом доме маленькой деревушки. Он не имеет высшего образования, так как после окончания средней школы не получилось поступить в университет для получения высшего образования из-за финансовых трудностей в семье. Жена Абдулхакима также не имеет образования и является домохозяйкой, она занимается домашними делами и воспитанием детей.

Чтобы иметь доход на пропитание, Абдулхаким занимается своим бизнесом. Он занимается откормом и продажей крупного рогатого скота. Также  Абдулхаким подрабатывает водителем такси. От данного бизнеса он получает хороший доход. Жена также помогает Абдулхаким в его деле, она продаёт молоко, полученное от скота.  Сейчас Абдулхаким хочет увеличить количество скота для расширения своего бизнеса. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку скота. Абдулхаким очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Abdulhakim is a cheerful and hardworking 38-year-old man. He is married and has four children. Abdulhakim turned to Arvand for the first time when he realized that there was an opportunity to receive financial assistance. Abdulhakim lives with his family in a small house in a tiny village. He does not have a higher education, as after her graduated from secondary school, he did not enroll in university due to financial difficulties in his family. Abdulhakim's wife also does not have an education. She is a homemaker who does the household chores and raises their children.

In order to have earnings to live on, Abdulhakim has his own business. He fattens up and resells cattle. Abdulhakim also earns extra money as a taxi cab driver. He receives a good income from this agricultural business. His wife also helps him with this business. She sells the milk obtained from the cows. Now Abdulhakim wants to increase the size of his herd to expand his business. This is why he is requesting a loan from Arvand to buy cattle. Abdulhakim really relies on a positive outcome and thanks Arvand in advance for their assistance.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Cristian Karolina

texts.es:
Cristian de 35 años de edad, madres solteras con dos hijos menores de edad, es originaria de León, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país, se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar una carrera y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad. Para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar una carrera y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica  la venta de artesanía como: cuadro típico, jarrones, ceniceros, ollitas de barro, muñecas artesanales, vestidos, camisas típicas, bolsos típicos, el escudo, el himno nacional, el  ave nacional. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos artesanales para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Cristian is a 35-year-old single mother with two young children. She is originally from León, a place located in the western zone of the country. She is hardworking, responsible, and has ambitions to improve herself. Unfortunately, because she lacks financial resources, she was unable to complete a college degree and she was obligated to work from an early age to help with household expenses.

Thanks to her effort and her desire to move forward, she makes money from the sale of handicrafts such as traditional paintings, vases, ashtrays, small clay pots, handmade dolls, dresses, typical blouses, typical purses, and handicrafts with the national shield, anthem, and bird. She dedicates 10 hours a day to her business, selling her products. The objective of this loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business in the purchase and sale of handmade goods so that in the near future she can obtain better earnings.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock her business in the purchase and sale of traditional paintings, vases, ashtrays, small clay pots, handmade dolls, dresses, typical blouses, typical purses, and handicrafts with the national shield, anthem, and bird

loans.name: Alfredo Salvador

texts.es: Alfredo Salvador, mayor de edad casado, originario del municipio de Chinandega, ubicado en el occidente del país, zona que se caracteriza por ser comercial y productiva, Alfredo es un microempresario propietario de un taller de joyería ubicado en su casa de habitación, donde realiza cadenas, pulseras, dijes, anillos, aretes de oro, plata, acero y bronce, los cuales compra sus productos a comerciantes que venden oro, sus ventas son al contado y al crédito los cuales el distribuye su mercadería en tiendas y a clientes fijos recuperando semanal y quincenal lo invertido, su negocio ha crecido teniendo mayor demanda, por lo que opto por realizar nuevamente un financiamiento para invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra de productos de materia prima como: oro, plata, bronce, acero, piedras, candados, limpiadores para prendas, entre otros mas, de esa manera lograra cumplir con varios pedidos que tiene y de esa modo poder satisfacer a sus clientes. Alfredo agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.
texts.en:
Alfredo Salvador is married.  He is from the Chinandega municipality in the western part of the country.  It is known for being a commercial and a productive area.  Alfredo has a small business, which is a jewelry shop located at his house.  He makes chains, bracelets, pendants, rings, and earrings from gold, silver, steel, and bronze.  He buys his products from merchants who sell gold.  He sells for cash and for credit.  He distributes his merchandise to stores and fixed customers.  He collects on his sales weekly and biweekly.

His business has grown, and he has more demand.  Therefore, he is opting to get a new loan in order to buy raw material like gold, silver, bronze, steel, stones, clasps, jewelry cleaners, and others.  This way he will manage to complete various orders that he has.  This way he will be able to satisfy his customers.

Alfredo is very grateful  for the support that the Kiva lenders provide to people with scarce financial resources.

loans.use: to buy raw material like gold, silver, bronze, and steel, among others.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 59 years old, married and has one child. 

She is in the agricultural business raising pig in the Philippines. Francisca requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Francisca has been raising pig for 10 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: M. Amjad

texts.en:
M. Amjad is 46-year-old married person. He is living in an urban area of Lahore, Pakistan. He is a welder by profession and manufactures school benches to order. He has been manufacturing and generating reasonable income for his family. He is the sole earner for his entire family. He gets contracts from various schools for manufacturing iron benches. He also manufactures iron accessories such as door and windows which are usable in houses. He has been providing door to door services to weld broken accessories as well. For this purpose he utilizes iron rods, soldering rods, welding rods and iron sheets on daily basis. 

Recently, M. Amjad signed a contract with a high school to manufacture a lot of desks and benches, but he does not have enough raw material. The customer paid some cash in advance, but not enough for M. Amjad to buy all the raw material he needs.

For this reason, M. Amjad contacted BRAC and requested a Kiva loan. After signing all necessary documents including a client waiver, BRAC gave him a loan. He will buy raw material such as iron rods, welding rods, soldering rods and iron sheets for manufacturing the school benches. This will allow him to generate additional income for his entire family and care for his children well. 

M. Amjad thanks Kiva and Kiva's field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy raw material such as iron rods, welding rods, soldering rods and iron sheets for manufacturing school benches.

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es: María del Socorro mayor de edad madre soltera de dos hijos menores aun de edad, originaria de uno de los municipios de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, zona que se caracteriza por existir uno de los ingenios mas grande del país, María es una mujer emprendedora que ha luchado día a día por salir adelante junto con sus dos hijos, inicia su negocio desde muy joven con el objetivo de poder mejorar sus ingresos y de esa manera sacar adelante a sus hijos, por lo que decide dedicarse a la compra venta de mercaderia en general como: variedades estilos de ropa, zapatos, cosmeticos entre otros mas, sus compras las realiza al contado en otro pais al por mayor al igual que en mercados de mayoreos, sus ventas son al contado y al credito recuperando semanal y quincenal tiene clientes fijos y eventuales, el objetivo de este credito es para invertir en la compra de mercaderia en general como: zapatos, productos plasticos, cosmeticos, ropa, sobre camas, almohadas entre otros.
texts.en:
María del Socorro is a single mother with two minor children.  She is from one of the Chinandega municipalities, which is located in the western part of the country.  The area is known for one of the biggest refineries in the country.

María is an enterprising woman who has struggled day to day in order to get ahead together with her two children.  She started her business when she was very young.  She did so in order to be able to improve her income and in this way get her children ahead.  She buys and sells general merchandise like various styles of clothes, shoes, and cosmetics, among others.  She makes her purchases wholesale and for cash in another country and at wholesale markets.  She makes her sales for cash and for credit.  She collects weekly and bi-weekly.  She has fixed and casual customers.

The objective of this loan is to buy general merchandise like shoes, plastic products, cosmetics, clothes, bedspreads, pillows, and others.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise like shoes, plastic products, cosmetics, clothes, bedspreads, pillows, and others.

loans.name: Fashagakura Group

texts.fr:
Anitha  fait parti du groupe Fashagakura  et habite  à Gitega. Elle a 29 ans et est mariée à Elvis,un cultivateur. Ensemble ils ont  4 enfants  dont 1 étudie.

Elle  fait le commerce de haricot, de  riz, de sel,… depuis 9 ans.

Elle est à son neuvième  dit à Turame. Avec le crédit Kiva qu’elle  obtient, elle  va augmenter son capital et acheter une grande   quantité de haricot, de riz, de sel,...  à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en: Anitha is a member of the Fashagakura group and she lives in Gitega.  She is 29 years old and married to Elvis, a farmer.  Anitha and Elvis have four children, one of whom is in school.  Anitha has been selling beans, rice and salt for the past nine years.  This is her ninth loan with Turame.  With this loan, financed by Kiva, she will increase her capital and buy a large quantity of beans, rice and salt for resale.  Her goal is to increase her revenue.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of beans, rice and salt for resale.

loans.name: Lesvia Esperanza

texts.es: Lesvia Esperanza mayor de edad madre soltera de cinco hijos todos mayores de edad, originaria del municipio de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, se caracteriza por ser una zona productiva y comercial, Lesvia se destaca por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable y con muchos deseos de superación personal, es una microempresaria que se dedica a la compra venta de mercadería en general como: variedades estilos de ropa, zapatos, cosméticos, entre otros, al igual que también tiene otro negocio que es el de destazar cerdos y luego realizar sus ventas, las cuales realiza fritos, pepenas, deliciosos nacatamales, moronga entre otros, sus ventas las realiza de forma ambulante, y sus compras son al contado, uno de sus sueños es poder terminar de reparar su vivienda, el objetivo de este crédito es para reforzar su capital de trabajo y de esa manera poder suplir  algunos encargos de sus clientes. Lesvia agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.-
texts.en:
Lesvia Esperanza is a single mother with five adult children. She is originally from the municipality of Chinandega, located in the western part of the country, which is characterized as a productive commercial zone.

Lesvia stands out as a hardworking, responsible woman with many desires to improve herself. She is a small businesswoman who makes her living buying and selling general merchandise such as various styles of clothing, shoes, cosmetics and other goods. She also has another business butchering pigs and later selling prepared foods like fried pork, coffee fruits, delicious nacatamales, and pork sausages among other dishes. She makes her sales in street markets and her purchases are made in cash.

One of her dreams is to be able to finish repairing her home. The objective of this loan is to strengthen her working capital and in doing so, she will be able to fulfill the requests of her customers. Lesvia is very grateful for the support that Kiva lenders offer to people with few financial resources.

loans.use: to invest in working capital for the purchase of general merchandise like clothing and shoes along with pork for the production of her delicious nacatamales and other things

loans.name: Basilia Domitila

texts.es: Basilia es una mujer de 40 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y su pequeño hijo de un año.  Ella se gana la vida mediante la venta de ropa en el mercado central de su localidad. De esta forma se gana el sustento y apoya a la economía del hogar. Basilia desea desea cambar el techo de la cocina de su vivienda dado que se encuentra deteriorado por causa del tiempo y las lluvias. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de teja y madera para proceder al cambio del techo de la cocina lo antes posible.
texts.en: Basilia is a 40 year old woman. She lives in her own home with her life's companion and her little one year old son. She earns a living selling clothes n the central market in her town. In this way, she earns income and helps with the family's expenses. Basilia wants to change the roof on the kitchen of her house because is has deteriorated due to time and rain. To do this, she has asked FUSAI for a loan to invest in roof tiles and wood to change the roof on the kitchen as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy roof tiles and wood for the roof on the kitchen.

loans.name: Anda Yolanda

texts.es: Anda Yolanda mayor de edad madera soltera de un hijo ya mayor de edad originaria del municipio de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, zona que se caracteriza por ser productiva y comercial, Anda es una microempresaria que es propietaria de una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación el cual cuenta con una experiencia de 16 anos, donde ofrece productos al por menor como bolsitas de café, caja de fósforo, cigarros menudeados, granos básicos, detergentes, pasta dental, refresco naturales,productos congelados, golosinas entre otros mas. su jornada diaria es de 15 horas diario desde las 6:00am que abre sus puertas para sus clientes hasta las 10:30 de la noche que cierra de tal manera que sus clientes quedan satisfechos por la buena atención que les ofrece, también ofrece mercadería en general como: variedades estilos de ropa, chinerias cosméticos entre otros. sus compras son al contado en casas distribuidoras y a camiones distribuidores, tiene clientes fijos y eventuales, El financiamiento lo necesita para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su pulpería para brindar mejor servicios a sus clientes al igual que mercadería como: cosméticos, ropa entre otros . Anda Yolanda no es primera vez que ha trabajado con León 2000, el cual ha demostrado ser responsable en sus pagos en tiempo y forma. Anda Yolanda agradece la ayuda de los inversionistas kiva a las personas de escasos recursos para  tener fuentes de trabajo digno en países pobre económicamente como es Nicaragua.
texts.en: Anda Yolanda is an older single mother. Her son is grown. She is from the town of Chinandega, located in the western part of the country. It is an area characterized as being productive and commercial. Anda is a micro-businesswoman. She is the owner of a store located in her house. She has 16 years' experience offering products retail, such as bags of coffee, boxes of matches, loose cigarettes, basic grains, detergent, tooth paste, natural juices, frozen products, snacks and more. Her daily schedule is 15 hours long, from 6:00 a.m,, when she opens her doors for her customers, to 10:30 p.m., when she closes. Her customers are satisfied with the good service that she offers them. She also offers general merchandise such as different styles of clothing, Chinese products, cosmetics and more. She pays for her products up front at distribution centers and trucks and she has regular and occasional customers. She needs the loan to invest in working capital to stock her store and offer a better service to her customers as well as merchandise such as cosmetics, clothes, and more. This is not the first time that Anda Yolanda has worked with León 2000. She has shown her self to be responsible and punctual with her payments. Anda Yolanda is grateful to to the Kiva investors for the help they give low income people so they can have sources of dignified work in poor countries like Nicaragua.

loans.use: to buy home consumption products such as basic grains, frozen goods, snacks, and more, as well as general merchandise, such as different styles of clothes, Chinese products, cosmetics and more.

loans.name: Dino

texts.en: Raul, a father of two, has been providing transportation services in his village to make a living. For more than two years, he's been earning well to provide for his family. He and spouse decided to begin another line of business to earn more income for the family. He started a general store selling grocery foods in their village. To make it happen, he borrowed a micro credit loan from GDMPC to purchase grocery goods to open the retail store. He uses his motorcycle (used also for his transportation business) to carry the goods to the store. In the future, he wants to acquire a new motorcycle to expand his services.

loans.use: to purchase grocery goods to open a retail store

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 52 years old and a resident of San Jose province of Isabela. She is married with three school-age kids. She earns a living through raising pigs. She is very loving person. Now she is applying for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy one piglet and one sack of feed for her growing hog-raising business.

Edna deeply wishes to maintain her membership in good standing with ASKI.

loans.use: to purchase one piglet and one sack of feed

loans.name: Edwin Ernesto

texts.es: Edwin de 41 años de edad se dedica desde hace 30 años a la agricultura principalmente a la siembra de maíz, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en sacos así como muestra la fotografía para luego salir a comercializarla a los mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, Edwin esta solicitando un crédito para la compra semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y así continuar con sus cosechas para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Edwin is 41 years old and has been farming for 30 years, growing primarily corn. When his harvested crops are ready to be stored, they are kept in sacks as shown in the photo. Eventually the products will be sold at the markets near his home.

Edwin is requesting a loan in order to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest controls, and other supplies. This will enable him to continue farming so that he can provide a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest controls, and other supplies.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosita is 40 years old and has two children who are in school.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Rosita requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell.

Rosita has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Rosita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Renalyn

texts.en:
Renalyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a 7000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy an additional basket of fish to sell.

Renalyn has been in this business for 5 years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional basket of fish to sell

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Meet Robert who is living in the Nyamira area, which is known for banana farming. He is married and has three children all of school going age. He has been doing farming for four years with his primary income source being milk, bananas and eggs. He also has a retail business. He enjoys farming because of the cattle rearing, which brings him a lot of profit. His biggest challenge is transporting farm output after the harvest.

Robert chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because their loan requirements are friendly. During the training, he learned about proper loan use and repayment. This loan will enable him to add more poultry and thus more eggs, which will lead to more income. This will enable him to pay his children's school fees and their living standards will improve.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena works hard to support her family. Rowena is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Rowena requested a 7000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of chicken, meat, hotdogs, etc.

Rowena has been in this business for 2 years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional chicken, meat, and hotdogs

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 55 year old woman and mother of four children. She lives in Taxila, Pakistan. Her husband is a vegetable merchant by profession, selling vegetable such as potatoes, onions, garlic, and carrots. He is solely responsible for feeding the entire family and providing for the household.

Razia's husband needs to purchase different types of vegetables to resell so that he can increase the size of his business, improve his sales growth and earning maximum profit. But due to their unfavorable financial position, he is not able to purchase the vegetables that his business needs to thrive.

Therefore, Razia has applied for a loan from Kiva field partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to purchase the above items for the family business.
 
She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy bulk vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Tuvyurane Group

texts.fr:
M. Goreth  fait partie du groupe  Tuvyurane  et habite à  Gitega. Elle a 35 ans et est mariée à  Edouard, un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 2 enfants,  âgés de 3  à 11 ans, dont 1 étudie.
  
Elle fait le commerce de  boutique (savon, farine de manioc, huile de palme,…) depuis 15  ans. 

Elle est à son troisième crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de haricot, de savons, de farine de manioc, ....à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dan les années prochaines, elle voudrait acheter un terrain cultivable et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
M. Goreth is a member of the Tuvyurane group and she lives in Gitega.  She is 35 years old and married to Edouard, who works in retail.  M. Goreth and Edouard have two children, ages 3 and 11.  One of their children is in school.

M. Goreth has been selling grocery products such as soap, cassava flour and palm oil for the past 15 years.  This is her third loan with Turame.  With this loan, financed by Kiva, she will increase her capital and buy a large quantity of beans, soap and cassava flour for resale.  Her goal is to increase her revenue.  In the coming years, she would like to buy some farmland and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of beans, soap and cassava flour for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural materials to help her coffee crops.

loans.name: Oldalia

texts.en: Oldalia has been doing her buy and sell business in their village to make a living. She sells copra and charcoal in town and earns a good income to sustain her business and provide the needs of the family. With her generated revenue, she was able to repay successfully her previous loan used for the business. She likes her business because there is no one doing this kind of business in her village. It earns well in addition to her income from her farm. To continue running her business, she took a new loan recently to purchase more coconut shells and charcoal products. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more coconut shells and charcoal products

loans.name: Gulbar

texts.en:
Gulbar is a kind woman. She and her husband are happy and have three children. She is very hard-working and kind-natured. She has a lot of friends and all of them love her very much.

Gulbar has been farming for 15 years, producing wheat and potatoes. In order to provide her crops with care they need, Gulbar is currently requesting another loan in the amount of 12,000 Somoni so that she can buy fertilizer, seeds and fuel and continue improving her crop production. She hopes than from the profit she can maintain a better standard of living and help her children continue their education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and fuel.

loans.name: Mutiara Group

texts.en:
For a housewife in Bali, it has become commonplace to have pigs at home. They are used to support the family’s income other than the husband's income. Apart from the farming business, something else that could help meet the needs of daily life is to raise livestock, especially pigs. 

In development, there are several obstacles faced in developing the business, such as limited knowledge of business management, as well as limited access to capital. To overcome this problem, they decided to join into one group so it would be easier to communicate among members of the group, and the group could more easily get funding.

Ni Nengah is head of the Mutiara group and runs a pig breeding business. To increase the business, Ni Nengah invited group members to participate in loan programs for small businesses from MUK. 

Ni Nengah’s loan will be used to buy three piglets and the rest to buy feed. In a period of six months, pigs are ready for sale. The advantage gained from this effort will be used entirely to support the family economy.

loans.use: to buy three piglets and also feed.

loans.name: Rottie

texts.en:
Rottie is married with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rottie is 34 years old and has two children who are in school.

She has a general store business in the Philippines. Rottie requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Rottie has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Rottie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion works hard to support her family. Salvacion is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a 9000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy an additional fishing net.

Salvacion has been in this business for 19 years now.

In the future, Salvacion would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy an additional fishing net.

loans.name: Uaminifu Rénové Group

texts.fr: La cliente  Muhondi est une vaillante commerçante, vice présidente et membre du groupe d’affaires «Uaminifu Rénové», senior entrepreneur, dynamique, âgée de 52 ans et mère de 5 enfants, qui tous étudient. Elle est   vendeuse des divers  produits d’alimentation. Elle installe sa marchandise dans une mini alimentation à son domicile dans un Quartier animé, où, elle a su gagner sa clientèle. Elle commença ses affaires avec le premier capital reçu de la récolte agricole. Son conjoint est un agriculteur. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Elle y a 25 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 3 sacs de farine de  format, 2 cartons du lait, 2 sac se sucre, 2 carton de vin, 3 cartons de jus, 5 cartons d’eau vive, 60 litres d’huile, etc. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son capital, scolariser, nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des petits entrepreneurs exclus du système bancaire classique, surtout; pendant ce moment difficile post conflits dans la région de l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
This client, Muhondi, is a valiant merchant and the vice-president of the business group "Uaminifu Rénové". A senior entrepreneur and energetic, she is 52 years old and a mother of five children, who are all students. She is a vendor of a variety of grocery items. She sets up her merchandise in a mini-store in her home located in a busy area, where she found out how to earn customers. She started her business with initial capital from harvesting produce. Her husband is a farmer. Later on, she benefited from a loan from the microfinance institution Hekima. She has been in this business for 25 years. 

This new loan will be used to purchase 3 sacks of wheat flour, 2 boxes of milk, 2 sacks of sugar, 2 boxes of wine, 3 boxes of juice, 5 boxes of spring water, 60 liters of oil, etc. Thus, she would like to increase her capital and provide education and food for her children. 

In conclusion, she thanks Hekima very much for promoting autonomy among small-scale entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system, especially during this difficult period post-conflict in the country's east.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, milk, sugar, wine, juice, oil, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to help Sarah purchase $4.00 kits that enable clean births for mothers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to help Ketty purchase $4.00 kits that enable clean births for mothers.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is 27-years old lady; she is the mother of three children. Her husband owns an auto workshop where he works maintaining auto vehicles. He is a skilled profession in his techniques and can easily fix vehicles within no time. He has to use various types of tools for these repairs, but recently he moved his workshop to a new location and as a result will have to replace some important and expensive tools.

Farzana has requested a loan for her husband so that her husband can work to make up for this loss. He will buy tools, spare parts, tires, break shoes, etc. for his auto vehicle repair workshop.

loans.use: to buy tools, spare parts, tires, break shoes etc. for her husband's auto vehicle repairing workshop.

loans.name: Yolanda Marisol

texts.es:
Yolanda de 30 años de edad,  no tiene un grado superior solo  logro sacar 8º grado,esta  acompañada, su compañero de vida trabaja como seguridad en un  banco, son padres de  dos hijos y asisten a  la escuela.


Yolanda trabaja de costurera y por días vende en un cafetin de la escuela, por las tardes vende pasteles debido a la necesidad económica y que sus hijos tengan una mejor vida.

 
El préstamo lo necesita para reparar el techo de su casa,el cual ya no sirve y  porque ya se aproxima el invierno,la necesidad quedara satisfecha, porque su familia tendrá mas seguridad.

El sueño de la cliente es ir poco a poco arreglando su casa,ya que le falta mucho por hacer y seguir trabajando con credicampo y ser una excelente cliente.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 30 years old. She does not have a higher education since she was only able to finish school up to the eighth grade. Yolanda is in a relationship and her life partner works as a security guard at a bank. They are the parents of two children who attend school.

Yolanda is a seamstress, but she also works at a school cafeteria during the day. In the afternoons, she sells pastries out of financial necessity so that her children can have a better life.

The loan she is requesting will be used to repair the roof of her house since it won’t be functional during the upcoming winter season. This need must be met so that her family can have a safer place to live.

Yolanda’s dream is to make gradual repairs to her house. There is so much that has to be done, so she will continue working with CrediCampo since she is an excellent client.

loans.use: to pay for repairs to the roof of her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to help Evelyn purchase $4.00 kits that enable clean births for mothers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to help Nicholas purchase $4.00 kits that enable clean births for mothers.

loans.name: Sabaly Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe    SABALY est constitué de  6 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles nucléaires  dans le village de KOKELE. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 7ème prêt. Les 6 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  condiments à l’image de SIRADIE qui est la 1ère femme debout  dans la photo de la gauche vers la droite. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, beaucoup de qualités de condiments avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The group SABALY is composed of six married women, who average 35 years of age and three children each. They live in nuclear families in the village of KOKELE. They know one another through ties of community, friendship, and commerce. To bolster their financial capacity, so as to improve their commerce, the women joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their seventh loan. The previous six loans were correctly paid back. 

This group of women does commerce in condiments, as does SIRADIE, who is the first woman standing from the left in the photo. With her loan, she intends to purchase many types of condiments from Bougouni wholesalers. She makes her sales retail to a mixed customer base paying with cash or credit at the market and at her home. She envisions making an average monthly profit of 50,000 francs CFA that will be invested in her business and used to pay back the loan.

loans.use: to purchase condiments

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito San Vicente se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.
La señora Carmen es socia fundadora del Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos para salir adelante en su negocio y mejorar su situación económica. Tiene  66 años de edad, hace varios años su esposos falleció pero de esa relación tiene 5 hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad, una hija aun viven con ella a pesar de que está casada.
Doña Carmen con la intención de ganarse algo por su cuenta y con esto poder salir adelante en el hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa donde tiene un pequeño local. Trabaja todos los días, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada quince días o al mes de acuerdo a lo que necesite. Tiene más de 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual sale adelante sin ayuda de nadie.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar ropa en especial de temporada playera. Su sueño es tener un buen local.
texts.en:
The Credit Group of San Vicente meets every fifteen days in the urban parish of Picoaza in the city of Portoviejo. The area is known for being very commercial, its traditional festivals of San Pedro and San Pablo and for the joy of its people.

Carmen is a founding member of the Credit Group and she enjoys it because of the help that the loans provide to get ahead in her business and improve her economic situation. She is 66 years old and many years ago her husband passed away. Together she and her husband had five children who are all grown up. One daughter still lives with her even though she is married.

Carmen with the intention of gaining her own income and therefore the ability to improve her household, she sells all types of clothing. She sells the clothes door to door and also from her house where she has a small shop. She works every day, allows her customers to pay with credit and collects every fifteen days. Carmen buys her merchandise in Guayaquil every fifteen or thirty days depending on her needs. She has been selling clothes for over ten years, which allows her to get ahead without the help of anybody else.

This loan will be used to buy clothes on special for the beach season. Her dream is to have a very good shop.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a 42-year-old woman residing in Taxila, Pakistan. She is the mother of three sons. Her husband is an oil seller by profession, and he has been in business selling oil for the past year. Shazia's husband is solely responsible for fulfilling the family's needs and supporting the household

Her husband wants to purchase different qualities of oil for reselling purposes, but due to insufficient financial resources he is unable to purchase the oil. Therefore Shazia has applied for a Kiva loan from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan she will provide the financial assistance to her husband so that he can enable him self to buy the oil supplies, which he will resell to earn a profitable income.

Shazia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of oil to sell.

loans.name: Kiunda

texts.fr: Le client Kiunda est un juriste/Avocat au tribunal de Grandes Instances et membre d’une organisation de la société civile, âgé de 45 ans, marié et parent de 2 élèves inscrits respectivement à école primaire et secondaire. Il a été informé de nouvelles opportunités de crédit éducation qu’offre l’IMF Hekima pour financer anticipativement les frais scolaires. Ainsi, ce nouveau prêt lui servira de payer les frais de scolarité de ses enfants élèves pour qu’ils ne soient plus exclus des cours durant toute l’année scolaire 2013-2014. Ce parent rêve un avenir meilleur pour ses enfants et les voir devenir Maitre avocat, gestionnaires parmi les cadres entreprises publiques ou para étatiques, professeurs d’université, Révérend pasteur, parlementaires, etc. Au finish, il salut grandement l’initiative spéciale de Hekima surtout de ce projet d’impact social pendant cette période de la reconstruction de l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Kiunda is a legal expert / lawyer with a District Court and he is also a member of a civil society organization.  He is 45 years old, married, and the father of two children who are currently enrolled in primary and secondary school.  Kiunda has become informed that the microfinance institution Hekima was offering education loans, therefore helping parents to pay school tuition fees in advance.  This new loan will allow Kiunda to pay his children's school fees, and will ensure that they are no longer expelled from school for the rest of the 2013-2014 school year.

As a parent, Kiunda's dream is to offer a better future to his children.  He would love to see them become lawyers, managers of public or para-governmental companies, university professors, ministers of religion, members of parliament etc.  He thanks Hekima for this special initiative and particularly for this project, which will have a positive social impact during this time of rebuilding of the Eastern part of the country.

loans.use: to pay his children's school fees.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Teresita works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell used clothing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a manicure and pedicure service. Teresita is borrowing PHP 7000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock of used clothing to sell for her buy-and-sell used clothing business.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of used clothing to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to help Stephen purchase $4.00 kits that enable clean births for mothers.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Nusrat is a 35-year-old married woman. She is a mother of four children. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Three years ago her husband started his own business of selling welding materials. 

Nusrat is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. He will use the loan amount to increase his supply of welding products,  including iron rods, iron sheets, soldering rods and welding rods. This will enable him to respond quickly to customer needs. He plans to expand his business with the additional income he earns. Nusrat hopes that this loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy welding products including iron rods, iron sheets, soldering rods and welding rods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn by the 100 kilograms

loans.name: Atilio

texts.es: Atilio de 55 años de edad trabaja como auxiliar de albañilería, él solo se vale para salir adelante, no tiene hijos ni nadie que lo atienda. Atilio quiere mejorar la vivienda que su madre le heredó. Desea comprar ladrillo cerámico para cubrir 30 metros cuadrado de piso (área que tiene su vivienda). Por lo anterior Atilio ha solicitado un crédito a FUSAI para comprar toda la cerámica, cemento, arena y pagar la mano de obra. Atilio es muy conocido por ser una persona muy humilde y cumplir con todos sus compromisos.
texts.en: Atilo is 55 years old and works as an assistant mason. He just wants to get ahead.  He does not have any children nor does he have to take care of anyone. Atilo wants to improve the home left to him by his mother. He wants to buy ceramic bricks to cover 30 square meters of floor space ( the area where he has his home). Antilo requested a loan from FUSAI in order to purchase the bricks, cement, sand and to pay the laborers. Atilo is well known for being a very humble person and he will fulfill all his obligations.

loans.use: purchase and install 30 square meters of flooring

loans.name: Jandry Junior

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito San Vicente se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.
En este lugar vive el señor Jandry, tiene 19 años de edad, mantienen una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de 2  años de edad, la mujer es ama de casa.
Don Jandry es un joven muy trabajador que le gusta a base de su esfuerzo salir adelante y con esto  darles a su familia lo mejor, el se dedica al comercio,  los fines de semana y feriados él se desplaza a ciertos cantones en los cuales se dedica a vender una gran variedad de productos, vende ropa interior, medias, camisetas y ropa de temporada, actualmente espera este crédito para ir a Guayaquil y comprar mercadería para luego llevarla a  vender a sus clientes, el lleva 3 años dedicado a esta actividad.
Este crédito es para compra ropa interior, camisetas, medias, entre otras prendas. Lleva más de 1 año  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos se financia su negocio. Sus sueños son tener su casa propia ya que donde vive es arrendado.
texts.en:
The San Vicente Loan Group meets every 15 days at the Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo. This place is known for being in a very commercial zone and for its traditional festivals of San Pedro and San Pablo and for the happiness of its people.
Jandry lives here. He is 19 years old. He is in a common law marriage in which he has a two-year-old son. His partner is a housewife.
Jandry is a very hardworking youth that likes to get ahead in life based on his efforts and with this give the best to his family. He is a merchant for a living. Weekends and holidays he goes to certain towns where he sells a great variety of products. He sells underwear, tights, shirts and seasonal clothing. Today he hopes for a loan to go to Guayaquil to buy merchandise to later bring to sell to his customers. He has been doing this work for 3 years.
This loan is to purchase underwear, shirts, and tight among other articles. He has been in the Loan Group more than a year and likes it because with these loans his business is financed. His dreams are to have his own house as where he lives is rented.

loans.use: to buy underwear, shirts, tights and other garments.

loans.name: Super Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe SUPER est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 39 ans, et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Nala II, commune de Falako, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréale, de condiment, de la patate, de l’habillement, et de henné. Les femmes du groupe SUPER sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente DJELIKA la deuxième personne à partir de la droite dans le rang debout est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de condiment. Elle compte acheter 1 sac d’oignon, 1 sac de feuille d’oignon, 1 sachet de pate romane, 4 kg de poivron et 1 kg de de poudre de gombo chez les grossistes à Fana. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle, à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 10 000Fcfa, qui sera injecté dans l’élevage de chèvres.
texts.en:
Group Super is made up of married women. They are on average 39 years old with four children. They all live in traditional families in the village of Nala II, Falako township, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They met through kinship relations, neighbors and friends. They trade in cereals, condiment, potatoes, clothing, and henna. This is the second solidarity loan for the women of group Super. To meet huge demand from their clients, they are turning to Soro Yiriwaso.

The amount will be used to purchase the aforementioned merchandise.

Our customer Djelika, the second person from the right in the standing row, is illiterate. She currently retails condiments. She is planning to purchase one bag of onions, one bag of onion leaves, one pouch of flavoring, four kilos of bell peppers, and one kilo of okra powder from wholesalers in Fana. She retails from home to a mixed-gender clientele, and takes cash. She is forecasting a monthly profit of 10,000 XOF, which will be invested in raising goats.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 48 years old and has eight children. She is married and three of her children are in school. She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines, and requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional feed.
