Virginia has been pig fattening for twp years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Virginia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional feed.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida works hard to support her family. Zenaida is married and has a buy and sell coconut wine business in the Philippines. 

She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional gallons of coconut wine to sell. Zenaida has been in this business for five years now. In the future, Zenaida would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional gallons of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 43 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as snack foods, sugar, soap, noodles, shampoo, canned goods, and other groceries.

Vilma has borrowed and paid back 12 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice.

Vilma aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as snack foods, sugar, soap, noodles, shampoo, canned goods, and other groceries

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila is 55 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Lucila is borrowing 14,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase rice seeds and pay for laborers' salaries for the preparation of her land.

Lucila has been farming rice for 12 years and also earns additional income from making nipa roofing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds and pay for laborers' salaries for land preparation

loans.name: Jai Karnataka Group

texts.en:
Renuka, 28, is married with two children. She lives with her husband and children who study in a local school in their village. She studied up to seventh grade and her husband owns a small piece of land measuring less than one acre. She & her husband work as farm laborers in horticulture fields and earns 125 Indian Rupees (INR) per day. She is the member of Jai Karnataka Joint Liability (JLG) along with 4 other women.

Renuka (the lady with the raised hand in the picture) and other group members have started their own micro enterprise of rearing goats & sheep. Three of her other group members don't have any land at all. Sheep & goat rearing is a lucrative business in the area.

Renuka is an active woman who always raises concerns over social issues haunting women in rural areas. She is instrumental in organizing a dairy producers' cooperative in the village which is managed by women members.

Renuka needs a loan to expand her livestock activities to increase her income.

The group wants to expand the activity of lamb rearing to widen their existing livelihood portfolio so that they generate additional income to meet education and reinvestment needs. The profits they generate are intended for increasing their herd size from the existing 1-2 goats. They also intend to own a buffalo and engage as milk producers.

loans.use: To buy lambs for rearing

loans.name: Greens Mahalakshmi Group

texts.en:
Paddavva is just 22 years old, married and has two children. She is the lady with the raised hand in the picture. Paddavva's husband is an agricultural laborer who lost his job when his village was submerged in the waters of the Upper Krishna Irrigation project. They had to relocate to a small hamlet in Mallapur, Bagalkot, North Karnataka. The village had little agricultural land, reducing the chances of regular income further for the family. Nearly a year back Paddavva joined an all women Joint Liability Group (JLG), Mahalakshmi.

The local field partner Future Greens, which trains economically backward people in allied agricultural practices, trained her along with four other women in goat and sheep rearing. The NGO also gave Paddavva insurance coverage for the animals. Her husband has taken a job as a construction worker at his new place and earns 250 Indian Rupees (INR) per day. But the family still lives in a rented cottage. The other members of the group share more or less the same story.

Greens Mahalakshmi has started its buffalo and goat rearing business and are doing well. Paddavva and other members seek a loan to buy more cattle and create a steady income generation model for their families. The group was inspired by the success of other such groups working in the neighborhood. Lending now will bring more financial security for Paddavva and other group members.

loans.use: To buy lambs for rearing

loans.name: Tejaswini - Thugunosi Group

texts.en:
Savitri is a 28-year-old woman who lives in Thoogunasi, Bagalkot, Karnataka, India. She is illiterate and a widow.

She started sheep & goat rearing recently. Savitri is a very confident woman despite being a widow. Her ambition is to expand the sheep rearing activity and that is the reason she is seeking a loan. With this expansion Savitri is expecting a boost in her earnings so that she can secure her future.

All the 5 members of Tejaswini – Thugunosi, which is an activity based Joint Liability Group (JLG), have been trained in all aspects of sheep rearing by the Future Greens Samsthe which is a local NGO.

The other 4 members of her group are Shobha, Renavva, Magundavva, and Hanumavva. They all want loans for the same purpose and are working in the agricultural fields as daily wage workers.

loans.use: To buy lambs for rearing.

loans.name: Mahalakshmi Group

texts.en:
Gangamma (the lady with her hand raised in the picture) lives in Thougunasi, Bagalkot, Karnataka. She heads a five member group of women, who have united to set up their own micro-enterprise unit.

Gangamma is an independent woman with two children who are studying. She owns a small house. She has started rearing goats and sheep recently. She also works as a farm laborer in her village whenever there is work available. Gangamma is a hardworking woman who has dedicated her life to the better future of her children. She needs a steady income to secure the future of her children.

She has joined the activity based Joint Liability Group (JLG) Mahalakshmi. The local NGO (Future Greens Samasthe) has trained her in bookkeeping and also gave her training on all aspects of goat & sheep rearing.

Gangamma seeks a loan to purchase additional stock of sheep and goats. The four other members of her group are: Shashikala, Nagavva, Prema, and Kasthuravva.

loans.use: To buy lambs for rearing.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is 40 years old and the mother of six children living in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a general store in which he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, biscuits etc. He manages the household necessities from his store as well. Some of his relatives like to purchase from his general store. He speaks in a monotonous tone, which is impressive and he easily wins the trust of others. Due to his behavior and tone, he has built a very good relationship with his customers. His general store is very famous in the town, which is the reason his business is running well. 

Due to his good relationships, his sales have increased a lot but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand. Therefore, Kousar requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy more stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits, etc. She hopes that her husband will use the loan in a positive way. The loan will help him to cope with the demand. 

She thanks to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, and biscuits to sell

loans.name: Greens Bhagya Lakshmi Group

texts.en:
Shantavva is 33 years old and has three children. Her husband migrates to town for six months to work as a construction laborer as their village, Togunasi in North Karnataka, comes in a dry belt and people have very little to do in farms. To change the economic condition of their families most women in the village have created Joint Liability Groups (JLG) which are activity based and are practicing various allied agricultural activities for additional income.

Shantavva (the lady with the raised hand in the picture) is part of Greens Bhagya Lakshmi JLG. She and four other members of her group have setup a sheep and goat rearing micro enterprise. Shantavva's business gives her an additional income apart from her laborer job in farms where on a work day she earns 120 Indian Rupees (INR). The economic insecurity has made one of her sons to drop out of school and join his father as a construction worker. She wants to keep her other two children in school and for that Shantavva needs to expand her business.

Shantavva now seeks a loan to purchase six more sheep and push her rearing business to a stronger production stage. The other members of the group also want to have more sheep so that their annual production of the cattle increase, which will bring more profits. All other group members want to buy at least 3 lambs each. Each has potential to earn 18,000 INR within a cycle of seven months.

loans.use: To buy lambs for rearing.

loans.name: Greens Shivalingeshwara Group

texts.en:
The villages of North Karnataka in Bagalkot always face shortages of water. The government has constructed many dams in the past and many more are coming. But the cost of these dams sometimes is not just economic, but emotional as well. The construction of Upper Krishna Irrigation project has forced nearly 146 villages to relocate.

One of the families which lost all their agriculture land to bulging waters was of Vatsala (the lady with the raised hand in the picture). Her family still lives on the small hills of Salagundi, but they find it extremely difficult to survive. The government has given them a piece of land, but the new village is 26 kilometers from Salagundi.

The only way they can live at their ancestral home is to completely shift to a sheep rearing business. They have some livestock, but to be back on their feet, the family needs more sheep.

Vatsala now requires a loan to buy at least 6 lambs. She is confident that with training and better medical practices she has learned from a local NGO, her business will be a success. She is also intending to use her profits to construct a new house.

The group – Shivalingeshwara Joint Liability Group (JLG) has 4 other such entrepreneurial women who come from the displaced area. The group needs a total of 125,000 Indian Rupees (INR) in loans.

loans.use: To buy lambs for rearing.

loans.name: M. Mushtaq

texts.en:
M. Mushtaq is a 36-year-old man living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan with his family. He works hard to provide better living standards to his family by selling gift baskets and decoration pieces. He purchases all gifts and decoration pieces from the market and then sells them to the general public. He makes most of his sales during festivals, occasions and ceremonies. He has become famous by providing good quality gifts and has retained many customers. 

This is M. Mushtag's second loan with Kiva, and he had a good experience with the last loan. He utilized the previous loan to buy gift baskets and decoration pieces, but this time he wants to buy mobile accessories in order to go with the trend. For further improvement of his business, he has requested a Kiva loan through BRAC Pakistan to buy mobile accessories and additional gift baskets. He is very experienced in his business and is confident that his business will move in a positive direction as a result of the loan investment. This time he has good hopes for support from lenders again and depends on lenders' cooperation. He is very thankful to Kiva’s field partner’s BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy mobile accessories and additional gift baskets.

loans.name: Lakshmi Devi - Honnakatti Group

texts.en:
Mahadevi (the lady with the raised hand in the photo) aged 34 years, lives in Honnakatti, Bagalkot, Karnataka. She has done her schooling till second grade. She is married and a mother of a daughter and two sons. Her husband is a farmer. She works as a daily wage labor in the agriculture fields nearby and earns 50 Indian Rupees (INR) per day.

Mahadevi is a very hard working woman and has formed a Joint Liability Group (JLG), along with 4 other ladies by the name Lakshmi Devi – Honnakatti with the intent to start sheep & goat rearing. Sheep farming is a lucrative business in the area as it is abundant with year-round green forage.

Mahadevi wants to improve her family income by rearing sheep, for which she seeks a loan. She hopes that this loan will help her family to be financially stable, give a good education to her children, and build a new house.

The group wants to add in activities like lamb rearing to widen their existing livelihood portfolio. The profits they generate are intended for increasing the herd size from the existing 1-2 goats. They also intend to own a buffalo and engage in milk production.

loans.use: To buy lambs for rearing.

loans.name: Shri Banasankari - Nandikeshwar Group

texts.en:
Madevi (the lady with her hand raised in the picture) is the leader of this group. She is 32 years old and lives in Nandikeswar, Bagalkot, Karnataka. She is married and has two sons who are in 6th and 11th grades. Madevi and her husband are both daily wage workers in agriculture fields and Madevi earns 100 Indian Rupees (INR) per day. She has dairy farm too.

Madevi is an active woman and a leader in her community. She wants a loan to purchase sheep and goats. This loan will allow her to expand her farm and helps her to bring more stability for her family. She wants to save enough to send her children to a better school and educate them.

The Joint Liability Group (JLG) "Shri Banashankari" is associated with Future Greens Samsthe which is local NGO. This group consists of 5 members all engaged in rearing of sheep & goats.

loans.use: To buy lambs for rearing.

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en: Nargis was born in 1981, and she is married with four children. She is a sewer, and has been busy in this service business for more than four years. She sews national dresses, European-style dresses and bathrobes. She sews in her house. Nargis is going to develop her business and in order to do this, she is asking for a loan of 5,000 Tajikistan Somoni to buy fabrics, needles, threads and buttons. She awaits your support, as this loan will help her to develop her business and maximize profit.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, needles, threads and buttons.

loans.name: Kumry

texts.en: Kumry is a hardworking woman. She is widowed and has three children. Kumry needs to earn money. That’s why she is going to organize her own business. She wants to organize a sewing business. She is a sewer and wants to open her own workshop. Now her son is the only provider for the family and that’s why they live poorly. Kumry’s children will help her to manage the business. She took part in a course called ‘To Get Ahead’ from a women's organization and earned a certificate. She is asking for a loan of 1,500 USD to buy a sewing machine, fabrics, threads and needles. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine, fabric, threads and needles

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is married with an only child who helps her husband operate their repair shop to make a living. After many years of running this business, they have been able to sustain and improve their services. Her income from this business is used for their daily expenses and her child's education. To improve the services, their shop should have a stock of multi-purpose spare parts and machine oil to be used for repair services. To comply with this,  she took a loan from GDMPC micro credit, which she had joined recently. In the future, she wants to own a car for their personal use and to extend their service by visiting clients at home for on-call services.

loans.use: to buy additional spare parts and oil used for repair services

loans.name: Oysha

texts.en:
Oysha is a smart and kind woman. She is widowed and has six children, two of whom are not adults. Oysha lives poorly because she is the main source of food for her children after the death of her husband. She has been busy with growing tomatoes, maize, potatoes and wheat. She has rented land. Her son helps her manage the business. Her income is small and that’s why she lives poorly. 

She is going to sow a new crop of vegetables but she does not have the money to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. She is asking for a loan of 3,000 TJS to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Mariyam

texts.en:
Mariyam is 42 years old, married, and the mother of six children. Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses. However, now, the rickshaw requires proper maintenance to keep it functional. 

For this, Mariyam has applied for a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan. Her husband wants to buy new tires for his vehicle. Mariyam is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business. Mariyam is thankful to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new tires for her husband's auto rickshaw

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en: Maribel is 39 years old, married and is raising seven children together with her husband. She has a secondary education. To provide the primary income for her family, she raises hogs. She started this work nine years ago with a purchase of pigs for 2,000 PHP. Thanks to Maribel's hard work, today her business has three heads of pigs. In order to further develop her business, she requested a loan from ASKI to buy two heads in order to increase her hog-raising business headcount. Maribel plans to invest earnings from the loan in further increasing her domestic livestock quantity and saving money for her children's continued education.

loans.use: to buy two heads of pigs in order to increase her hog-raising business headcount.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en: Loreta is a diligent mother who runs a small variety store in the local community, selling grocery items, snack foods and offering coffee to her customers. She is 45 years old and widowed. Due to living hardships, she aims to make her business profitable in order to earn sufficient income and meet her family's daily necessities. Having inadequate capital, she is requesting for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy sugar, salt, cooking oil, coffee, laundry soap, noodles, soft drinks, mineral water and eggs to sell in her store. She is hoping that her loan will enable her to improve the business someday.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, cooking oil, coffee, laundry soap, noodles, soft drinks, mineral water, and eggs to sell.

loans.name: Julissa Cristela

texts.es: Julissa de 24 es madre solera, ella tiene una hija de 3 años de edad. Julissa y su pequeña hija viven en casa de su madre. Julissa está decidida en sacar adelante a su pequeña hija, trabaja desde muy temprano en un comedor cerca de su domicilio, su madre le ayuda a cuidar a su hija. Julissa desea comprar e instalar puertas y ventanas en la vivienda de su madre para mayor privacidad y seguridad; por lo anterior ha solicitado a FUSAI un crédito que le permita comprar las puertas metálicas y ventanas además de pagar la mano de obra.
texts.en:
Julissa, 24, is a single mother with a 3 year-old daughter.  Julissa and her little daughter live in her mother's house.  Julissa is determined to provide for her small daughter.  She works starting very early in the morning at an eatery that is close to her house.  Her mother helps her to care for her daughter.  

Julissa wants to buy and install doors and windows in her mother's house for greater privacy and security.  To do this, she has requested a loan from FUSAI to buy metal doors and windows and to pay for labor.

loans.use: to buy doors and windows and to pay for labor

loans.name: Esmeralda Nahuala Group

texts.es:
Nahualá is one of the rural municipalities of Sololá in the highlands of Guatemala. Approximately 93% of the population lives in the outskirts of the small populated town. The vast majority of the population speaks a Mayan dialect, Kiche, as their first language and to a lesser degree, Spanish. Most of the women have had no formal education. They mostly work in the production of handicrafts and textiles.

The new Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Esmeraldas Nahualá” is composed of seven women who live in this area. They are requesting loans in order to leave poverty behind and step into a more prosperous and educated future. This will be their very first opportunity to secure a loan from Friendship Bridge and start, sustain or grow their small businesses.

The President of the Trust Bank is 46 year old Juana who is the mother of eight children and has no education. She is married. Juana creates beautiful traditional textiles called “huipiles” and in addition, buys and sells used clothing. Her business is doing well but Juana wants to invest more capital in her business and is requesting a loan from Friendship Bridge. She will use the funds to purchase different types of yarn and other materials with the goal of improving the quality of her huipiles. 

The seven ladies of the Trust Bank “Esmeraldas Nahualá” are most anxious to start their very first loan cycle with Friendship Bridge. They have been preparing for this moment by participating in the non-formal educational trainings offered at their monthly meetings by a Friendship Bridge loan officer. Topics covered include budgeting and accounting practices, effective business management, women’s rights and self-esteem, as well as nutrition and health. 

Doña Juana and the ladies in the Trust Bank appreciate the confidence and generosity of KIVA investors. The combination of capital in the form of microloans and education will help them empower themselves and face a brighter and more prosperous future. They will share their empowerment and success with their families and their rural municipality of Nahualá
texts.en:
Nahualá is one of the rural municipalities of Sololá in the highlands of Guatemala. Approximately 93% of the population lives in the outskirts of the small populated town. The vast majority of the population speaks a Mayan dialect, Kiche, as their first language and to a lesser degree, Spanish. Most of the women have had no formal education. They mostly work in the production of handicrafts and textiles.

The new Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Esmeraldas Nahualá” is composed of seven women who live in this area. They are requesting loans in order to leave poverty behind and step into a more prosperous and educated future. This will be their very first opportunity to secure a loan from Friendship Bridge and start, sustain or grow their small businesses.

The President of the Trust Bank is 46 year old Juana who is the mother of eight children and has no education. She is married. Juana creates beautiful traditional textiles called “huipiles” and in addition, buys and sells used clothing. Her business is doing well, but Juana wants to invest more capital in her business and is requesting a loan from Friendship Bridge. She will use the funds to purchase different types of yarn and other materials with the goal of improving the quality of her huipiles. 

The seven ladies of the Trust Bank “Esmeraldas Nahualá” are most anxious to start their very first loan cycle with Friendship Bridge. They have been preparing for this moment by participating in the non-formal educational training offered at their monthly meetings by a Friendship Bridge loan officer. Topics covered include budgeting and accounting practices, effective business management, women’s rights and self-esteem, as well as nutrition and health. 

Doña Juana and the ladies in the Trust Bank appreciate the confidence and generosity of KIVA investors. The combination of capital in the form of microloans and education will help them empower themselves and face a brighter and more prosperous future. They will share their empowerment and success with their families and their rural municipality of Nahualá

loans.use: To purchase different types of yarn to make textiles

loans.name: Phy

texts.en:
Phy, a resident from Kampong Thom province, is 58 years old and a widowed woman. She has three children, two of whom are her burdens. She raises her family by farming rice and cassava in her village and selling at the local markets seasonally. Farming is her important source of income. She has been a farmer for almost 14 years. 

This is the first loan for Phy with Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), a long-standing Kiva partner. She will spend her entire loan to fix her plowing machine, which is broken and is unable to be used now. She hopes to have a better harvest and yield so she will be able to improve her current living conditions.

loans.use: to fix her plowing machine.

loans.name: Khurram Abbas

texts.en:
Khurram Abbas is taking a loan to buy cosmetic products such as facial cream, face powder, lipstick, and nail polish as well as artificial jewelry. He is 29 years old, married and living with his family in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He recently started this business and he is hoping for the warm support of the Kiva lenders because his financial progress depends upon the loan. His shop is situated near many parlors where ladies demand beauty products and jewelry. This is the reason his stock sells out quickly and he has to refuse his worthy customers.
 
Therefore, Khurram Abbas has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan to buy new cosmetics products such as facial cream, bleach cream, nail polish, hair color, lotions and jewelry.

Khurram Abbas feels proud when someone appreciates his efforts and devotions regarding his new business.  He thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy beauty products and artificial jewelry for resale.

loans.name: Segundo Pedro

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 37 años de edad, de estado civil casado, vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos de 14, 5 y 5, en la comunidad Manzana pamba perteneciente al cantón Guaranda, Provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la ventanilla Manzana pamba está formada por 10 socios que son de la misma comunidad los cuales se dedican a la agricultura, se encuentra ubicada a 30 minutos de la oficina operativa Guaranda.
Segundo es agricultor, se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado. Solicita el crédito para compra de ganado, para aumentar la producción de leche. La compra la realiza en Guaranda cada semana, y la venta de leche cada semana. Su meta es aumentar el ganado. Su desafío es la crisis económica. En su tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte, la costumbre que más le gusta es el carnaval.
texts.en:
Segundo is 37 years old, married, and lives with his wife and three children, ages 14, 5, and 5 in the Manzana Pampa Community, within the Guaranda settlement of the Bolivar province.

He is a member of the Manzana Pampa group, made up of 10 members from the same community, located 30 min from the Guaranda office.  They are farmers.

Segundo is a farmer who buys and sells livestock.  He is asking for this loan to buy livestock to increase his milk production.  He makes his purchases in Guaranda each week and sells his milk each week.  His goal is to increase his amount of livestock.  His challenge is the economic crisis.  He likes to play sports in his spare time and his favorite tradition is carnival.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 42 years old and chose to be single. She lives in a rural community where she runs a small variety store. She dreams of improving the business and make it profitable in order to support her parents and save for her future. To work out her plan, she is asking for a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy more stocks of soft drinks, noodles, laundry soaps, assorted candies, snack foods and seasonings to sell in her store. She believes that someday, she will become successful and financially stable as she continue to work hard and strive for it.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, noodles, laundry soaps, assorted candies, snack foods and seasonings to sell

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en: Shaheen is 36 years old. She is a housewife and looks after her family, which consists of five persons. She is well trained in stitching cloth. She provides stitching services to people at her house. She needs to purchase a sewing machine and a variety of stitching materials including threads, needles, cloth etc. This is very important for her to continue her work efficiently and professionally. However, due to the lack of money, she finds it difficult. So Shaheen is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. BRAC Pakistan issued her the loan that she requested. Shaheen is very thankful to Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and other materials.

loans.name: Motaz

texts.en:
Motaz is a 23-year-old single man from a small village near Nablus City, named Tubas. He opened a small store that sells toys and gifts. It is a good business and the only source of income for the family.

Motaz borrowed a loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more toys and gifts to resell. By taking this loan, Motaz will be able to improve his store and increase sales. Motaz appears in the photo in his toy store.

loans.use: to buy more toys and gifts to resell.

loans.name: Vilma Victoria

texts.es: Vilma de 43 años de edad es una mujer muy trabajadora, ella tiene un pequeño negocio de ropa y calzado en un mercado del municipio en donde vive. María tiene 18 años de estar viviendo en casa propia junto a su esposo y su hija de 16 años. Ella desea comprar e instalar 2 puertas y una ventana para su vivienda, ademas quiere hacer una división en una habitación. Vilma no dispone de todo el dinero que esta obra requiere, por lo que ha solicitado a FUSAI un crédito que le permita hacer la mejora. Vilma está consiente del compromiso que este crédito implica por lo que se compromete a pagar todas las cuotas y posteriormente solicitar otros créditos para invertir más en su vivienda.
texts.en: Vilma, 43, is a hardworking woman.  She has a small business selling clothing and shoes in a market in the town where she lives.  Maria has been living in her own house with her husband for 18 years, and she also lives with her 16 year-old daughter.  She wants to buy and install 2 doors and a window in her house, and she also wants to make a dividing wall in a room.  Vilma does not have the money available that this work requires, and so she has requested a loan from FUSAI to make the improvements.  Vilma is aware of the obligation that she is taking on with this loan, and she promises to make all of her payments.  Later, she will take other loans to make more investments in her house.

loans.use: to buy 2 doors, a window, and to build a dividing wall in a room

loans.name: Pedro Jose

texts.es:
Pedro de 56 años de edad, casado con dos hijos menores de edad, es originario de  Leon, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país, EL se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable con ganas de superación personal, en sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de la compañía de sus hijos. En la actualidad lucha día a día para brindarles estabilidad económica, emocional a a sus hijos y formarlos en persona de bien, lograra sus sueños como verlo convertido en profesionales.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de medicamentos éticos y genéricos como acetaminofen, panadol, tabcin, glibenclamida, loratadina, talerdin, renikan, corilin, kidi, medoc, acido mefenamico. El dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo su producto de forma ambulante en las diferentes farmacias y pulpería de la localidad. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  Pedro agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Pedro is 56-years old, married and has two young children.  He is a native of Leon, an area in the west of the country.  Pedro is known for being hard-working, responsible and having a desire for self-improvement.  In his free time, he enjoys his children's company.  Pedro currently works day after day to offer his children some financial and emotional stability and to help them become good people.  His dream will be realized once he sees his children with professional careers. 
Thanks to his efforts and his desire to get ahead, Pedro has a business selling brand-name and generic medications such as: acetaminophen, Panadol, Tabcin, Glibenclamide, Loratadine, Talerdin, Renikan, Corilin, kidi, medoc and mefenamic acid.  He works about ten hours a day traveling around to sell his products to the different pharmacies and general stores in his neighborhood.  The goal of this loan is to invest in working capital and stock up his business so that, in the not too distant future, he can earn more income.  Pedro is grateful for the help of the Kiva lenders, who offer low-income people and poor countries, like Nicaragua, the chance for a dignified means of work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital to stock up his medication business with: acetaminophen, Panadol, tabcin, Glibenclamide, Loratadine, Talerdin, Renikan, Corilin, kidi, medoc and mefenamic acid.

loans.name: Kathleen

texts.en: Kathleen is one step further on her journey, as she will graduate this month.   Her parents and siblings will be very proud.  Before, it was her great ambition.  But the support of the GDMPC educational loan made it a reality.  She is now ready to face another challenge on her journey, namely to cover graduation fees.  To do so, she took out a new loan from GDMPC.  In the future she wants to become successful.

loans.use: to cover graduation fees.

loans.name: Robilyn

texts.en:
Robilyn is 29 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 35,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Robilyn has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and earns additional income from raising livestock.

Robilyn aspires to save money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Shams-Ul-Zaman

texts.en:
Shams-Ul-Zaman is a 57-year-old married man living with his family in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He is the father of six children. Some of his children are in high school and one is looking for a suitable job.

He buys various kinds of dishwashing powder, soap and liquid from wholesalers and sells at retail from his shop. He buys small pieces of dish soap to sell at very low prices as well. He works hard and honestly to earn better to support his family. Shams-Ul-Zaman wants to take a loan to get more stock on a daily basis related to dish washing. In this way, he can generate additional income and cherish his entire family in a good manner. This is his first loan with Kiva and he has great expectations for the honorable lenders.
 
Shams-Ul-Zaman is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy dish washing soap and liquid for resale.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 24-year-old single man from Bedia, a small village near Nablus city. He lives with his parents in a small, simple house. Three years ago, Mohammad opened a small store for selling clothes and shoes for men. This is the only source of income for the family.

Mohammad borrowed a loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more products for his store. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to increase his sales and income. Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes to resell.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en: Mila is 40 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for six years and earns additional income from food vending. Mila is borrowing PHP 12,000 to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward attaining her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Edwina

texts.en: Edwina is a widowed woman, and she has two children. She describes herself to be optimistic. She operates a retail business where she sells sandals, and she has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a vibrant location and her primary customers are of all types. Edwina describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital, and she will use this 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of sandals. Her business goal is to own a boutique within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sandals.

loans.name: Cindy

texts.en: Cindy is 23 years old.  She is married with one child, who is in school.  Cindy is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines.  She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.  Cindy has been raising pigs for two years.  In the future, Cindy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Stewart

texts.en:
Meet Stewart, a productive farmer living in the Nayamira area of Anayanza Akaenya with his wife and three children, two of whom are of school-going age. In farming, he loves cattle raising the most. His primary source of income comes from the sale of tea, milk and eggs. His biggest challenge is picking tea.

Stewart chose Juhudi Kilimo because their loan requirements are friendly and they are always timely. During the training, he learned proper loan use and repayment. This loan will help him get more poultry, which will increase his income base, secure a bright future for his children and enable him to take care of his family's needs comfortably.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Jeana

texts.en:
Jeana is 49 years old, married and has six children, one of whom is in school. 

Jeana is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines, and she requested a 9,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain her work.

In the future, Jeana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new hair cutting tools and redecorate his shop

loans.name: Maria Morena

texts.es: María de 39 años de edad, su esposo y su hijo de 7 años de edad viven en casa propia desde hace 22 años. María se dedica al cuido de su hijo pero con el afán de aportar al hogar se ha dedicado desde hace 7 años a comercializar productos de catálogo, como productos de belleza, fantasía y enchapes en joyas. María a visto la necesidad de hacer ciertas mejoras a su vivienda, ella quiere cambiar algunas láminas del techo de su vivienda ya que están quebradas. María ha solicitado un crédito a FUSAI para comprar lámina de fibrocemento, pines, pernos, polines y pagar la mano de obra. El invierno se aproxima y no desea pasar angustias por los daños que podría generarse.
texts.en: Maria (39 years old), her husband, and her 7 year old son live in their own house, which Maria and her husband have had for the past 22 years.  Maria is dedicated to caring for her son but in an effort to support her home, she has spent the last 7 years marketing catalog products such as beauty items and costume jewelry. Maria, having seen the need to make some improvements to her home, wants to change some sheets from the ceiling of her home because they are broken.  Maria has requested a loan from FUSAI in order to buy fiber cement sheets, pins, bolts, polin, and to pay for labor.  Winter is approaching and she does not want to worry about the damage that can occur.

loans.use: to buy fiber cement sheets, pins, bolts, polin, and to pay for labor in order to repair the roof of her housing.

loans.name: Roobie Rouze

texts.en: Roobie Rouze is on her way to her graduation day. Becoming an IT graduate is now at hand for Roobie Rouze. But aside from her tuition fees and other charges in the previous semester, she had to accept that there's still another payment needed. She still needs to cover graduation fees and thesis expenses.  She is thankful to GDMPC for helping students to pursue ambitions for a better future. She wants to become successful in the future.

loans.use: to cover graduation fees and thesis expenses

loans.name: Buena

texts.en:
This is Buena, 45, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite Philippines. She is married to Marcelo, a driver and the father to their children. She and her husband manage their own household. At this time she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Buena oversees and owns operations of their Tricycle transportation business. They have one tricycle that carries up to four passengers to their destinations within the community. The tricycle driver then remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to her. In her business the regular customers are the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 every day.

 To help her continue operations of her business she is requesting a Php 30, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts, accessories and for the maintenance of their motorcycle.

Buena hopes to be successful in business and dreams to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their Tricycle unit.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is 61 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

Ofelia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell. Ofelia has been in this business for eleven years and has previously received funds through Kiva. Ofelia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Monic

texts.en: Monic is a 29-year-old married woman with three school-going children.  She lives in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in the clothing business on a busy street for five years. She started her business for self-employment and to look after her family.  She hopes to expand her business into a well-stocked boutique in her town, where she can earn more income. However, she is challenged with limited capital. Monic is an honest woman who is requesting clothes to resell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en: Abida is a 25-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible housewife. Currently, Abida owns a dairy farm at her home, and she produces milk with the help of her husband. A few days ago, one of her cattle was stolen due to lack of security. There is no proper shelter for her cattle, which needs to be improved. Abida wants to buy a buffalo and maintain the cowshed, but she has insufficient savings. Therefore, Abida requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she could overcome these deficiencies and carry on her business smoothly. With the profits, Abida will ensure the security of her cattle and build up the cattle's shelter, so that she could avoid theft in the future. Abida is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo and maintain the cowshed on her dairy farm.

loans.name: Nathan

texts.en: Nathan is a 44-year-old married man with four children, two of whom attend school. He has been in the retail business for seven years while participating in timber and farming businesses for additional income. He started his business for self sustainability and for educating his children.  He hopes to expand his business and to educate his children.   Debtors and high transportation costs affect his business.  Nathan is a hardworking man who intends to use the loan to buy books to resell.

loans.use: to buy books to sell in his shop.

loans.name: Eljun

texts.en:
Eljun is a hardworking 21 year old man. He was  studying in a university taking a BS (Business Administration) degree. 

Eljun has four siblings and he is  someone who is very dedicated to his studies and love of family. His father worked as a laborer and his mother as a housekeeper.

He is requesting this loan to pay for a school project needed for final requirements. His goal is to fine a better job and encourage his siblings to continue to study to become successful in the future.

loans.use: for school project needed for final requirements

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es: Samuel de 49 años de edad es casado, tienen dos hijos de 14 y 15 años de edad. Su esposa se dedica al cuido de sus hijos y el quehacer del hogar. Samuel se dedica al transporte de carga y personas, él tiene un pickup que en el lugar en donde habita es un medio de transporte muy común. Samuel desea realizar unas mejoras a su vivienda, pero no tiene todo el dinero que la obra requiere, por lo anterior solicitó a FUSAI un crédito y con el dinero hacer un corredor en su vivienda y construir una pila para almacenar agua potable. Él sabe que esta inversión le será de mucho bien para toda su familia.
texts.en: Samuel, 49 years old, is married and has two children that are 14 and 15 years old.  His wife is dedicated to caring for their children and the domestic responsibilities of the home.  Samuel is dedicated to the transport of both freight and people - he has a pickup truck, and where he lives, this is a very common form of transport.  Samuel wants to make some improvements to his home but he does not have all the money that the work would require and due to this, he requested a loan from FUSAI.  With the money, he will make a corridor in his home and construct a water basin to store drinking water.  He knows that this investment will help his family immensely.

loans.use: to construct a corridor in his home and a concrete basin to store drinking water.

loans.name: Yousef

texts.en:
Yousef is a 45-year-old married man from Gaza city. He lives with his wife, two sons and one daughter in a small, simple house. Yousef works as an employee in the public sector with a low income, which barely covers all the family needs. Two years ago, Yousef opened a small barber shop. It is a good business and supports part of the family expenses. Yousef would like to renew his barber shop.

Yousef took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy new hair-cutting tools and other machines and to make new decorations for his barber shop. By taking this loan, Yousef will be able to improve his business and attract more customers. This will increase his income and improve his family's living conditions. Yousef appears in this photo in his barber shop.

loans.use: to buy new hair-cutting tools and other machines, and to make new decorations for his barber shop.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 53 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like soap, shampoo, egg, noodles, can goods, etc.

Corazon has borrowed and repaid 26 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from buying and selling vegetables.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like soap, shampoo, egg, noodles, can goods, etc

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a farmer living and working in the Nyamira area of Nyanza Kenya. He lives with his wife and two children, who are of school-going age. He enjoys dairy farming the most and his main source of income is milk, eggs, and crops (cash and horticultural). His biggest challenges are pests and disease control.

James heard about Juhudi Kilimo from his friends, who shared how they had benefited from the loans. So he decided to join. During the training, he learned about group cohesion and the benefits of working in groups. James said that through his greenhouse profits, he will be able to educate his children and take care of his family's basic needs.

loans.use: to construct a greenhouse.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad is a hardworking entrepreneur who resells vegetables in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy additional vegetables to sell. Trinidad has been in this business for 9 years. She also earns additional income from reselling fish.

Trinidad has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Tamar

texts.en:
Tamar is a 30-year-old hardworking woman, from Batumi city, west Georgia. She lives with her husband, sister-in-law, and little child. Tamar's husband works as a private accountant, and he generates 300 GEL monthly. Sister-in-law is a nurse and is paid 200 GEL per month. Tamar works as an expert assessor at a private company and has a fixed salary.

In order to increase her monthly income and get an additional source of income for her family, Tamar decided to open a mini-store. She requested a loan and was approved under the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo; the start up program that enables people to start or re-start businesses. 

With the requested money, she will purchase stocks of soft drinks, chewing gum, and other mixed goods for her store, and will also arrange the place with all the needed parts. The income from this new business will greatly help Tamar make savings, and more effectively meet all daily costs. She will be really grateful for helping her maintain her private activity.

loans.use: to open a mini-store of chewing gums, soft drinks, and other mixed goods.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: An $800 loan is offered to Veronica to improve her business. Veronica opened her kiosk in 2013 with her own working capital. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store like candles, slippers, cigarettes, oils and bread. Veronica is generating a good income from selling. She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business. Veronica is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: To buy candles, slippers, cigarettes, oils and bread

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Razia is a 50-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.  She is passing her life with her husband and three children. Her husband is a very hard working and honest person. He owns a small restaurant in which he offers types of delicious foods. He hired a worker for his restaurant and he has to pay a salary to that worker. He has been running his restaurant for many years and this is the reason that most of the chairs, utensils and crockery have broken. So Razia's husband wants to buy furniture for the restaurant and crockery but his major income is spent on household expenses. Therefore, Razia requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can buy furniture and crockery for the restaurant. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy furniture and crockery for her husband's restaurant.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: An $800 loan is offered to Rosita to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as Fanta, Coca Cola, cigarettes, noodles, coffee, sugar, salt, soap and slippers. She has been involved in business activities since 2002. She feels very comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day. Running a business has made Rosita independent because she can be responsible for herself and help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, cigarettes, noodles, coffee, sugar, salt, soap and slippers

loans.name: Thilieta

texts.en: Thieleta is 44 years old. She is married with one kid. Thieleta is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past 10 years, she has been running a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. She is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan through ASKI to buy additional vegetables to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy cabbage, tomatoes, sweet potatoes and bananas for her business

loans.name: Kareem

texts.en:
Kareem is a 35-year-old married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife in a small, simple house. Kareem works as an employee in a local firm where he earns a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. Kareem and his wife would like to improve the home and buy all the needed stuff.
 
Kareem took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water for the family home. By taking this loan, Kareem will be able to improve his home and reduce the electricity costs. 

Kareem appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family home.

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of children, Rosalyn works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending.  Rosalyn is borrowing PHP 16000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Rosalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Melanie works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and earns additional income from selling vegetables and raising pigs. Melanie is borrowing PHP 29500 through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Melanie has been sustaining her business activities through her past twenty-one loans from NWTF and more recently through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP  through NWTF to buy items to sell like snack foods, sugar, soap, noodles, and other groceries for her general store business.

Ligaya has been in this business for 4 years. Ligaya earns additional income from selling vegetables.

Ligaya has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy items to sell  like snack foods, sugar, soap, noodles, and other groceries

loans.name: M. Sharif

texts.en:
M. Sharif is a 37-year-old married man, living with his family in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He is an ice cream distributor and offers various flavors. He buys various flavors ice creams from different companies and sells to the whole town through distributors. He has appointed a few distributors who sell ice creams over bicycles. The bicycles consist of thermos flask boxes and an umbrella. In this way, he is providing the source of income to the unemployed people and generating income for his family as well. Nowadays, he hired a new person for selling ice cream, but he does not have an additional bicycle and ice cream.
 
M. Sharif has already been spending his savings on purchasing the stocks of ice creams, and does not have cash in hand to buy a bicycle and additional ice creams.

Therefore, M. Sharif contacted with BRAC and requested a Kiva loan. He will utilize the loan for purchasing a new bicycle, thermos flask box, umbrella, and additional ice creams. In this way, he will provide the source of income to another unemployed person.

M. Sharif is very thankful to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a bicycle, thermos flask box, umbrella, and additional ice creams of various flavors.

loans.name: Manuela Rufina

texts.es:
Manuela Rufina  es una persona de 35 años de edad, vive con su familia en el municipio de Nahualá, departamento de Sololá, tiene un hijo de 6 meses, se dedica a vender ropa típica de la región, tiene dos años de experiencia en la actividad, ella solicita a ADICLA un crédito por Q. 6,000.00, para invertirlo en su negocio y tener más variedad en su mercadería, Manuela es una persona muy creativa ya que  con los ingresos que obtiene de la venta ayuda a su familia a obtener más ingresos y darle mejores condiciones de vida a su pequeño hijo. 
Manuela desea que su hijo asista a la escuela, para se prepare bien académicamente y así tener mejores oportunidades en su vida como ella no lo tuvo.
texts.en: Manuela Rufina is 35 years old and lives with her family in the municipality of Nahualá, within the department of Sololá, She has a 6 month old son.  Maria is dedicated to selling traditional clothing of the region and has experience doing this for the last two years.  She is requesting a loan of 6,000 Quetzals ($775 USD) in order to invest in her business and have more variety in her merchandise.  Manuela is a very creative person and with the income she is making from her sales, she helps give her family more earnings and improve the living standard of her young child.  Manuela would like her son to attend school so that he can be well-educated and have the opportunities in his life that she could not have.

loans.use: to buy and sell traditional clothing.

loans.name: Vilma De La Paz

texts.es: Vilma de 52 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo quien se dedica a la venta de periódicos, Vilma se caracteriza por ser una mujer honesta, trabajadora y sobre todo muy emprendedora. Hace varios años que logro establecer una pequeña tiendita en su hogar de residencia y gracias a Dios y a su arduo trabajo y dedicación el negocio es muy reconocido en la zona por lo que ya cuenta con mucha clientela. Doña Vilma solicita un crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de mercadería para la tienda tales como: huevos, golosinas, azúcar, arroz, leche, frijoles, pan dulce y de más artículos que parezcan atractivos para los clientes. De esta manera espera lograr su sueño de seguir mantenido activo su negocio y por consecuencia seguir trabajando por un mejor futuro junto con su esposo.
texts.en:
Vilma is 52 years old. She lives in her own house with her husband, who works selling newspapers. Vilma is known for being an honest, hardworking, and above all, a very enterprising woman. Several years ago, she opened a small store in her home. Thanks to God and to her hard work and dedication, her business is recognized in the area for already having many customers.

Vilma is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to invest in the purchase of merchandise for the store, such as: eggs, candy, sugar, rice, milk, beans, sweet bread and more items that are appealing to her customers. In this way, she hopes to achieve her dream of keeping her business running and therefore continue working for a better future together with her husband.

loans.use: to purchase eggs, candy, sugar, rice, milk, beans, sweet bread and other products.

loans.name: Sarah Jean

texts.en: Sarah Jean is almost done with her studies, and her graduation day is fast approaching. She is happy about having her parents and sibling being proud of her success. Her previous loan was used for buying school materials and other miscellaneous expenses for the last semester. But now, she is taking another loan for graduation fees, and it is granted by GDMPC through their education loan. Sarah Jean is thankful to GDMPC for this is a big help to students who wants to become successful.

loans.use: to pay for graduation fees.

loans.name: Heen

texts.en: Heen is a very dedicated son who wants to become successful in the future. He studied for a BS Criminology at a university. His father works as a government employee, whereas his mother works as a fish vendor.  His part time job at an internet cafe attendant helped him in his studies, but to acquire  documents intended for PNP application purposes is quite expensive aside from his school expenses. He need financial assistance to make it possible. With his GDMPC education loan he will be able to acquire all the documents and hopefully in the future he will find a better job.

loans.use: to acquire documents intended for PNP application purposes

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en: Rachael is a 36-year-old Kiva borrower. She has one child who is one years old. She describes herself to be good at work. She operates a retail business where she sells groceries, biscuits, maize and other items. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a busy area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of capital. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of groceries. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her business. This is her first loan with SMEP-DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stock of groceries

loans.name: Cora

texts.en:
Cora is 39 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Cora is borrowing PHP 11,500 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Cora has been raising pigs for three years, and earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ana Marie

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Ana Marie works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish wooden box making business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from furniture making. Ana Marie is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional wood, nails, etc. for her dried fish wooden box making business.

Ana Marie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional wood, nails, etc for her business.

loans.name: Edison

texts.en: Edison used the previous loan to pay school fees for his children. He has been in retail shop business and also does farming to supplement his income. He went into this business for personal and family sustainability in relation to basic needs and educating his children. He faces difficult challenges of  competition and inadequate capital, yet he dreams of transforming his business into a wholesale business and to educate his children up to the University level. Edison intends to use the loan to buy soap to sell.

loans.use: To buy  soap to sell.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a married Ugandan woman with four children, all of whom go to school in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in the retail business for eleven years, working seven days a week and twelve hours a day. Her business is located on a busy street. She started business to look after her family and is requesting a loan to buy omo and eggs. Agnes hopes to have a house, however competition is a challenge to be faced.

loans.use: to buy omo and eggs to sell.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: Miguel, es una persona de 61 años de edad, vive con su familia en el municipio de Nahualá, departamento de Sololá, tiene 5 hijos, cuatro de ellos ya se casarón, la más pequeña tiene 13 años de edad, estudia primero básico en el instituto de la comunidad, Miguel necesita Q. 3,000.00 para ponerle piso a su vivienda, él cosecha banano y de allí obtiene sus ingresos, lleva 40 años dedicándose a esta actividad agrícola. El deseo de Miguel es tener su casa en mejores condiciones y más adelante poner su negocio propio.
texts.en:
Miguel is a 61 year old man. He lives with his family in the municipality of Nahualá in the department of Sololá. He has 5 children, four of whom are already married. The youngest girl is 13 years old and is in seventh grade at the community's school.

Miguel needs 3,000.00 quetzales to install a floor in his house. He harvests bananas and from this obtains his income; he has been doing this agricultural work for 40 years. Miguel's desire is to have his house in better condition, and later on, to have his own business.

loans.use: to install flooring in his home.

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques, les six  membres du groupe Djèkafo ont en moyenne 33 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Niomirambougou un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Niomirambougou. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de fruits (papayes, bananes…), pommes de terre, boissons, condiments et la restauration. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Aby (femme debout en 3ème position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo) est une grande  vendeuse des fruits (papayes, bananes…). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 5 corbeilles de papayes  et 100kg de bananes en gros au quartier du fleuve de Bamako. La revente se fait en détail à Niomirambougou à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Aby  compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
The six members of the Djekafo group are married women living mainly in monogamous families. On the average, they are 33 years old, with four children. They all live in Niomirambougou, a district in Bamako and know each other as neighbors as well as through their work as vendors at the Niomirambougou market.  The group members sell fruits (papayas, bananas etc), potatoes, drinks condiments, and cooked dishes. With the goal of bolstering their work capital, the group members have  decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their first solidarity loan.
Mrs. Aby (the third one standing from left to right in the photo) is a well-known vendor of fruits (papayas, bananas etc). She plans to use her loan to buy five baskets of papayas and 100 kg [220 lbs] of bananas wholesale in the river port neighborhood of Bamako. She sells retail in Niomirambougou, mainly to female customers. With this loan, Mrs. Aby plans to earn an average monthly revenue of 50,000 West African francs, which will be used to reinvest in her business and cover some minor household expenses.

loans.use: to buy fruits.

loans.name: Solano

texts.es:
Solano tiene 24 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hija en el distrito de Pucará, una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente al cultivo de frutales, arroz, maíz, comercio de los mismos y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la cría y comercio de animales menores en la parte posterior a su domicilio, su esposa le apoya en esta labor, Solano ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de variedad de alimentos balanceados y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Solano is 24 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in the Pucara district. It's a community in a warm climate and the population works in agriculture, particularly in the growing and selling of fruit, rice, corn and raising livestock. The community is located in the Jaen province in the Cajamarca region of Peru's northern sierra.

He works in the raising and selling of small animals behind his home, and his wife helps him with this job. Solano has requested a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles to purchase a variety of balanced feed and use it to generate more income for his family.

loans.use: To purchase balanced feed to fatten his animals

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa tiene 55 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Cayalti una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas, caballeros, niños y a la venta de accesorios todos los días de la semana en ambiente de su hogar hace mas de 6 años, es una madre emprendedora, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 700 nuevos soles para la compra de variedad de ropa de temporada para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Teresa is 55 years old. She lives in the district of Cayaltí, a community where the people make a living from agriculture, trade, and ranching. It is located in the province of Chiclayo, which belongs to the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru.

Teresa makes a living by selling accessories and clothing for ladies, men, and children. She has been doing this for more than six years and she works every day, selling her products from home. She is an enterprising mother. She has requested a loan of 1,700 PEN in order to buy a variety of seasonal clothing to offer to her clients, thereby generating greater revenue.

loans.use: to buy a variety of seasonal clothing to offer to her clients

loans.name: Bélgica Mirella

texts.es:
En una localidad llamada Tierras Amarillas del cantón Rocafuerte cada quince días  se reúnen las socias del Grupo de Crédito Mejorando El Futuro, este sector es conocido por su agricultura ya que gran parte de sus habitantes se dedican a los sembríos de ciclo corto.
En este lugar vive la señora Bélgica, tiene 34 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 14, 12 y 10 años  que estudian en  colegio y escuela. El marido trabaja en un taller de mecánica automotriz. 
Doña Bélgica con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, aunque la mayor parte de sus ventas es por pedidos que le realizan sus clientes, ella viaja hasta Guayaquil una vez por mes a comprar lo que le encargan sus clientes y  también trae más mercadería para recorrer por la ciudad, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días.  Tiene un año que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, lo que más vende es ropa de mujer.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, en especial ropa de temporada. Está desde el inicio en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque con uno de los créditos empezó este negocio. Sus sueños es ver que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sean buenos profesionales,
texts.en: In a town called Tierras Amarillas in the Rocafuerte area the members of Grupo de Crédito Mejorando El Futuro meet every two weeks. This region is renowned for its agriculture, since a large portion of its inhabitants are employed in the sowing of short-term crops. This is where Bélgica lives, a 34 year old woman who cohabitates with her partner with whom she has three children of 10, 12, and 14 years of age who are currently attending school. Her spouse works in a car repair shop. Ms. Bélgica works in sales of all types of clothing with the purpose of making her own money and helping her partner with household expenses. She sells door-to-door, although the majority of her sales are orders made by her customers. Once a month she travels to Guayaquil to purchase the items ordered by her customers and also brings additional merchandise to offer throughout the city. She sells to customers on installment plans and collects payment every two weeks. For a year she's been doing this line of work and it's going very well. Women's clothing is her best-selling item. This loan is to purchase clothes, particularly seasonal clothing. She's been in Grupo de Crédito since the beginning and likes it because she used one of the loans to start this business. Her dream is to see her children complete their schooling and become real professionals.

loans.use: To purchase clothes.

loans.name: Gharam

texts.en:
Gharam is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in the photo.

Gharam is a 37-year-old married woman from a small village near Tulkarm city. She lives with her husband and eight kids. Her husband is a construction worker with an unstable income due to the low demand in the winter. He would like to improve his business and expand it so his income will increase. 

Gharam took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her husband to buy wood, bars and a new mixer for his construction work. By taking this loan, he will be able to improve his productivity and also his income.

loans.use: to buy wood, bars and a new mixer for her husband's construction work.

loans.name: Iluminada

texts.en:
Iluminada is married, and she works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Iluminada is borrowing 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Iluminada has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF, and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Teratai Indah Group

texts.en:
Sayu Komang is the head of the lending group. But now she can’t work as usual because one of her hands is broken, and she still needs time to recover. Her husband helps her to do her daily activities, and she’s very happy about that.

Sayu Komang is a housewife who raises pigs at her home. Using the current loan, Sayu Komang successfully maintains three pigs and will make a net profit of 500.000 IDR, which will be used to pay her everyday expenses. 

Teratai Indah group's members mostly have trading businesses and raise livestock. One is raising pigs. With 11 members, the group got a loan of 18,000,000 IDR. Sayu Komang is using her loan to buy three types of local pigs. The pigs will be maintained for two months, then sold. Profits from the sale will be set aside, and the capital will be used to buy more pigs. Sayu Komang hopes this effort will be smooth so that she can realize her dream of making her kitchen more spacious.

loans.use: to buy three types of local pigs.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es: Santiago con 55 años de edad casado con cuatro hijos mayores, originario de uno de los municipios de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, zona que se caracteriza por el cultivo de la caña y donde existe uno de los ingenios mas grande del país al igual que el comercio, Santiago se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador, responsable y con muchos deseos de superacion personal, es un microempresario que se dedica a la compra venta de cerdos y crianza en pie, sus compras las realiza en comarca aledañas y vecinos, sus ventas son al contado y al credito a clientes fijos y eventuales, los cuales recupera semanal y quincenal lo invertido, no solo este negocio tiene gracias a sus esfuerzos y sacrificios ha logrado sacar a su familia adelante por la buena administracion que ha tenido y con los otros negocio que ha logrado poner como: venta de pan dulce crianza de gallinas entre otros y de esa manera ha tenido un poco mas de ingresos. uno de sus sueños es poder ampliar mas sus negocios y de lograr de culminar de construir sus vivienda. el objetivo de este credito es para capital de trabajo en la compra de cerdos en pie, gallinas, leña, manteca, harina entre otros mas. santiago agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos economicos.-
texts.en: Santiago is a 55 year old married man with four adult children, and a native of the municipality of Chinandega located in the western region of the country, an area known for growing sugar, having one of the largest refineries in the country, and also its commerce. Santiago is known to be a hard-working and responsible man with lots of desire to better himself. He's a micro-entrepreneur who works in the buying and selling of pigs and animal raising. His purchases are done in nearby areas and transacted in cash as well as credit with regular and occasional customers. Payments are collected every week and every two weeks and this isn't his only business. Thanks to his hard work and sacrifice he has been able to support his family with good management and the other businesses he has created, such as: selling pastries and raising chickens, among other things, and that's how he has obtained a bit of extra income. One of his dreams is to further expand his businesses and finish building his home. The purpose of this loan is to obtain working capital and purchase pigs, chickens, wood, lard, flour, and more. Santiago is grateful for the help that Kiva lenders provide to low-income people.

loans.use: To purchase pigs, chickens, and products to make bread among other things

loans.name: Rin

texts.en:
Rin is 60 years old and is married with four children, two of whom rely on her income and are ready for school. Rin earns her income through farming rice and cassava, which is her major source of income. She has been in the business for almost 40 years. The challenges for her farming business are weather conditions, price fluctuations, crop diseases and agricultural tools.

To help her further improve her farming, she is asking for a loan which will be used to buy farm inputs like cassava seedlings and pesticide. ​​With this, she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm, thus augmenting her harvest and yields.
