loans.use: to buy farm inputs like cassava seedlings and pesticide.

loans.name: Florefe

texts.en:
Florefe is a married woman and a mother of a 14-year-old son from Panglao, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari or variety store business, selling various goods and items to the people in her place. Florefe also sells home-cooked snack foods and refreshments.

Florefe is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise to sell, like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, and ingredients for making ice candy, like milk, sugar and others. Florefe has hopes of expanding her business so that it will generate more revenue.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell, like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, and ingredients for making ice candy, like milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina is a 35-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of five children. She looks after her family at home, as she is a good housewife. Her husband provides services of painting work in buildings and shops, as well. In this regard, her husband is in need of some painting-related items such as paints of different colors, brushes, distemper, etc., for increasing his work. So, Amina made contact with BRAC Pakistan for the loan. BRAC Pakistan issued her loan so that her husband can be able to buy paints of different colors, brushes, distemper, etc., for increasing his work. Amina is so much thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy paints of different colors, brushes, distemper, etc.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 56 años de edad, de estado civil casado, tiene 5 hijos de 37,34,30 años, vive con su esposa en la comunidad Manzanapamba perteneciente al cantón Guaranda, Provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la ventanilla Manzanapamba está formada por 10 socios que son de la misma comunidad los cuales se dedican a la agricultura, se encuentra ubicada a 30 minutos de la oficina operativa Guaranda.
Pedro es agricultor, se dedica al comercio de animales, también se desempeña como albañil. Solicita el crédito para la compra de una vaca, con lo que aspira producir más leche para la venta. La compra la realiza en Guaranda, cada semana y la venta del producto cada 5 meses. Sus metas son: estar bien con la familia, salir adelante y sin problemas. Su desafío son las plagas y las heladas. En su tiempo libre le gusta descansar, conversar con la familia, la costumbre que más le gusta son las fiestas de la Virgen.
texts.en:
Pedro is 56 years old, married, and has five children, ages 37, 34, and 30/  He lives with his wife in the Manzana Pampa Community, within the Guaranda settlement of the Bolivar province.

He is a member of the Manzana Pampa group, made up of 10 members from the same community, located 30 min from the Guaranda office.  They are farmers.

Pedro is a farmer who sells animals and also works as a mason.  He is asking for this loan to buy a cow so he can produce more milk to sell.  He will make his purchase in Guaranda each week and sells his products every five months.  Hos goals are to be well with the family and come out ahead with no problems.  He likes to converse with his family in his spare time and the Virgin Mary festival is his favorite tradition.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Umeda

texts.ru: Тридцати семилетняя жительница города Конибодом Умеда занимается своим торговым бизнесом. Она на местном рынке своего города продает различные виды тканей, платков, полотенец и т.д. Она начала этот бизнес два года назад. Финансовые трудности семьи заставили Умеду самой начать зарабатывать на жизнь. У Умеды двое детей. Дочери 12 лет, а сыну 9 лет, они ходят в школу. Ее муж работает охранником в одной фирме. Основной доход семьи поступает за счет бизнеса Умеды. Сейчас она хочет увеличить ассортимент товара, чтобы привлечь больше клиентов. Она просит кредит для купли тканей и платков для развития бизнеса.
texts.en: Umeda, a 37-year-old resident of the city of Konibodom, runs her own business selling various types of fabric, scarves, towels, etc. at the local market. She began this business two years ago, as her family's financial difficulties required her to start earning a living. Umeda has two children, a 12-year-old daughter and a nine-year-old son, both of whom go to school. Her husband works as a security guard at a company, but Umeda's business is the family's primary source of income. She wants to increase her assortment of goods in order to bring in more clients, and is asking for a loan to purchase fabric and scarves to develop her business.

loans.use: to buy fabric and scarves for resale

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es: Manuela, tiene 43 años de edad, vive con sus cinco hijos en el municipio de Santa Catarina Ixtahuacán, departamento de Sololá, el primero de sus hijos ya se graduó y la ayuda en su panadería, el segundo tiene 18 años se gradúa este año, el tercero tiene 14 estudia tercero básico, el cuarto tiene 12 estudia primero básico y el quinto tiene 10 años todavía no va a la escuela, ella desde hace doce años instaló una panadería en la comunidad donde vive, empezó con poco capital, hasta el momento es la única panadería que funciona en este lugar, ella solicita a ADICLA un crédito por un monto de Q. 6,000.00 para invertirlo en la compra de más insumos para la preparación de pan, con esta inversión aumentaría la cantidad de pan que ella elabora a diario y así atender a mas clientes.
texts.en:
Manuela is 43 years old. She lives in the municipality of Santa Catarina Ixtahuacán in the department of Sololá with her 5 children. The oldest of her children has already finished school and helps in her bakery; the second oldest is 18 years old and will graduate this year; the third is 14 years old and is in third grade; the 4th is 12 years old and studying in the first grade; and her fifth child is 10 years old and hasn't yet started school.

Manuela set up her bakery two years ago, in the community where she lives. She started the business with a small amount of capital, and it is the only bakery in the area.

She is requesting a loan from ADICLA in the amount of 6,000.00 Quetzales [$775 USD] which she will invest in additional supplies for preparing her bread. With this investment she will increase the quantity of bread she can make daily, and will be able to serve more clients.

loans.use: to operate her bakery.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to help her husband to buy new tools and repair parts for his workshop.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en: Mary Jane, aged 40, owns and operates a farm. She has been raising pigs and selling meat in her village and she earns well from this business. In order to purchase pig feed, she has borrowed a loan from ASKI. She hopes to gain more revenue to cover daily expenditures and to improve the piggery to ensure a better income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed

loans.name: Diadema

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Diadema works hard to support her family. She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines, and earns additional income from a general store. Diadema is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her vegetable garden.

Diadema has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her vegetable garden.

loans.name: Mkawadigo

texts.en:
Mkawadigo is married with three school-going children. They live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mkawadigo has operated a fruit and vegetable stall business for the past three years. She sells from home to her neighbours. She dreams of establishing a mini green-grocery in the future.

With the loan, Mkawadigo wants to purchase green vegetables, onions, potatoes and tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, onions, potatoes and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Bader

texts.en:
Bader, who appears in the photo, is a 47-year-old married man from Jericho city. He is the father of nine sons and six daughters. Bader is a worker in a local company where he earns a low income which barely covers all the family's needs. One year ago, Bader started his own project which is producing honey. He puts small beehives in a room in his garden.
 
Bader has taken out a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more beehives for his project. By taking out this loan, Bader will be able to increase the honey production. He would like to take out a bigger loan in the future and expand his business.

loans.use: to buy more beehives for his project.

loans.name: Khurshed

texts.en:
Khurshed is married with one child. Being a responsible father, Khurshed works hard every day to generate income so he can cover his daily costs and send his child to school. He is dedicated to his farming business, growing wheat and potatoes on his own land. To contribute to improving his family's living standards, he has worked hard from early morning till late evening for six years.

Khurshed would like to develop his business. Therefore, he is asking for a loan of 1,500 Somoni to purchase mineral fertilizers and seeds for the new planting season. He hopes that Kiva lenders won’t reject his loan and he thanks lenders in advance for their generosity.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and seeds for the new planting season

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more grocery products and renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Carlos Augusto

texts.es: Carlos de 51 años de edad vive junto a su esposa en casa propia. Carlos tiene en su domicilio un pequeño taller de estructura metálica, trabaja muy bien las defensas de ventanas, puertas, verjas y otros tipos de trabajos de decoración con hierro. Su esposa es empleada en una panadería de su municipio. Carlos desea construir una pila para recolectar agua potable y un baño en su vivienda, por lo que ha solicitado a FUSAI un crédito con el que pagará la mano de obra y comprar; 6 bolsas de cemento, 200 ladrillos de obra, 4 pliegos de lámina galvanizada, grava, arena, hierro y cuartones de pino. Carlos se compromete a cancelar todas las cuotas que este crédito implica.
texts.en:
Carlos is 51 years old and lives with his wife in their own home. Carlos has a small metal-structured workshop in his home. He is very good at making iron bars for windows and doors, as well as railings and other types of iron decorations. His wife works for a bakery in their municipality.

Carlos wishes to build a large basin to gather water, and a bathroom in his house. He has requested a loan from FUSAI for this purpose, and will use the loan to pay the builders for their labor and to purchase: 6 bags of cement, 200 bricks, 4 sheets of galvanized aluminum, gravel, sand, iron and pine planks. 

He promises to make all of the payments required for this loan.

loans.use: to purchase the materials needed to build a wash basin and a bathroom in his house.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 48 years old, married and has four children, one of whom is in school. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Anita has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Anita has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Anita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Kim Chhin

texts.en:
Kim Chhin is a 43-year-old married woman who is now a widow. She has three children who are employed in various careers to help support the family. Kim Chhin describes herself to be confident and an industrious farmer. She is diligent about her farm work because she believes that her efforts and determination may one day result in satisfying the outcome that she seeks.

Due to the lack of a vehicle for fulfilling their transportation needs, Kim Chhin is asking for a loan which she will use to buy a second-hand motorcycle for her children. This will save them from paying for daily taxi services and allow them to save more for their future needs. She is very thankful to all lenders in advance.

loans.use: to buy a second-hand motorcycle for her children.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman who has been blessed with five children, four in school and one who is too young. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Fatuma operates a charcoal-selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and villagers. Her greatest monthly challenge is the high cost of transportation. She is requesting a loan to purchase charcoal for resale. Fatuma joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Joycee

texts.en:
Joycee is energetic and  travel loving with beauty and brains who has aspired to become a flight attendant since she was young. She is pictured with her mother standing on the right. She is 22 years old from Manipur, Senapati district, which is about 62 km away from the city of Imphal, in the  northeastern region of India. Her father is a Pastor and her mother helps her father in his ministry. She is the eldest amongst her siblings. She has two younger sisters and a brother. 

She has completed her graduation from Manipur University. Since childhood, she dreamed of becoming an air hostess but in the back of her mind, she thought that it would be like chasing rainbows. Right after she completed her pre secondary, with her parents' consent, she went to take the cabin crew interview, which was conducted in town during that time. But unfortunately, she couldn’t get through during that time. However, she never gave up her dreams and kept persisting until she reached her goal. With her never-give-up attitude, she achieved her dreams successfully today.  

She is so thankful to her parents because in spite of their difficulties, limited income and other responsibilities of the family; they made an effort to send her to a good school and let her pursue her dreams. Joycee says that being the eldest in the family, she has lot of responsibilities on her shoulder and it is time to help her parents. She wishes to help her parents by supporting them financially in looking after her younger siblings. There is no other source of income apart from her father’s monthly salary, which is just sufficient to run the family's affairs. 

She needs money to enroll in cabin crew training. However, due to financial crunches, her parents could not enthusiastically send her off. Through her common friends, she learned about Kiva who provides financial help to the potential and deserving professional who need financial support to nurture her dreams. She thanks Kiva for being such a great help in times of need and for their generosity towards her and the family.

loans.use: To pay for a flight attendant training course

loans.name: Fatat

texts.en:
Fatat is a 51-year-old married mother of two children. She is a hard worker and has been selling used clothes since 2012, to support her beloved husband in covering her precious family's needs and requests. When she started her business, Fatat faced slight obstacles in finding a shop with a special location that could freely attract customers' attention. Today, she is well known in her region for the special prices and quality of products that she provides to her customers. Her current customers are the main marketing sector on which she relies.

Today, Fatat is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with special spring and summer collections to provide her customers with a wide variety of products upon their request. 

She hopes to keep on developing her business through diversifying her products and moving to a larger place in the future, as she is already working on expanding into the shoes sector.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with special spring and summer collections

loans.name: Paula Asuncuion

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito San Vicente se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.
En este lugar vive la señora Paula, tiene 27 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene una hija de 6  años la misma que estudian en escuela. El marido es taxista. 
Doña Paula es una joven mujer que le gusta trabajar y con su esfuerzo salir adelante, tiene una tienda de víveres en casa de los suegros donde ella también vive,  allí vende todo tipo de productos, como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, verduras, frutas,  artículos de bazar entre otras cosas, a ella le gusta tener su tienda bien surtida y así brindarles la mejor atención a sus clientes, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, sus suegros le ayudan cuando ella tiene que salir a realizar alguna actividad pero por lo general es ella la que siempre pasa en su local,  Tiene más de 7 años con su tienda y le encanta lo que hace.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, entre otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Grupo De Crédito  hace 2 años y le gusta por la ayuda que les brinda la institución. Sus sueños son aumentar su tienda.
texts.en:
The Credit Group ‘San Vicente’ meets every 15 days at the Picoaza parish in Portoviejo.  This area is known for its trade, its traditional festivals of San Pedro and San Pablo, and for the cheerful nature of its people.

This is where Paula, 27, lives with husband and their 6-year-old daughter.  Her daughter is studying at school and her husband is a taxi driver.

Paula is a young woman who likes working hard and getting on in life.  She has a convenience store at the house of her parents-in-law, which is where she also lives.  There she sells all types of products such as rice, sugar, oil, washing detergent, beans, vegetables, fruit and stationery.  She likes to have her shop well stocked and therefore, be able to offer the best service to her customers.  She works every day from 6.00 in the morning until 8.00 in the evening; sometimes working even later.  Her parents-in-law help her if she has to leave the shop for a moment, but generally, she is the one who is in the shop most of the time.  She has  had the shop now for more than seven years and she loves it.

With this loan she is going to increase her stock.  She will buy rice, sugar and oil, among basic convenience products.  She has been in the credit group for two years and she benefits from the help that they offer.  She dreams of expanding her store in the future.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil and other basic products.

loans.name: Elio

texts.es:
Elio tiene 23 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Pomahuaca una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de café, dedicándose a esta actividad desde hace 6 años, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos para el mantenimiento de sus cultivos y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Elio, 23, lives in Pomahuaca, a community dedicated to agriculture, trade and livestock.  This district is located in the province of Jaen in Cajamarca in the northern mountains of Peru.

Elio works in agriculture.  His main activity is growing coffee, which he has been doing for six years.  He has asked for a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles to buy fertilizers so he can maintain his crops and generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to maintain his coffee plantations.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: Miguel, tiene 39 años de edad, vive con sus dos hijos en el municipio de Nahualá, departamento de Sololá, los hijos son de 16 y de 14 años de edad, en este año terminan de estudiar el ciclo básico y el otro año empezarán una carrera, él se dedica a llevar y a traer gente de un municipio a otro en su pick-up, de esta actividad obtiene buenas ganancias, Miguel solicita un crédito por un monto de Q. 11,000.00 para invertirlo en la venta de leche de vaca que lo hace de forma ambulante hasta el momento, él se dio cuenta que entre más invierte más ganancia obtiene, Miguel en el futuro quiere comprar otro pick-up para hacer mas viajes.
texts.en:
Miguel, 39, lives with his two children in Nahuala, Solola.  His children are 16 and 14 years of age.  This year they finish their general education and will start next year to study at a higher level.  

Miguel transports people between towns in his pick-up truck, which offers him a steady income.  He is asking for a loan of 11,000 quetzales to invest in buying and selling cow’s milk, which he sells as he drives around the towns.  He realized that the more he invests in this business, the more profit he will make.  In the future he would like to buy another pick-up truck to be able to make more journeys.

loans.use: to buy and sell milk.

loans.name: Carlos Edwin

texts.es:
Carlos Edwin tiene 38 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Buenos Aires, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon, que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

El brinda servicio de transporte público en su mototaxi, trasladando a sus clientes a los caseríos aledaños, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para realizar los trámites de su brevete y Soat y de esta manera brindar un servicio seguro para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Carlos Edwin, 38, lives with his wife and children in Buenos Aires.  This community is dedicated to agriculture, trade and livestock.  It is located in the Morropon province in Piura on the northern coast of Peru.

He offers a taxi service in his rickshaw, taking people to the neighboring villages.  He has asked for a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles to take care of his driving license and car insurance so that he can offer a safe service to his customers.

loans.use: to pay for his driver's license and car insurance, so he can offer a safe service.

loans.name: Nelly Narcisa

texts.es:
En una localidad llamada Tierras Amarillas del cantón Rocafuerte cada quince días  se reúnen las socias del Grupo de Crédito Mejorando El Futuro, este sector es conocido por su agricultura ya que gran parte de sus habitantes se dedican a los sembríos de ciclo corto.
En este lugar vive la señora Nelly, tiene 50 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 8 hijos, 6 de ellos mayores de edad y dos de 16 y 14 años que estudian en colegio, 4 de sus hijos aun viven en su casa. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.
Doña Nelly trabaja en sociedad con uno de sus hijos, ellos se dedican a la venta de leche, quesos y ganado, en un carro que tienen su hijo se desplaza a los campos a comprar la leche a ciertos ganaderos y también recogen la leche que ellos ordeñan de sus vacas, para luego llevarla hasta su casa en la cual dedican una parte a elaborar el delicioso queso y la otra parte la lleva a vender por localidades vecinas junto con el queso que el día anterior ella a fabricado, parte del crédito también su marido lo utiliza para sus cultivos, el tiene sembrado arroz y maíz.. 
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar leche y abono para los cultivos. Está en el Grupo de Crédito desde el inicio y le  gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños es que sus hijos menores terminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
In Tierras Amarillas, Rocafuerte, the Credit Group ‘Mejorando el Futuro’ meets every 15 days.  This area is known for its agriculture as most of the population there work on the crops.

This is where Nelly, 50, lives.  She is married and has eight children, six of whom are now adults.  The younger two, who are 16 and 14, are studying at school.  Four of her children still live in their home.  Her husband works in agriculture.

Nelly works in the society with one of her sons.  They sell milk, cheese and cattle.  Her son uses their car to travel to different farms and collect the milk that they have just milked from their cows.  Then he takes it to their house, where they use some of it to make delicious cheese, and the rest of it to sell it around the neighborhood together with the cheese they made the previous day.  

Her husband will use part of this loan to buy fertilizer to help with his crops.  He grows rice and corn.  The rest of it will be used by Nelly to buy milk.  She has been in the credit group since it began and she is grateful for the help it offers.  Her dream is for her younger children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy milk and fertilizer.

loans.name: Wa'al

texts.en:
Wa'al is 35 years old and married, and they have four children. They live in their own house in Gaza; referred to as Gaza City, it is a Palestinian city in the Gaza Strip, with a population of 515,556, making it the largest city in the Palestinian territories.

For 10 years, Wa'al has worked at his accessories and perfume shop. He asked Ryada for this loan to buy an electronic generator and an air conditioner. Wa'al has a lot of customers who prefer to buy from him rather than other shops in the area because he treats them nicely. He hopes that this business increase continues and that it increases his income, enabling him to give his children good conditions in life and meet their needs.

loans.use: to buy an electronic generator and air conditioner.

loans.name: Kankelefo Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages polygamiques, les quatre  membres du groupe Kankelefo ont en moyenne 38 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Niomirambougou un des quartier de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Niomirambougou. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, condiments (aubergines, tomates et persils), pains, glaces et produits cosmétiques. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Gna, debout à l’extrême gauche sur la photo, a une  grande renommée dans le petit commerce de condiments (aubergines, tomates et persils). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 4 corbeilles de tomate, 4 corbeilles d’aubergine et 2 corbeilles de  persil à  Kati. La revente se fait en détail  à Niomirambougou à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Gna compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 80 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Predominantly married in polygamous households, the four members of the Kankelefo group are on average 38 years old with three children. They all live in  Niomirambougou, one of Bamako's districts, and became acquainted through neighborhood ties and their income-generating activities at the Niomirambougou market.

Group members trade condiments (eggplant, tomatoes and parsley), bread, ice cream and cosmetics. In order to increase their working capital, the group decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second group loan cycle.

Ms. Gna, standing at the far left in the photo, has a great reputation in the retail trade of condiments (eggplant, tomatoes and parsley). She intends to use her loan to buy four baskets of tomatoes, four baskets of eggplants and two baskets of parsley in Kati. Retail sales are made in Niomirambougou to a clientele composed mainly of women.

With this loan Ms. Gna hopes to attain average monthly profits of 80,000 CFA francs, to be reinvested in the business and used to meet household needs.

loans.use: buy condiments

loans.name: Marème

texts.fr: Madame Marème, possède un réfrigérateur avec lequel elle travaille depuis 10 ans en vendant de l’eau fraiche et du jus glacé. Elle a aussi remplacé il y a seulement 4 mois, sa grand-mère (qui a pris de l’âge et qui ne vend plus) dans sa cantine dans le marché central et qui vendait des divers comme de l’encens, du beurre de karité, des calebasses… C’est d’ailleurs pour renforcer la cantine, qu’elle sollicite ce crédit. Là bas, elle ouvre de 10h à 19h et peut avoir au minimum une recette journalière de 1500F. Elle veut acheter un congélateur et augmenter sa capacité de production de jus. Marème rêve aussi d’avoir sa propre maison.
texts.en:
Mrs. Marème owns a refrigerator that she's been using for her business for the past ten years. She sells cold water and iced juice. Only four months ago, she replaced her grandmother (who's getting old and cannot sell anymore) who used to sell various products such as incense, shea butter, calabashes, etc, in her small shop at the central market.

It is in fact to strengthen this shop that Mrs. Marème is seeking this loan. She opens her shop from 10 a.m. to 7 p.m., and her daily turnover reaches at least XOF 1'500.

She also wants to buy a freezer and increase her juice production capacity. She also dreams to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy incense, calabashes, and shea butter

loans.name: Savet

texts.en: Savet is 32 years old and a married woman with three children living in Takeo Province. She is a factory laborer and her husband is a trailer driver. Both of them can earn 8 USD per day. Now she would like to apply for loan of 1,300 USD to buy a new trailer for her husband to provide services to clients. This loan can help her family to gain a better living standard. In the future, she hopes that she can open a small retail shop at home.

loans.use: to buy a new trailer for her husband to provide services to clients.

Her husband works as a security guard and two of her children work as factory laborers. All of them can earn 9 USD per day. She would like to apply for a loan of 700 USD to buy pigs to breed and sell for a profit. This loan helps her to get more profits as well as better living standards.

loans.use: to buy pigs to breed and sell for a profit.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en: Pov is 42 years old and a married woman with two children living in Takeo province. She is a factory laborer and her husband, who is with her in the photo, runs a business purchasing junk materials to resell. Both of them can earn 25 USD per day. Pov would like to apply for a loan of 1,000 USD to raise her husband's business capital and buy junk materials to resell. This loan helps her husband’s business to get more profit.

loans.use: to raise her husband's business capital and buy junk materials to resell.

loans.name: Yon

texts.en:
Yon is 42 years old. She is a married woman of three children in Takeo Province. Yon and her child are factory laborers and her husband is a farmer. All of them can earn $9 per day. 

Yon would like to apply for loan of $1,200 to buy timber to build a house. This loan would help her family to live in better conditions.

loans.name: Kunthea

Now she would like to apply for a loan of 1,200 USD to buy cows to breed and sell for a profit, and also to buy land. The loan helps her to make more profit for her family as well as make her family’s lives better. In the future, she hopes that her kids can get diplomas.

In the future, she hopes that her business can expand more and her kid can get a bachelors degree.

She is the mother of three kids -- one son and two daughters. Her husband works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. Two years ago, Olfat's husband opened a small store for selling TV satellites and some small electronic devices. It is a good business and the only one in his kind in the area

Olfat took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her husband to buy more products for his electronics store to resell. By taking this loan, the store sales will increase as well as the family income.

loans.use: to help her husband buy more products for his electronics store to resell.

loans.name: Tisongmi Taba-Nyong Nayili Group

texts.en:
Damu is an active woman, 48 years old, from Nyong-Nayili in the northern part of Ghana. She is married and has six children. She is the second person from the left among those placing their hand on the shea nuts in the group picture.

Damu is a member of a shea butter processing group who have been in the business for the last 4 years. Their group is called Tisongmi Taba-Nyong Nayili Women's Association. Damu makes good profits from the business since she and every member of her group have been trained by Grameen Ghana on how to process high quality premium shea butter for both international and local markets.

Damu and the group have asked for a loan of 6,900 cedis to enable them to buy 115 bags of shea nuts for processing. By so doing, Damu will increase production and, hence, profit more, repay the loan, and support her children’s educational and food needs.

loans.use: To buy 115 bags of shea nuts to extract premium shea butter

loans.name: Editha Judith

texts.es:
En una localidad llamada Tierras Amarillas del cantón Rocafuerte cada quince días  se reúnen las socias del Grupo de Crédito Mejorando El Futuro, este sector es conocido por su agricultura ya que gran parte de sus habitantes se dedican a los sembríos de ciclo corto.
En este lugar vive la señora Editha, tiene 30 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene una hija de 13 años que estudia en colegio. El marido se dedica a la agricultura. 
Doña Editha realiza el crédito para su esposo, el mismo que  se dedica a la agricultura,  el siembra cultivos de arroz, maíz y verduras, ella se encarga de realizar los créditos con los cuales financian estos cultivos mientras que su marido es quien se dedica a los trabajos en el campo junto con dos personas más a quienes les pagan por su trabajo,  siembran en toda época del año ya que cuentan con bombas de riego para esto, actualmente en esta época invernal han aumentado la cantidad de tierra para el cultivo por lo cual esperan tener una gran producción este año. 
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar fertilizantes y pagar mano de obra para trabajos en los cultivos. Está en el Grupo de Crédito desde hace 5 años y le  gusta porque le ayudan con los créditos. Sus sueños es tener una muy buena cosecha
texts.en:
The members of the Mejorando El Futuro communal bank meet every two weeks in a place called Tierras Amarillas, within the Rocafuerte settlement. This sector is known for its agriculture and most of its residents raise short cycle crops. Editha lives here. She’s 30 years old and is in a live in relationship, with a 13 year old daughter who attends school. Her husband is a farmer. Editha is taking out the loan for her husband, who works in agriculture growing rice, corn and vegetables.

She is in charge of getting the loans with which they finance their crops, while her husband works the fields, along with two other people whom they pay. They plant all year round now that they have irrigation pumps which make this possible. During the current winter season they have increased the amount of land for cultivation and so they are hoping for a good yield this year.

They will use the money from this loan to buy fertilizers, and also pay for labor to look after the crops. She has been part of the communal bank for 5 cycles and she likes it because it helps her with loans. She is hoping to have a very good harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for labour.

loans.name: Bweyogerere High School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Abraham. He is the Director of Bweyogerere High School, a mixed school in the Peri-urban area of Bweyogerere in Wakiso with 700 students. Bweyogerere High School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Bweyogerere high will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. This will be supplemented by the sale of carbon credits, which the school will generate from using the water tank. Abraham ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Isata

texts.en:
Hello, this is Isata, a businesswoman from Waterloo in northern Freetown. Isata is married to a man who works in the local area. They have five children. All five of her children (aged between 4 and 20) are still attending school. 

Isata started her business to take care of her family. She sells palm oil in a nearby town. Palm oil is heavily relied upon in local homes, as it is the base for spicy local (and affordable) stews such as “crain-crain” or “rice and cassava leaf”. She works from 8:00 a.m. to 6:30 p.m. and then tends to her family. Even though Isata is proud of her business, it faces challenges from the poor transportation infrastructure in the area. This makes traveling to purchase stock or reach new markets slow and expensive. 

Isata would like to use this loan to buy palm oil in bulk (by the gallon). This would allow her business to remain profitable. She would like to thank BRAC Sierra Leone and the Kiva lenders for helping her and her business.

loans.use: to buy palm oil in bulk for her business.

loans.name: New Hormisdallen School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is George. He is the Head teacher of New Hormisdallen Primary School, a mixed school in the Peri-urban area of Bweyogerere in Wakiso district with 927 students. Hormisdallen Primary School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Hormisdallen Primary will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. This will be supplemented by the sale of carbon credits, which the school will generate from using the water tank. George ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Nil Esmidio

texts.es:
Nil Esmido tiene 67 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Buenos Aires, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon, que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de plátano, que los comercializa en su domicilio, cuenta con clientela considerable, ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para el pago de mano de obra por el mantenimiento de su cultivo de plátano y para la compra de abono para el mismo y de esta manera tener una producción oportuna para ofrece a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Nil Esmido is 67 years old. He lives with his wife and children in the Buenos Aires district, situated in the Province of Morropon which belongs to the Piura region on the north coast of Peru. The local people work in commerce, agriculture and livestock.

Nil Esmido makes a living from agriculture, particularly growing bananas, which he sells from his home. He has a large clientele.

He has asked for a loan of 3000 nuevos soles to pay for labour to look after the banana plants and to buy manure for them so he can have a good crop which is suitable for selling to his customers.

loans.use: to pay for labour to look after the banana crop.

loans.name: Aladino

texts.es:
Aladino tiene 30 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Pomahuaca, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de café desde hace seis años, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos y de esta manera tener una producción oportuna para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Aladino, 30, lives with his wife and children in the district of Pomahuaca, a community dedicated to agriculture, commerce and livestock farming.  It is located in the province of Jaén which belongs to the Cajamarca Region in the northern mountain range of Peru.

He has been involved in agriculture, cultivating especially coffee, for the last six years.  He is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,500 PEN to buy fertilizer so he will have a better crop to offer his customers, which will generate more income for them.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Rogelio Rojas

texts.es:
Lucero Lorenzo tiene 43 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Pomahuaca, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de café, su esposa le apoya en esta labor preparando los alimentos para los jornaleros que dan mantenimiento a su cultivo, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos para su cultivo y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Lucero Lorenzo, 43, lives with his wife and children in the district of Pomahuaca, a community dedicated to agriculture, commerce and livestock farming.  It is located in the province of Jaén which belongs to the Cajamarca Region in the northern mountain range of Peru.

He is involved in agriculture, especially in the cultivation of coffee.  His wife helps with the work by preparing food for the hired hands who carry out crop maintenance.  He is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,500 PEN to buy fertilizers for his crop in order to generate more income for the family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Sabougnouman Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques, les six membres du groupe Sabougnouman ont en moyenne 45 ans et 6 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Niomirambougou un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Niomirambougou. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, condiments (poivrons, tomates, aubergines, persils), produits cosmétiques, poissons et restauration. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Fatoumata en 3ème position de la droite vers la gauche est une grande vendeuse des condiments. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  8 corbeilles de tomate, 3 corbeilles de poivron, 1corbeille de persil et 8 corbeilles de d’aubergine à Bamako. La revente se fait en détail à Niomirambougou à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Fatoumata compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 90 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Mostly married in monogamous households, the six members of the Sabougnouman group are on average 45 years old with six children. They all live in Niomirambougou, one of Bamako's districts, and became acquainted through neighborhood ties and their income-generating activities at the Niomirambougou market.

Group members trade condiments (peppers, tomatoes, eggplant, parsley), cosmetics, fish and food preparations. In order to increase their stock-in-trade, the group decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second group loan.

Ms. Fatoumata (third position from right to left) is a great vendor of condiments. She intends to use her loan to buy eight baskets of tomatoes, three baskets of peppers, one basket of parsley and eight baskets of eggplant in Bamako. Retail sales are conducted in Niomirambougou to a clientele composed mostly of women.

With this loan Ms. Fatoumata hopes to achieve average monthly profits of 90,000 CFA francs, to be reinvested in the business and use to meet household needs.

loans.use: buy condiments

loans.name: Elmer Javier

texts.es:
Elmer Javier tiene 41 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Cayaltí, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El brinda servicio de transporte en su trimovil, propia en el centro y exteriores del distrito de Cayalti todos los días de la semana hace mas de 03 años, ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de una carpa para su vehículo y de esta manera brindar un servicio en mejores condiciones a sus pasajeros.
texts.en:
Elmer Javier is 41 years old and lives with his wife and children in the Cayaltí district located in the Province of Chiclayo which belongs to the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru. The locals work in commerce, agriculture and livestock.

Elmer Javier provides a transport service with his own mototaxi in the centre and outlying areas of the Cayaltí district. He has been doing this every day for more than 3 years. 

He has asked for a loan of 3000 nuevos soles to buy a canopy for his vehicle so he can provide his service with better conditions for his passengers.

loans.use: to buy a canopy for his vehicle.

loans.name: Estrella Del Consuelo

texts.es:
En una localidad llamada Tierras Amarillas del cantón Rocafuerte cada quince días  se reúnen las socias del Grupo de Crédito Mejorando El Futuro, este sector es conocido por su agricultura ya que gran parte de sus habitantes se dedican a los sembríos de ciclo corto.
En este lugar vive la señora Estrella, tiene 47 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos mayores de edad la menor de ellos vive en su casa. El marido es comerciante de frutas. 
Doña Estrella es una mujer muy luchadora que le gusta ganar algo con su trabajo, ella tiene un pequeño comedor en un balneario cercano a su casa el cual es muy concurrido los fines de semana y feriados, allí prepara deliciosos platos y también prepara las deliciosas salchichas las cuales son muy apetecidas por sus  clientes. Ella  le da parte del crédito a su marido para que compre frutas para la venta, el cual lo realiza en una tricimoto que recorre la ciudad y sitios cercanos.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar víveres para la preparación de los alimentos y frutas para el negocio del marido. Está desde el inicio en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos siempre son de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños son comprar un carro para que su esposo venda las frutas.
texts.en:
In a town called Tierras Amarillas in the Rocafuerte Canton, the members of the communal bank "Mejorando el Futuro" meet every 15 days.  The area is known for its agriculture since most of the local people are short-cycle crop growers.

This is where Estrella, 47, lives.  She has a common-law husband and four grown children, the youngest of whom lives at home.  Her husband is a fruit merchant.

Estrella is a very determined woman who likes to earn a profit through her work.  She has a small food stall a spa near her home which is very busy on weekends and holidays.  She prepares good food, including her delicious sausages, which her customers enjoy.  Part of the loan will go to her husband for the fruit business which he carries out as a street vendor on a three-wheeled motorcycle.

Estrella will use the loan to buy ingredients for her food and fruit for her husband's business.  She has been in the communal bank since its beginnings and she feels the loans are always very helpful.  Her goal is to buy a vehicle for her husband's fruit business.

loans.use: To buy food ingredients and fruit.

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques, les cinq  membres du groupe Djekafo ont en moyenne 42 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Dravela bolibana un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Dravela bolibana. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, pommes de terre, laits en poudre, produits cosmétiques et condiments. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Sadio 1 ère debout à droite sur la photo, est une grande vendeuse de pommes de terre. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 15 sacs de pommes terre  à Bamako. La revente se fait en détails au marché à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Sadio espère avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 60 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Mostly married in monogamous households, the five members of the Djekafo group are on average 42 years old with five children. They all live in Dravela Bolibana, one of Bamako's districts, and became acquainted through neighborhood ties and their income-generating activities at the Dravela Bolibana market.

Group members trade potatoes, powdered milk, cosmetics and condiments. To increase their stock-in-trade, the group decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first group loan cycle.

Ms. Sadio (first person standing on the right in the picture) is a great vendor of potatoes. She intends to use her loan to buy 15 bags of potatoes in Bamako. Retail sales are conducted at the market to a clientele composed mostly of women.

With this loan Ms. Fatoumata hopes to achieve average monthly profits of 60,000 CFA francs, to be reinvested in the business and used to meet household needs.

loans.use: buy potatoes

loans.name: Sigimame Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  SIGIMAME  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  39 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à KOLONDIEBA, une des préfectures de la 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités à tout moment. Elles sont à leur sixième prêt avec l’institution et compte bien le rembourser.
Mme KOROTOUMOU  (2ème sur la photo de la droite vers la gauche) compte acheter avec son prêt 2 sacs de maïs. Elle vend quotidiennement au marché de KOLONDIEBA. Elle s’approvisionne à  KOLONDIEBA. Elle vend au comptant  et parfois à crédit à une clientèle mixte.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 10 000FCFA.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Sigimame Group are married women who are, on average, 39 years old, and have four children.  They all live in polygamous families in Kolondieba, one of the prefectures of the third administrative region of Mali.

The women want to work continuously to improve their businesses, so they work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  This will be their sixth loan and they intend to repay it correctly.

Korotoumou (second from the right in the photo) will use her loan to buy two sacks of maize.  She sells her product at the Kolondieba daily market and buys more stock in Kolondieba as well.  She has various customers and sells mostly for cash, although occasionally she offers sales on credit.

Korotoumou expects to earn a monthly average of 10,000 francs CFA, which she will use to repay her loan and help her husband with the day-to-day expenses of their household.

loans.use: to buy cereals for resale.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Ruth quien con su credikiva respondió a todos sus pedidos, aumentando sus ventas, su capital de trabajo y sus utilidades. Su negocio se ha fortalecido y los ingresos familiares se han incrementado. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva que le servirá como fondo de efectivo para responder a la demanda de productos escolares y alusivos al carnaval, teniendo en cuenta que es una alta temporada para todos los artículos alusivos  a estas épocas de fiesta y estudio. Ella envía un menaje a los financiadores de Kiva : Estoy muy agradecida con Kiva y con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, porque he mejorado gracias a su apoyo los ingreso familiares , pido a ustedes que sigan apoyándome.
texts.en:
Thank you for supporting Ruth who, with her Kiva loan, was able to fulfil all her orders thus increasing her sales, her working capital and her profits. Her business has been strengthened and her family income has increased.

Currently she is applying for a new Kiva loan which will act as cash flow to meet the demand for school products and items for the carnival, bearing in mind that this is a peak time for all these items for carnival and the school year. 

She sends a message to the Kiva lenders: "I am very grateful to Kiva and the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, because thanks to your help I have increased my family's income. I ask you to continue supporting me."

loans.use: to buy school products and items for the carnival.

loans.name: Camilo

texts.es:
Camilo tiene 63 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Pimpingos una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

La actividad que realiza cliente es la cría y comercialización de ganado vacuno, posee dos reses de su propiedad, también cultiva café, ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra dos toretes para posteriormente engordarlos y ofrecerlos a un mejor precio y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Camilo, 63, lives with his wife and children in the district of Pimpingos, a community dedicated to agriculture, commerce and livestock farming located in the Cutervo Province which belongs ot the Cajamarca Region in the northern mountain range of Peru.

The borrower raises and sells livestock.  He owns two head of cattle and also grows coffee.  He is requesting a loan in the amount of 3,000 PEN to buy two young bulls to raise and sell at a good price.  His aim is to generate more income for the family.

loans.use: To buy two young bulls to raise and sell.

loans.name: Sewa Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages polygamiques, les cinq  membres du groupe Sewa ont en moyenne 38 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Dravéla Bolibana un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Dravéla. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’habits (brodés, pagnes wax…), d’encens, du lait en poudre, du sucre et des mayonnaises. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Sitan en 2ème position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse des habits (brodés, pagnes wax et bazins).  Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  5 pièces de pagnes brodés, 10 pièces de pagnes wax  à  Bamako. La revente se fait en détail au marché et en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Sitan compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 60 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Mostly married in monogamous households, the five members of the Sewa group are on average 38 years old with three children. They all live in Dravela Bolibana, one of Bamako's districts, and became acquainted through neighborhood ties and their income-generating activities at the Dravela market.

Group members trade clothing (embroidered pagnes, pagnes wax and bazin fabrics), incense, powdered milk, sugar and mayonnaise. To increase their stock-in-trade, the group decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first group loan cycle.

Ms. Sitan (second person from left to right in the picture) is a great vendor of clothing (embroidered pagnes, pagnes wax and bazin fabrics). She intends to use her loan to buy 5 lengths of embroidered pagnes and 10 lengths of pagne wax (colorful West-African fabric) in Bamako. Retail sales are conducted at the market and as an itinerant vendor to a clientele composed mostly of women.

With this loan Ms. Sitan hopes to achieve average monthly profits of 60,000 CFA francs, to be reinvested in the business and used to meet household needs

loans.use: buy clothing

loans.name: Alimatou

texts.fr:
ALIMATOU est née vers 1969 à KADIANA, commune de KADIANA une des sous-préfectures de la 3ème Région administrative du Mali .Mme ALIMATOU est mère de 4 enfants. Mme ALIMATOU réside à KOLONDIEBA avec son mari polygame.
Mme ALIMATOU s’est vite intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat et vente de chaussures et de pagnes wax .Sa vente se fait à KADIANA au marché et chez elle à la maison.  
Forte de  ses 5 années d’expérience dans le domaine, elle collabore avec Soro Yiriwaso pour augmenter  son fonds de commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cesse de grandir et est à son  premier  prêt.
Mme ALIMATOU compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 100 paires de chaussures  et 30 pagnes wax. Elle s’approvisionne à BAMAKO. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant et quelques fois à crédit. Sa clientèle est mixte.
Mme ALIMATOU espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 50 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Alimatou was born around 1969 in Kadiana, one of the sub-prefectures of the third administrative region of Mali.  She has four children and lives in Kolondieba with her polygamous husband.  She began selling shoes and wax pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing) at a young age, from her home and at the market in Kadiana.  

She has five years' experience in her business, and has decided to work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso, to improve her working capital.  This will enable her to respond to the ever-increasing demands of her customers.  Alimatou will use this, her first loan, to buy 100 pairs of shoes and 30 wax pagnes.  She buys her supplies in Bamako, and sells to various customers for cash or on credit.

Alimatou hopes to earn a monthly profit of 50,000 francs CFA, which she will use to repay her loan, reinvest in her business and provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy shoes and wax pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing) for resale.

loans.name: Amadou

texts.fr:
AMADOU  est né vers 1977 à DEBENA, commune de KADIANA, une des sous-préfectures de la 3ème Région administrative du Mali .Mr AMADOU a  3 femmes et 6 enfants. Il réside à DEBENA.
Mr AMADOU s’est vite intéressé aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat et vente de sucres, cigarette etc, puis de la farine pour sa boulangerie .Sa vente se fait à DEBENA.  
Fort de  ses 10 années d’expérience dans le domaine, il collabore avec Soro Yiriwaso pour augmenter  son fonds de commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cesse de grandir et est à son  premier  prêt.
Mr AMADOU compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 sacs de sucres, 2 cartons composés de différentes marques de cigarettes, et 5 sacs de farines de blé. Il s’approvisionne à KADIANA et à TENGRELA .Il effectue ses ventes au comptant et quelques fois à crédit au marché et à la maison. Sa clientèle est mixte.
Mr AMADOU espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Amadou was born around 1977 in Debena in the commune of Kadiana, one of the sub-prefectures of the third administrative region of Mali.  He has three wives and six children, and they live in Debena.  At an early age, Amadou began earning money by buying and selling sugar, cigarettes, etc.  Later on he also bought and sold flour.  He makes his sales in Debena, and has ten years' experience in his business.

Amadou has decided to work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso, in order to increase his working capital and satisfy the increasing demands of his customers.  This will be his first loan, and he will buy two sacks of sugar, two boxes of mixed brand cigarettes and five sacks of wheat flour.  He buys his supplies in Kadiana and Tengrela, and sells from door-to-door and at the market, for cash or on credit.  He has a varied customer base.

Amadou hopes to earn 40,000 francs CFA a month, and will use this to repay his loan, reinvest in his business and provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy various items for resale.

loans.name: Norvel

texts.es:
Norvel tiene 23 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Santo Domingo de la Capilla, una comunidad con paisajes verdes, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de café desde hace 6 años, ha solicitado un préstamo de 4 000 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos y pago de mano de obra por el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café y de esta manera ofrecer una producción oportuna para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Norvel is 23 years old. He lives with his wife and children in the district of Santo Domingo de la Capilla. It is a community with green landscapes. Its residents work in agriculture, trade and livestock. It is located in the Cutervo province, which belongs to the Cajamarca region in the northern sierra of Peru.  

He works in agriculture, especially in growing coffee for the last 6 years. He has asked for a loan of 4 000 nuevos soles to buy fertilizer and to pay for labor costs for maintenance on the coffee crop. This way, he can offer a timely yield for his customers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his coffee crop

location.town: Santo Domingo de la Capilla - Cutervo - Cajamarca

loans.name: Benkola Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe BENKOLA sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  33 ans, 3enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à KOLONDIEBA, une des préfectures de la 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités à tout moment. Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt avec l’institution et compte bien le rembourser.
Mme RAMATOU  (2ème sur la photo de la droite  à la gauche) compte acheter avec son prêt 1 sac d’atiéké avec 5 kg de poissons. Elle vend ses plats alimentaires quotidiennement au marché, à la maison et de  façon ambulante  dans la ville de KOLONDIEBA et est très sollicitée surtout le jour de foire. Elle s’approvisionne à KOLONDIEBA. Elle vend au comptant et parfois à crédit à une clientèle mixte.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 10 000FCFA.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of Benkola Group are married women who average 33 years of age and 3 children. They all live in polygamous families in Kolondieba, a prefecture in the third administrative region of Mali.

They work with Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, in order to carry out their activities throughout the year. They are seeking their ninth loan from the MFI, and definitely intend to repay it.

Mrs. Ramatou is the second woman from the right on the photograph. She intends to use her loan to buy 1 sack of "atiéké" (grated fermented cassava pulp) and 5 kg of fish.

She sells the dishes she prepares daily at the market, at her home, or as a traveling saleswoman in Kolondieba City. She's very much in demand, especially on fair days.

She gets her supplies in Kolondieba. She sells for cash, and sometimes on credit, to a mixed-gender clientele. She intends to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 10'000 (ca US$ 21), which will enable her to repay the loan and also to help her husband cover daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy one sack of "atiéké" (grated fermented cassava pulp) and 5 kg of fish

loans.name: Jenny Elizabeth

texts.es:
En una localidad llamada Tierras Amarillas del cantón Rocafuerte cada quince días  se reúnen las socias del Grupo de Crédito Mejorando El Futuro, este sector es conocido por su agricultura ya que gran parte de sus habitantes se dedican a los sembríos de ciclo corto.
En este lugar vive la señora Jenny, tiene 26 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 11 y 6 años que estudian en escuela. El marido es comerciante. 
Doña Jenny es una mujer muy luchadora que le gusta ganar con su trabajo y con esto ayudarle  a su marido con la dura carga de sacar adelante sus hijos y su hogar, ella desde hace 8 años atrás se dedica a la fabricación y venta de dulces, esta es una tradición que la aprendió de su mamá y le está dando muy buenos ingresos ya que sus dulces son deliciosos, ella prepara sus dulces y luego las entrega a comerciantes que los venden en diferentes lugares de la provincia. Esta forma ella contribuye con sus ingresos para sacara adelante a sus hijos.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar azúcar, harina y otros víveres para la preparación de los dulces. Está desde el inicio en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta por los beneficios que recibe de la institución. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In a community called Tierras Amarillas of the Rocafuerte canton, the members of the credit group Mejorando El Futuro meet every two weeks. This sector is known for its agriculture because a big part of its inhabitants work in short cycle agriculture.  

This is where Jenny lives. She is 26 and is in a common law marriage from which she has two children, aged 11 and 6. They are in school. Her husband is a merchant. Jenny is a woman who is a fighter. She likes to earn from her work and help her husband with the difficult burden of the home and getting their children ahead. For 8 years, she has worked making and selling sweets. This is a tradition that she learned from her mother and it is bringing in good income because her sweets are delicious. She makes them and then delivers them to merchants who sell in different parts of the province. In this way, she contributes with her income to get her children ahead.  

She will use this loan to buy sugar, flour and other grocery items to make the sweets. She has been in the credit group since the beginning and she likes it because of the benefits she receives from the institution. Her dream is to give her children the best.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour and other grocery items.

loans.name: Seybou

texts.fr:
SEYBOU est né vers 1983 à KADIANA, commune de KADIANA, une des sous-préfectures de la 3ème Région administrative du Mali .Mr SEYBOU est monogame avec un enfant. Il réside à KADIANA avec sa femme dans une famille traditionnelle.
Mr SEYBOU s’est vite intéressé aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat et vente d’aluminium et à la fabrication des ustensiles de cuisine.Sa vente se fait au marché et à son atelier.  
Fort de  ses 12 années d’expérience dans le domaine, il collabore avec Soro Yiriwaso pour augmenter  son fonds de commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cesse de grandir et est à son  premier  prêt.
Mr SEYBOU compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 300 kilogrammes d’aluminium. Il s’approvisionne à BAMAKO. Il effectue ses ventes au comptant et quelques fois à crédit au marché. Sa clientèle est composée d’hommes.
Mr SEYBOU espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Seybou was born around 1983 in Kadiana, one of the sub-prefectures of the third administrative region of Mali.  He is a monogamous man, who is married and has one child.  He lives with his wife in a traditional family.  At an early age, Seybou began earning money.  He buys aluminium to make kitchen utensils, which he sells at the market and from his workshop.

Seybou has twelve years' experience in his business and has decided to work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso, to improve his working capital and respond to the increasing demands of his customers.  He will use this, his first loan, to buy 300 kgs of aluminium from Bamako.  He sells the kitchen utensils at the market for cash, or sometimes on credit.  Most of his customers are men.

Seybou hopes to earn 75,000 francs CFA a month, and will use this to repay his loan, reinvest in his business and provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy aluminium to make kitchen utensils for sale.

loans.name: Aminata's Group

texts.fr:
Badeya est un regroupement de femmes de Médine-coura de Koutiala qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 30 ans et ont au moins 3 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que, de Pagnes, Sucres, Gâteaux, Savons  et divers. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso pour la première fois.
Aminata 1 ère debout de la  gauche vers la droite est une vendeuse de Savons. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des savons en quantité et en qualité. Elle se procure de ces savons à Koutiala. Elle les vend à la maison et au marché à une clientèle diverse. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Badeya comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 90 000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Aminata compte réaliser  105 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
Badeya is a group of women from Médine-coura in Koutiala.  They live in large traditional families with their husbands, children and other relatives.  They are, on average, 30 years old and have at least three children.  

The women sell various items, such as pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing), sugar, cakes and soaps.  The group members would like to increase the size of their businesses so they have decided to work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.

Aminata (standing on the far left in the photo) sells soaps.  She will use her loan to buy a large quantity of high quality soaps in Koutiala.  She sells her product at home or at the market to various customers.

Most of the group members expect to earn an average of 90,000 francs CFA over the loan cycle, but Aminata expects to earn 105,000 francs CFA.  The women will use their earnings to repay their loans, provide for their personal expenses and increase their working capital.  They would like to continue to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso to ensure the continuation of their stock levels.

loans.use: to buy soaps for resale.

loans.name: Gilma Guadalupe

texts.es:
En una localidad llamada Tierras Amarillas del cantón Rocafuerte cada quince días  se reúnen las socias del Grupo de Crédito Mejorando El Futuro, este sector es conocido por su agricultura ya que gran parte de sus habitantes se dedican a los sembríos de ciclo corto.
En este lugar vive la señora Gilma, tiene 54 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 3 hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.
Doña Gilma realiza el crédito para su esposo, el mismo que  se dedica a la agricultura, el siembra arroz y verduras en toda época del año y  maíz en la época invernal ya que estos los siembra en terrenos altos, en cambio el arroz y las verduras siembra en terrenos adecuados para el riego, el cuenta con bombas llevan el agua desde el rio que está cerca hasta sus cultivos,  por lo general son tres cosechas de estos productos que realiza al año y es de esta forma que ellos logran salir adelante gracias a los frutos que les da la tierra, con su marido trabajan dos o tres personas en el cuidado y desbrote de los cultivos por lo cual su marido les paga un sueldo y esta personas con su trabajo también pueden llevar el pan diario a sus   hogares. 
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar fertilizantes y para pagar mano de obra para trabajos en los cultivos. Este es su tercer ciclo en el Grupo de Crédito. Sus sueños es tener una muy buena cosecha.
texts.en:
In a community called Tierras Amarillas of the Rocafuerte canton, the credit group Mejorando El Futuro meets every two weeks. This area is known for its agriculture, because a big parts of its residents grow short cycle crops.

This is where Gilma lives. She is 54 years old. She is married and from her marriage has 3 children who are grown and on their own. Her husband works in agriculture.  

Gilma took the loan out for her husband. He works in agriculture, growing rice and other vegetables all year long, and corn in the winter, because that is planted on higher land. The rice and the vegetables are planted on land that can be irrigated. He has water pumps that bring the water from the river that is near his crops. In general, there are three crops that he has every year and this is how they are able to get ahead, thanks to the fruits of the earth. Her husband works with two or three people caring for and harvesting the crops. Her husband pays them wages and these people can also bring home the daily bread with their work.  
 
She is going to use this loan to buy fertilizers and pay for labor for the crops. This is her third cycle in the credit group. Her dream is to have a good harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labor.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is 56 years old and blessed with five children. They live in a village, planting and harvesting rice and vegetables to sell. She also engages in a hog-raising business to have an additional source of income. 

She aims to acquire more pigs to raise, but she has insufficient capital. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of PHP50,000 to buy hog feed, vitamins, vaccines and additional piglets to raise. 

Through this loan, she is confident that she will be able to improve the business and make it more profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, vitamins, vaccines and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Soumaila

texts.fr:
SOUMAILA est né vers 1971 à SIKORO, commune de KADIANA, une des sous- préfectures de la 3ème Région administrative du Mali .Mr SOUMAILA a  2 femmes et 6  enfants. Il réside à SIKORO dans une famille nucléaire.
Mr SOUMAILA s’est vite intéressé aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat et vente de céréales et darticles divers de boutique.Sa vente se fait à SIKORO.  
Fort de  ses 15 années d’expérience dans le domaine, il collabore avec Soro Yiriwaso pour augmenter  son fonds de commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cesse de grandir et est à son  premier prêt.
Mr  SOUMAILA compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10 sacs de mais et 10 sacs de mil et 3 sacs de sorgho. Il s’approvisionne à SIKORO et environnants .Il effectue ses ventes au comptant et quelques fois à crédit au marché et à la maison. Sa clientèle est mixte.
Mr SOUMAILA espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Soumaila was born around 1971 in Sikoro, Kadiana commune, one of the sub-prefectures of the third administrative region of Mali.  He has two wives and six children, and lives in a nuclear family in Sikoro.  He began earning money at a young age, by buying and selling cereals and various items in his shop in Sikoro.

Soumaila has fifteen years' experience in his business and has decided to work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso, in order to increase his working capital.  This will enable him to satisfy the increasing demands of his customers.  Soumaila will use this, his first loan, to buy ten sacks of maize, ten sacks of millet and three sacks of sorghum from Sikoro and the surrounding area.  He sells to various customers for cash or credit at the market or at home.

Soumaila hopes to earn 40,000 francs CFA a month, and will use this to repay his loan, reinvest in his business and provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy cereals for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more goods and renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Parda

texts.en:
Parda has more than 15 years of experience in the farming business. He lives with his family in a rural area. Parda is married, and has six children; two of them are not adults. 

Parda began his own business growing vegetables 15 years ago. He grows maize and wheat, and he has his own land. He works from early morning till late evening. His wife and son help him to grow vegetables. 

Parda is going to make new sowing. He is asking for a loan of 1,800 Somoni to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer. 

He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more products for her business to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the fee to register her degree.

loans.name: Clarice

texts.en:
Clarice is a 29-year-old married woman. She has four children, with ages ranging from 8 to 10 years. She describes herself to be honest and God-fearing.
