Clarice operates a tailoring shop where she makes clothes to sell. She has been involved in this business for two years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a shortage of tailoring material. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. 

Her business goal is to expand within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM; she will use the anticipated profits to open other businesses.

loans.use: buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Jose Eduardo

texts.es: Jose de 33 años de edad vive en casa de un familiar con su esposa y su hijo, es un hombre luchador y responsable para que a su familia no le falte lo necesario para la subsistencia. Actualmente trabaja vendiendo comida cerca de su lugar de residencia desde hace 2 años tiene mucha clientela fija pues da a un buen precio el plato de comida, Jose desea ampliar su puesto es decir comprar mesas, sillas, mas materia prima para variar su menú como carne, pollos, arroz, frijoles, verduras, frutas, etc.  y tener un poco de mas entrada económicamente, pero no cuenta con los suficientes ingresos para esta inversión,es por eso que solicita un crédito para comprar lo dicho; y asi obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia lo necesario sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
José, 33, lives with his wife and son in the house of a relative. He is a hardworking and responsible man who makes sure his family has what it needs. He has been working selling food close to where he lives for two years and has many fixed costumers due to his good prices.

José wants to expand his business. He wants to buy more tables, chairs and more ingredients (meat, chicken, rice, beans, vegetables, fruits, etc.). He hopes that this will result in better profits. However, he does not have enough to make this investment, which is why he is requesting a loan. With a better income he will be able to give his family what they need to live comfortably.

loans.use: to buy chairs, tables and ingredients (meat, chicken, rice, beans, vegetables, fruits, etc.).

loans.name: Inocencia

texts.en:
Inocencia is a farmer from Sikatuna, Bohol. She is a married woman and a mother of an eight-year-old child. She has been in the rice farming business for more than five years now; she helps her husband in tilling their field. Inocencia is also engaged in a hog-raising business.

Inocencia is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for the farm and additional piglets to raise. With this, she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm, thus augmenting her harvest and yield.

In the future, Inocencia hopes to make her business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her daughter.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the farm and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Sheila May

texts.en:
Sheila May is 26 years old and married with two children; both are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Sheila May runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for three years, and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Sheila May would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a businesswoman who is very hardworking. She is married with seven children; two are in school and the rest are adults. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Josephine has operated a charcoal selling business for the past four years. Her potential clients are neighbours and passersby. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase bags of charcoal to sell. 

She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Husein

texts.en:
Husein is a 23-year-old single man who has been working as a barber for nine years. He was only 14 years old when he started working as a barber to financially support his beloved family.

In 2009, Husein established his own business and started developing it gradually to fit customer's needs and requests. Today, Husein has a good base of work, and he is working hard to develop and expand it properly by developing his talents, and providing his customers with the best services requested.

Husein is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to continue making necessary maintenance to his parents' house to keep it a healthy living place for his beloved family members.

He is anxiously looking forward to his dream of finishing the building of his dream house in order to get married and make his own small family.

loans.use: To continue making necessary maintenance to his parents' house.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is 36 years old and from Nakuru. She is married to Benjamin, and they are blessed with four children aged 15, 13, 10 and 6 years old.

She has been running her dairy farming business for the last 10 years. 

To enable her buy one more dairy cow and animal feed, she has applied for her first loan of KES. 100,000 from Vision Fund Kenya.

Her monthly income right now is KES. 30,000, and her intention is to use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to educate her children.

In the future, she hopes to be a successful dairy farmer.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and animal feed

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is asking for a loan because she believes that through it she will improve her business.
 
The previous loan enabled her to save money from her retail kiosk business. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, rice, and meat for her business.

She feels that she was able to make a good investment with her previous loan, which to date has allowed her to maintain her level of profits to help her family cover their personal expenses

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, rice, and meat for her business.

loans.name: Tunikby

texts.en:
Tunikby is from a rural area. She grows potatoes, maize, rice, nuts, etc. She began her business deal in this field five years ago. She lives in an old house with her husband and four children. 

The family gathers their main income from farming; she makes sowing twice in a year. Tunikby is going to make new sowing, but she has no money to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer. 

She is asking for a loan of 1,500 Somoni to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer. 

Tunikby is going to improve her living conditions from the profit. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Sheena Lowe

texts.en: Sheena Lowe is studying in a university taking up Bachelor of Science in Business Administration. She has used her previous loans from GDMPC to meet her school tuition fees and other expenses. She is now ready for her graduation day. She had needed money recently to pay her graduation expenses and she took another loan. She is hopes to become successful in the near future and to be able to help her family meet their needs and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: for graduation fees.

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en: Leonard is a 35-year-old married man. He has one child who is a year old. He describes himself to be versatile. He operates a retail business where he sells animal feed and animal drugs. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a secure place. He describes his biggest business challenge to be increased operational costs. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of animal feed and animal drugs. His business goal is to double revenue within 5 years. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees.

loans.use: buy more stock of animal feed and animal drugs.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a cafeteria business in the Philippines. 

Rosalinda successfully paid back her previous loan, and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. She is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional items like sugar, coffee and other ingredients for her cafeteria business.

NWTF is re-listing Rosalinda's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like sugar, coffee and other ingredients.

loans.name: Risper

texts.en:
Meet Risper, a farmer living in the highlands of Litein. She is married and has two small children, both of whom are of school-going age. She has been doing farming for four years, which she enjoys very much.  Her major income sources are milk and crops like vegetables. Her biggest challenge is a lack of sufficient funds.

Risper chose Juhudi Kilimo for this poultry loan because they process their loans faster.

During the training, she learned that it is very important to develop a culture of saving.

Through this loan, her income will increase and thus she be able to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Donika

texts.en:
Donika’s house is not far from the beach; during the summer time, she rents two apartment units in her house to people who go to her village for vacation. 

She is requesting this loan because she wants to furnish these units; specifically, she plans to buy refrigerators and install doors. 

In addition to this little seasonal activity of renting out rooms for summer, she sells fruits (pears and figs) and veggies (tomatoes, cucumbers, peppers and eggplants) to vacationers along the beach. Her husband works in construction; he gets paid on an hourly basis. 

Donika is 38, and a married mother of four children; the oldest is12 and the youngest is 2.

loans.use: to install doors and buy refrigerators for the rooms that she rents out for the summer

loans.name: Myriam

texts.en:
Myriam is a 51-year-old married mother of seven children. She has been running her convenience store for the past ten years to support her beloved husband in covering their family's daily needs.

Myriam is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to add special spring and summer beverages to the merchandise she sells. Her business is going on just fine, but just like any small business, it needs additional support to expand and develop properly. This loan will help her to respond to her customers' needs and requests.

loans.use: To purchase special spring and summer beverages to sell in her store

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 42-years-old and married with one kid who is in school.  She works very hard to provide for them.

Emily runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Emily has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future Emily would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Gulruhsor

texts.en: Gulrukhsor began her own business with selling children’s clothes 19 years ago. She was young and it was so difficult for her to manage the business. Thanks to her hard work and patience, she developed her business little by little. She sells children's clothes in the local market. Her experience and skills help her to develop the business. She renews the assortment of her goods every season. Gulrukhsor is going to buy goods for the new spring season but she does not have enough money. She is a careful mother of four children. She is going to improve the living conditions for her children. She is asking for a loan of 11,000 Somoni to buy children’s clothes for the new season. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy children's clothes for the new season

loans.name: Chinyavu

texts.en:
Chinyavu is a married woman who has been blessed with six children, all of whom go to school. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Chinyavu has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and villagers. Her greatest monthly challenge is the high cost of transportation.

She is requesting for a loan to purchase charcoal for resale. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Fridah

texts.en:
Fridah is 55 years old and from Nyahururu. She is married to Samuel, who earns income for the family. They have five children, all of whom are adults. They are aged 36, 34, 33, 25 and 20.

Fridah is in the business of poultry raising. She has been in operation for the past two years. She has applied for her second loan of 45,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya. Her plan is to use it to buy more chickens and chicken feed. 

Her monthly income from her business at the moment is 18,000 KES. Her hope and dream for the future is to be financially stable and buy a plot and build rental houses.

loans.use: to buy more chickens and feed for them.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.es: Rogelio de 35 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus hijos, el se dedica a la pesca artesanal desde hace 14 años, comercializa sus productos en los mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra sacar adelante a su familia, Rogelio esta solicitando un credito para la compra de redes, trasmayos y un motor nuevo para la lancha para poder continuar con su trabajo y asi poder obtener mas ventas para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rogelio, who is 35 years old, lives in his own house with his wife and children. For the last 14 years he has earned a living as a traditional fisherman. He sells his catch in the markets around his home and with the money he makes from his sales he is able to bring his family up.

Rogelio is asking for a loan to buy nets, drift nets and a new motor for the boat so he can continue with his work and so make more sales so he can give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy nets, drift nets and a new motor for the boat.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en: Estrella has managed her own cafeteria for more than three years earning well for the family. With her generated revenue, she was able to improve her business and repay her previous loan successfully, which was used for the business. Recently, she took a new loan from GDMPC to purchase additional pots, utensils and raw ingredients to prepare food to cater to more costumers. Her dream of improving the business is at hand as a result of her determination to make it and she is supported faithfully by her husband. In the future, she wants to improve her business as well as the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase additional pots, utensils and raw ingredients

loans.name: Selinah

texts.en:
Selinah is married and has nine children, four of whom attend school and the rest of whom are adults. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees for her children.

For the past four years, she has operated a bodaboda (motorcycle) transport business. Her potential customers are town dwellers. She cites the high cost of maintenance as her major challenge.

With this loan, she wants to purchase another motorcycle to expand her business. She joined Yehu to access loans to improve her living standards

loans.use: to purchase another motorcycle to expand her business.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is a single man. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

He has operated a kiosk business from home for the past four years, selling to passersby and neighbours. 

With this loan, he wants to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, rice, sugar, and detergents.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, sugar, detergents, and rice

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is a farmer from Sikatuna, Bohol. She is a married woman and the mother of seven children. Aida has been in the farming business for more than 15 years now. This is the source of her income.

Aida is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for the farm and rice thresher machine. With this, she will be able to improve the productivity of her rice farm thus augmenting her harvest and yield. In the future, Aida hopes to make her farming business a success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the farm and rice thresher machine.

loans.name: Agripina

texts.en:
Agripina is a married woman and a mother of three grown children from Sikatuna, Bohol. She has been engaged in a rice farming  business with her husband for more than 15 years now. Agripina is asking for a loan for her farm. She needs a loan to buy fertilizer and to pay for labor costs. With this, she will be able to grow healthy rice, thus, improving the productivity of her  farm.

In the future, Agripina hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for labor costs

loans.name: Evezel Aisley

texts.en: Evezel Aisley is on her way to reach her goal. Her previous loan from GDMPC helped a lot to cover tuition fees and other expenses. Her graduation day is fast approaching and she needs money to pay the balance of her tuition fees and needed graduation expenses. She borrowed a new loan again to cover all her expenses needed in order to comply with all the requirements and other charges. She is thankful to GDMPC for being a part of her journey.

loans.use: to pay the balance of her tuition fees and needed graduation expenses.

loans.name: Jumagul

texts.ru: Жумагул 42 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. Старшая дочь-замужем, остальные -школьного возраста. У Жумагул - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Жумагул занимается животноводством, стартовав 16 лет назад, с покупки скота на 20,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Жумагул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы. Ежемесячный доход составляет 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жумагул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Жумагул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en: Jumagul is 42 and married with four children. Her oldest daughter is married and the others are still in school. Jumagul has a high school education and works in animal husbandry as the primary source of income for her family, a business she began 16 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 20,000 KGS. Thanks to her hard work, Jumagul now has three milking cows and a monthly income of 20,000 KGS. With the goal of further developing her business, Jumagul has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan to purchase cows and increase her head count of livestock. She plans to invest profits from the loan into acquiring more livestock and to save toward her children's education.

loans.use: to buy cows for her animal husbandry business

loans.name: May Joy

texts.en: May Joy is 25-years-old and single. She lives in a rural community and helps her parents by gaining income through buying and reselling fruits and vegetables. She dreams of becoming successful and financially stable in order to have a bright future. To achieve her goal, she plans to improve and strengthen her business in order to increase her income. Having inadequate capital, she is asking for a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy more stock of native products, fruits and vegetables to sell. Through hard work and strong determination, she believes that she will be able to achieve her goal in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock of native products, fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DEMBAGNOUMA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 41 ans, et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Solomanibougou, commune de Marka-coungo, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiment, de charbon, de l’essence, et la farine boulangère. Les femmes du groupe DEMBAGNOUMA sont à leur premier prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente SIRA la personne assise est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse d’essence. Elle compte acheter 115 litres d’essence chez les grossistes à Marka coungo. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 26 000Fcfa, qui sera réinjecté dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The women of the Dembagnouma group are married and are, on average, 41 years old and have three children.  They all live in traditional families in the village of Solomanibougou, Marka-counga commune, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  They know one another through family, friendship and neighbourhood connections.

The women sell food ingredients, charcoal, fuel and baking flour.  They would like to be able to satisfy the enormous demand of their customers, so they have decided to work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.   This will be their first group loan, and they will use it to buy the merchandise already mentioned.

Sira (sitting at the front of the photo) is illiterate.  She sells fuel and will use her loan to buy 115 litres of fuel from wholesalers in Marka-coungo.  She sells the fuel to various customers for cash, from her home.  Sira expects to earn 26,000 francs CFA a month which she will reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy fuel for resale.

loans.name: Gulnigor

texts.en:
Gulnigor is 37 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in the south part of Tajikistan. As a responsible parent, she operates her own business selling fabrics in a local market, which she has been doing for five years. She uses the profit from her business for the well being of her children. 

Gulnigor  requested a loan from IMON for 8,000 Somoni, which she will use to buy fabrics for the new season as she renews her assortment of goods every season. She hopes to see her children as highly educated people in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics for the new season

loans.name: Tania Yobanny

texts.es:
TANIA, hace 4 años, inicia una idea de negocio con la venta de gelatina, helados, hielo, agua y queso en su casa ubicada en un barrio muy vulnerable de Borbon. ha tenido deseos de tener una tienda grande donde sus clientes puedan encontrar muchos productos. Con este crédito ella comprara arroz, azúcar, panela, leche, yogurt, aceite, huevos, queso, plátano, papas, papel sanitario y otros productos para ponerse una tienda en casa. 
Tania tiene 4 niños y   1 niña que van a la escuela regularmente, Tania es muy dinámica y de carácter algo fuerte. Ella desea ver su tienda muy grande y dar empleo a la gente de su barrio.
texts.en:
Tania started her business idea four years ago selling gelatine, ice cream, ice, water and cheese from her home in a very vulnerable area of Borbon. Her hope has been to have a large shop where her customers can find all kinds of products.

She will use the loan to buy rice, sugar, brown sugar, milk, yoghurt, oil, eggs, cheese, bananas, potatoes, toilet paper and other products so she can set up a shop in her home. 

Tania has 4 boys and a girl who go to school regularly. She is very dynamic and quite a strong character. She wants to see her shop become much bigger and employ people from her local neighbourhood.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, brown sugar, milk, yoghurt, oil, eggs, cheese, bananas, potatoes and toilet paper.

loans.name: Mazen

texts.en:
Mazen is a 27-year-old single man who has been working at selling mobile phones, accessories, and prepaid cards for the past five years. In 2012, he opened his own shop to increase his income and develop his living situation. 

Mazen is applying for a YOUTH loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, in order to increase his mobile phones and prepaid cards capital. 

He is very excited about this loan, and he hopes that he can keep on replying to his customers' needs, since his previously acquired loan helped a lot in developing his business and increasing his income. 

Most of his customers are his neighbors, friends, and relatives. As for the future, Mazen is intending to keep on expanding his business, to improve his social and financial living situation, and to plan to make a small family of his own in the future.

loans.use: to increase his mobile phones and prepaid cards capital

loans.name: Pearl Valerie

texts.en: Pearl Valerie is a kind daughter who wants to become successful in the future. Her father works as a meter reader in an electric cooperative, while her mother is a private employee. Her parents are very proud of her achievements in making her studies successful. She is nearly done with her accountancy course. She need financial assistance to cover graduation fees and charges. She is thankful to GDMPC for making students' dreams successful and bearable.

loans.use: to cover graduation fees and charges

loans.name: Mijgona

texts.en:
Mijgona is a young and successful lady. She is a 27-year-old who is married and bringing up two little children. She needs a source of income because her husband’s income is small. She decided to organize her own business with selling food items such as oil, beans, rice, etc. She will buy goods from a central market in bulk, and retail them in a local market of her region. 

She took part in a women's organization course called "To Get Ahead" and got a certificate. She will be a good business lady, as she is a hardworking woman. Her mother will help her with managing the business. 

She is asking for a loan of 12,500 Somoni to buy oil, beans, rice, etc. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy oil, beans, rice, etc., for organizing a new business

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is a married woman with seven children, six of whom attend school and one of whom is an adult. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For over four years, she has operated a water selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality, especially during the rainy season.

With the loan, she wants to purchase water pipes to repair leaking pipes. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase water pipes to repair leaking pipes.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married woman with five children, two of whom attend school, while two are underage, and one is an adult. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For over two years, she has operated a fruits and vegetables stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of establishing a grocery store in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase stock of green vegetables, fruits, tomatoes, potatoes and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of green vegetables, fruits, tomatoes, potatoes and onions.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah appreciates the previous loan, which helped her to buy potatoes, tomatoes, onions and fruit for sale. She comes to you here again asking for a loan to buy a variety of vegetables, onions, tomatoes and fruits for sale. 

The business has enabled her to support her family well.

loans.use: to buy a variety of vegetables, onions, tomatoes and fruits for sale

loans.name: Encarnacion

texts.es: Don Encarnación es originario de la comarca Acedades en la ciudad de Boaco, casado y padre de cinco hijos ya independientes. Tiene 64 años de edad. Es de oficio Agricultor, se dedica a la siembra de Trigo, Maíz y Frijoles. Inicio su negocio con un pequeño huerto para consumo familiar y venta a sus vecinos más cercanos, poco a poco fue obteniendo ganancias y logro así comprar parcelas para la siembra de Trigo, Maíz y Frijoles. Su meta próxima es preparar el terreno para la nueva siembra del ciclo agrícola. Solicita el crédito para alquilar media manzana de propiedad. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá realizar la siembra y obtener mejores ganancias. Su plan futuro es realizar nuevas siembras y mejorar su situación económica.
texts.en:
Encarnación is originally from the Acedades region in the city of Boaco. He is married and has five adult children. He is 64 years old.

He is a farmer and grows wheat, corn, and beans. He began his business with a small garden that he used for personal consumption and also sold the products to neighbors. Little by little, he earned money and was able to purchase land to grow wheat, corn, and beans. 

His next goal is to prepare the land for the next planting cycle. He requests this loan to rent a half of a manzana (about 1/3 of a hectare) of land. He believes that the loan will help him a lot to plant crops and earn more money.

His plan for the future is to plant new crops and improve his financial situation.

loans.use: to rent about 1/3 of a hectare of land.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 39-year-old Isatu from Goderich Western rural area in Freetown. She is married and has three children. She began her business because she wants to improve her standard of living.  

Isatu runs a retails business. She sells palm oil. She has been running this business for 10 years. She works at the business 12 hours per day, six days per week. Isatu says that the main challenge to her business is the poor road network within her operation area.

Isatu has requested a loan in order to purchase more gallons of palm oil to expand her business. The extra income from this loan will allow her to take care of her family's welfare and repay her loan. 

In the future, she plans to open a big food store. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Ismail

texts.en:
Ismail is a widowed father of two children, 30 and 24, who have immigrated to neighboring countries. His neighbors speak very highly of him, according to the loan officer. He practices agriculture as a means for income and also rents out part of the loam he owns. He plants fodder for animals in quantities and sells some.

Plum orchards and grapevines are among his favorite fruit crops, so this is where most of his focus has been for some time now.  “Plum trees do moderately well, although they usually only produce every other year and offer merely not more than ten kilograms of fruit per tree,” said Ismail, smiling.

Ismail wants to plant fodder with the loan that he is requesting from VFA and Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to plant fodder for animals.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Encontramos a Francisca lavando ropa en el rio de Borbón.  Ella es clienta de Fodemi y se dedica desde hace mucho tiempo a la crianza y venta de pollos.
Francisca vive con su hija y su yerno, quienes tienen un hijo de un mes de nacido.
Ella desea comprar 300 pollos y balanceado, para criarlos y luego venderlos en los asaderos de la ciudad y las tiendas del barrio.
Ella dice que siempre ha vendido sus pollos en los asaderos pero siempre le piden más, por esta razón comprara  pollos pequeños y medianos para poderlos vender cada 2 semanas.
Es una actividad de dedicación y amor, con la que puedo cubrir los gastos familiares y pagar las cuotas de crédito, dice Francisca.
ella desea tener un galpon grande y dar trabajo a jovenes de su barrio.
texts.en:
We came across Francisca washing clothes in the Borbón river. She is a client of Fodemi and for a long time has earned a living raising and selling chickens. Francisca lives with her daughter and son-in-law, who have a one-month-old son. 

Francisca wants to buy 300 chickens and balanced feed, so she can raise them and then sell them to the roast chicken shops in the city and the local shops. She says she has always sold her chickens to the roast chicken shops but they are always asking for more, so she plans to buy small and medium sized chickens so she can sell them every 2 weeks. 

Francisca says she puts a lot of love and dedication into her work and it enables her to cover the family's living expenses and pay the loan instalments. 

She wants to have a large chicken barn and provide employment for young people in her area.

loans.use: to buy balanced chicken feed and 300 chickens to raise and sell.

loans.name: Leidy Joana

texts.es:
Leidy, a sus 30 años de edad, es madre soltera de 2 hijos de 11 y 5 años, por quienes lucha incansablemente para brindar el sustento diario y educación.
Su vida productiva como independiente, comenzó con la venta de mercancía, actividad que realizó durante varios meses, pero tuvo que terminar la actividad porque los clientes no le pagaban. Desde hace 2 años se dedica a trabajar como manicurista independiente, el oficio lo aprendió de manera empírica y presta su servicio a domicilio, por lo que no tiene un horario de trabajo establecido, ya que depende de el tiempo que sus clientes tengan disponible.
A pesar de los obstáculos que se le presentan, ella sigue motivada para realizar su actividad y poder sacar a sus hijos adelante, esto la impulsa a solicitar el crédito con el que comprará insumos al por mayor (esmaltes para uñas, acrílicos, limas y otros) y cancelará el saldo de un crédito que tiene vigente, esto le permitirá continuar prestando un buen servicio a sus clientes, logrando generar mejores ingresos.
Leidy manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es tener un negocio estable y próspero que le permita progresar y brindar a sus hijos la oportunidad de tener una mejor educación y bienestar.
texts.en:
Leidy, who is 30 years old, is the single mother of two children, ages 11 and 5, for whom she fights tirelessly to provide daily nourishment and education. Her independent, productive life began with merchandise sales, which she did for many months, but she had to end this business because her customers did not pay. 

Two years ago, she began working as an independent manicurist, which is a job that she learned from observation. She works from her home, so she does not have a set work schedule since her work depends on the time that her customers are available.

Despite the obstacles that exist, she continues to be motivated to do her job and move her children forward. This is why she is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase supplies in bulk (nail polish, acrylics, nail files, etc.) and pay off the balance of an outstanding loan. This will allow her to continue to provide good service to her customers and generate more income. 

Leidy tells us that her greatest desire is to have a stable, prosperous business that will allow her to progress and provide her children with the opportunity to have a better education and well-being.

loans.use: to purchase supplies in bulk (nail polish, acrylics, nail files, etc.) and pay off the balance of an outstanding loan.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy rice, palm oil, onions, Margi, tomatoes, etc., in a large quantity

loans.name: Mahmady

texts.en:
When Mahmady got a 3.5 ha plot of land and began his agricultural business, he was very happy. Mahmady grows wheat, tomatoes and onions. He has been busy with this business for more than 13 years. He has great experience in this field. 

Mahmady works hard in his land. His lovely wife helps him with growing agricultural produce. Mahmady and his wife have three children. Their children are Mahmud who is 23 years old, Munira who is 20 years old, and Sobir who is 18 years old. Mahmady always tries hard for the well-being of his family. 

Mahmady is going to sow a new crop. He is asking for a loan of 3000 Somoni to buy mineral fertilizers, seeds and fuel. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizers, seeds and fuel

loans.name: Guldasta

texts.en:
A hard-working woman from a rural area is going to organize her own business deal and be successful in this field. 

Guldasta was born in 1987. She is a young and smart woman. Guldasta is married and has two little children. She always wanted to organize a business and, from the profits, improve her living conditions. She took part in a course ‘To Get Ahead’ at a women's organization and she got a lot of new information for herself. 

Guldasta is asking for a loan of TJS 6,000 (somoni) to buy cows to organize her new business. She will feed cattle at her house, where she has built a cowshed. She awaits your support and thanks you for your support in advance.

loans.use: to buy cows for her new business.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon is a 25-year-old married woman. She has one child who is one year old. She describes herself as organized and goal-oriented. 

She operates a chemist where she sells medicine. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in an area with potential for growth. She describes her biggest business challenge as lack of enough funds. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of medicine for resale. Her business goal is to open a big chemist within five years. She hopes that in the future she will have improved family livelihood and a stable business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stock of medicine for resale.

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy is a farmer from Sikatuna, Bohol. She is a married woman. 

Mary Joy has been in rice farming business for more than ten years now. She also runs a sari-sari store business, selling various goods and items to the people in her place.

Mary Joy is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for the farm and additional stocks for the sari-sari such as canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries. With this, she will be able to augment her income and profit.

In the future, Mary Joy hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the farm and additional stocks for the sari-sari store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase clothing, like pants and shirts, to sell.

loans.name: Dhahabu

texts.en:
Dhahabu is a 27-year-old, married woman. She has two children, five years old and ten years old. She describes herself as being determined. 

She operates a food stall where she cooks food for sale. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are reliable. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient space. 

Dhahabu will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy materials to renovate the food stall. Her business goal is to have a hotel within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will own a five-star hotel. 

This is her second loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited (SMEP DTM). Her previous loan of KES 20,000 was successfully repaid.

loans.use: to buy materials to renovate her food stall.

loans.name: Fadia

texts.en:
Fadia is a Palestinian refugee who works hard to support her beloved family. She is a 37-year-old married mother of four children who has been working in the embroidery business since she was 17 years old.

Today, Fadia is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to develop her business by buying special threads and other business needs in addition to making necessary maintenance to her house to keep it a healthy living place for her beloved family members.

She and hopes that one day she can develop her business widely to move her living and business outside the camp she is living in.

loans.use: To buy special threads and other materials to develop her business and to make necessary maintenance to her house.

loans.name: Wilikateme Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe WILIKATEME est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 49 ans, et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Massoukou, commune de Marka-coungo, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréale, de sel, de charbon, d’habillement, de beurre de karité, de dah, de la galette, et du henné. Les femmes du groupe WILIKATEME sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
La cliente BABENIN la deuxième personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang assis est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de beurre de karité. Elle compte acheter 40 kg de beurre de karité sur place au village. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce au marché journalière de Marka coungo à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 8.000Fcfa, qui sera utilisé pour assurer la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
The Wilikateme group is made up of married women, who are on average 49 years old with 4 children each. They all live in traditional families in the village of Massoukou, in the Marka-coungo community of the Dioila district in the region of Koulikoro (the second administrative region of Mali.) The women came to know each other through family, neighbors, and friends.

The women are in the business of selling cereals, salt, charcoal, clothes, shea butter, bissap, cakes, and henna. The women of the Wilikateme group are on their fifth group loan. In order to better meet the growing needs of their customers, they turned to Soro Yiriwaso.

Babenin is the second person from left to right in the seated row. She is illiterate and currently sells shea butter. She plans to purchase 40kg of shea butter in the market. She makes her sales at retail for cash in the daily market of Marka Coungo to a customer base made up of both men and women. Babenin hopes to earn a monthly profit of 8,000 francs CFA which she will use to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase shea butter

loans.name: Los Jovenes Group

texts.es: Coordinado por el señor Denis con 24 años, soltero se dedicada a Ebanistería elaborando y reparando muebles, siendo de principal ayuda para elaborarlos el papá, con los créditos anteriores a obtenido máquinas para el mismo negocio como es una circular de mano y un taladro, las mejoras de este taller son notorias, lo que le motiva seguir prestando para la inversión de materia prima como es la madera. también el grupo conformado por el socio Huberne con 29  años de edad dedicado a la compra y venta de verduras y perecederos entre otros, además integrado además por la señora Fabiola de 22 años la cual comercializa ropa nueva en la comunidad.
texts.en:
This group is coordinated by Denis, who is 24 years old. He is a carpenter, repairing furniture and making furniture, with his dad as his main helper. With his previous loans he has bought machines for his business such as a hand-held circular saw and a drill. He has made big improvements to the workshop and this motivates him to continue with another loan to buy raw materials such as wood.

The group also consists of Huberne, who is 29 years old and buys and sells vegetables, perishable goods and other items, and Fabiola who is 22 years old and sells new clothing around the local area.

loans.use: to buy different types of wood as raw materials, such as cedar and mahogany.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Meet Dorcas, a farmer who resides in the Nkubu area of Eastern Kenya with her family. She has three children. 

She loves horticultural farming very much because it has always provided her with enough money to take good care of her family. She has undertaken farming for the past 15 years. Her biggest challenge is insufficient water and capital.

Dorcas said that she chose Juhudi Kilimo because it is the only institution that meets her farming needs. During the training, she learnt how to develop a savings culture. 

After buying the water tank and pipes, her farm will easily access water that will boost productivity and so income will increase. This will help her pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank and pipes.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Meet Martin, a farmer who resides in the Nkubu area of Eastern Kenya with his wife and two children of ages 1 and 5 years. He enjoys dairy farming the most in farming, and he has been doing it for seven years. His primary income comes from the sale of milk, eggs, tea, sukuma wiki (collard greens) and cabbages.

He says that Juhudi Kilimo finances a number of assets for farmers, and he found out that they are the only institution that best suits his needs. During the training, he learned how to plan and budget, which will help him as a farmer.

Through this loan, he will be able to buy animal feed, thus causing his livestock to produce more, and therefore, lead to an increase in income. This will ensure that his children's school fees are well taken care of.

loans.use: to purchase animal feeds.

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards.

Besides the poultry business, Mbeyu practices a fruits and vegetable selling business. She is requesting a loan to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables and potatoes for resale. 

Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables and potatoes for resale

loans.name: Sidi

texts.en:
Sidi is a married woman with five children, two of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her potential customers are neighbors, pupils and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour and beans. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour and beans

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and fabric.

loans.name: Ololailumtia 2 Group

texts.en:
Edward has eight children between the ages of three and thirteen and also owns and operates a hotel in Ololailumtia, a rural village almost 100km and a least a three hour drive from Kenya national grid power. The village sits on the edge of the Masai Mara and serves as a commercial hub for both the Masai residents who live in the town and for those in surrounding smaller villages. A weekly market attracts pastoralists from all over the region. Without access to electricity, the village must rely on generators, kerosene, and candles for their energy needs.  Edward takes pride in providing his customers with a clean, safe place to stay, but he could provide even better service with access to power.

Edward presently operates a diesel generator to power lights in his customers’ rooms. He only runs the generator for a few hours each evening and asks customers to either pay for generator fuel or use kerosene lanterns if they would like additional light. Customers sometimes complain and shorten their stay because of the lack of power. To provide more light, Edward would need to raise room charges to cover the fuel costs, which would scare away customers. Furthermore, the generator is unreliable and breaks often. To be repaired, it must be taken over three hours to the nearest large town. This takes Edward away from his business for over a day and causes him to lose a lot of income.

The solar micro-grid will provide Edward a constant and reliable power source to use for lighting and other energy services, such as phone charging and small TVs to attract more customers to his hotel. Edward will pre-pay for electricity in small bundles using his mobile phone. The solar system will require very little maintenance and a large battery bank ensures there will be plenty of power even on cloudy days. Edward will spend a lot less money for the micro-grid power than he was on diesel fuel and the frequent generator maintenance trips. He can then reinvest this money in his hotel or use it to pay school fees for his children. Furthermore, the solar system is far better for the environment and Edward’s health than the noisy, polluting diesel generator.

Aside from Edward, three other business owners in the village are also a part of the loan connecting to the grid: Patricia, Isaac, and John. They are all looking forward to having reliable power at an affordable rate which they will also use to grow their businesses.  The micro-grid, will thus, spur economic activity in Ololailumtia and provide better and cheaper options for more residents to use energy to improve their lives.

loans.use: to connect to the solar micro-grid installed in Ololailumtia.  With connection to power, Edward will be able to attract more customers to his hotel with reliable lighting, TVs, and phone charging.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta de 24 años de edad se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de productos de uso personal como lociones, desodorantes, cremas, shampoo, perfumes, etc. su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar los gastos de su hogar vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus hijos, la clienta desea acrecentar su negocio por eso solicta un credito que le permita poder comprar todo lo necesario como: perfumes, lociones, desodorantes, cremas, shampoo, etc. todo por mayor ya que tiene mucha clientela por dar sus productos a precios accesibles con la ayuda solictada ella podra obtener mejores ganancias y asi seguira dandole a su familia lo que necesita sin limitacion alguna
texts.en:
This 24-year-old borrower makes a living selling all kinds of personal products such as lotions, deodorants, creams, shampoo, perfumes etc. She runs her business from her home and with the profits she makes from her sales and the help of her husband they are able to cover the household expenses. She lives in her own house with her husband and children. 

The borrower wishes to increase her business and so she is asking for a loan which will enable her to buy everything she needs such as perfumes, lotions, deodorants, creams, shampoo etc. wholesale. She has a lot of customers because she sells her products at affordable prices. With the the help of the loan requested she will be able to make better profits and so continue to give her family everything they need, with no restrictions.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, lotions, deodorants, creams, shampoo etc.

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en:
Suriya is a 40-year-old woman residing in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of six children. She is a housewife who looks after her family at home. 

Her husband provides services in shuttering work for building making. In this regard, her husband needs material such as soldering rods, welding rods, iron rods and sheets for manufacturing iron accessories to improve his shuttering work so that he can generate more income to financially support his family. 

Suriya is applying for loan from Kiva's field partner for her husband so that he can buy material such as soldering rods, welding rods, iron rods and sheets for his work.

Suriya is thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy material such as soldering rods, welding rods, iron rods and sheets for shuttering work.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase shaving tools and a chair.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en: Being a responsible mother, Leonida engages in buying and reselling fruits, vegetables, and other native products within her community. She is 52 years old, and has six children. Despite the hardships of living, she has the determination to continue sending her children to school. Due to the high cost of school fees, she aims to improve the business in order to generate sufficient income. She is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy more stocks of fruits, vegetables, soft brooms, orchids and ornamental plants to sell. She believes that her loan will help her to make the business grow.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of fruits, vegetables, soft brooms, orchids, and ornamental plants to sell.

loans.name: Sol De Oro Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SOL DE ORO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Srta. Grecia ella es soltera y tiene 22 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de productos de belleza,la socia vende lápiz labiales, cremas y perfumes,la socia también se dedica al negocio de venta de materiales de construcción como cemento, arena y ladrillos, la socia trabaaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia por medio de estos pequeños negocios quiere salir adelante, el  sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los productos de belleza. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar lápiz labiales, cremas y perfumes.

La socia que esta pegada a la foto grupal se le tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.

 
 
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de granos secos, negocio de internet, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to Sol de Oro Communal Bank, located in the district of Cusco in the province and department of Cusco. Grecia, who is 24 years old and single, is a member. She has a business selling beauty products and sells lipsticks, creams and perfumes. She also sells construction materials such as cement, sand and bricks. She works from 8am to 6pm and wants to get on in life by means of these small businesses. Her dream is to have a small shop where she can sell the beauty products.

Grecia is asking for the loan to buy lipsticks, creams and perfumes. 

The member whose photo is attached to the group photo asked permission for work reasons to have her photo taken after the meeting. 

The other members sell bulk grains, run an internet business, have a grocery shop and a restaurant business. 

Grecia is grateful to everyone who is involved in helping with this dream and promises to pay her loan instalments in the agreed timeframe.

loans.use: to buy lipsticks, creams and perfumes.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a married mother of four children. All of her kids still attend school which is the reason for her hard work.  She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. 

She has operated a milk-selling business at the market for the past two years, selling to passersby and neighbours. She cited seasonality as her major challenge in the business.

With the loan she wants to purchase gallons of milk for sale. Her dream is to see her children get better education and become important people in society.

loans.use: to purchase gallons of milk for sale.

loans.name: Tabu

texts.en:
Tabu is married and has six children, two of whom go to school. The rest are adults. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Tabu has operated an orange selling business for the past six years, selling from home to her neighbours and passerby. 

With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase sacks of oranges for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of oranges for resale.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en: Angelina is a farmer from Sikatuna, Bohol. She is a married woman and a mother of four grown children. Angelina is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for the farm and additional piglets to raise. With this, she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm thus augmenting her income. In the future, Angelina has hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the farm and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Kdaf

texts.en:
Kdaf is 28 years old and the father of two children, living with his wife and children in his house in Hodiedah, Yemen. He works as cleaner in the public sector and earns a low salary. He thanks Kiva lenders who helped him last year to buy construction materials for his house. 

Because his salary is very low, Kdaf had to find another income source. He has been working as a motorcycle driver after finishing his day job. The motorcycle belongs to one of his relatives. Now, he wants to buy his own motorcycle in order to make more money. Therefore, he decided to apply for a Youth loan of 110,000 YER from AMB in order to buy a motorcycle. He looks forward to purchasing other motorcycles and a bus to have a good income.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Musharraf

texts.en: Musharaf was born in 1963. She is a hardworking woman from a rural area. She is married and has adult children. Musharaf has been busy selling food items for more than ten years. She has a food shop in the center of her village. She sells milk products, meat products, sweets, pasta, flour and etc. Musharaf has her regular customers. Her customers are glad for her activity as she sells high quality goods. She is asking for a loan of 3,500 TJS to buy food items to widen the assortment of her goods, as food items are in high demand. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy food items to widen the assortment of her goods.

loans.name: Dama

texts.en:
Dama is a widowed woman with two children who are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

For the past four years, she has operated a kiosk business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking  oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking  oil

loans.name: Hoern's Group

texts.en:
Hoern is aged 33 years old and married. She is a mother of two children, both of whom are dependent on her. To make a living, she and her husband have been growing cassava for 15 years. The current business earns her about 25,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Hoern’s group consists of three members who live in the same village of Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. She is a fourth-cycle client with VisionFund. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Hoern will user her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her crop yield so as to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is divorced with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.  She operates a coconut business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. With the loan she wants to purchase seven sacks of coconuts to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase seven sacks of coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Thos

texts.en:
Thos is 55 years old, married, with a grown-up child,  She is a resident of Pea Reang district, Cambodia.  She, together with her husband, are engaged in farming to earn a livelihood.  She has operated this business for more than 30 years and earns a decent income for her family.

At this time, Thos has applied for a USD 500 loan which will be used to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for the sake of her family members and to improve her household sanitation practices.  Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Thos is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, to safeguard the health of her family and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for the sake of her family members

loans.name: Famida

texts.en:
Famida is single. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family.

She has operated a poultry selling business at the market for the past five years, selling to her town dwellers and neighbors.  She faces a major challenge in the high cost of purchasing chickens, especially during picking season.

She is requesting a loan to purchase chicks and their feed for business continuity.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans at a lower cost to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and their feed for business continuity

loans.name: Vanna's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village located in the Kampong Cham Province’s Koh Sotin district, Vanna is 60 years old and married with seven children.  For the last 20 years, she has been working as a government officer.  To add more income, Vanna also raises chickens.  With the current business, she can earn about KHR 20,000 per day and can save about KHR 10,000 each day for future needs.

Vanna’s group consists of two members with VisionFund.  Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan.  As the leader, Vanna is going to use her portion to buy piglets to raise in order to earn additional income.  She hopes this loan will enable her to fatten her pigs so as to sell them for a good price.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise in order to earn additional income

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: José Orlando

texts.es: José de 69 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado de educación básica, está casado, su esposa es pensionada, pero se dedica a los oficios domesticos en su casa; tienen dos hijos que viven en otra casa con su madre pero que él las sostiene eonomicamente; no estudian ni trabajan, la actividad de él son las aves de corral y ordeñar una vaca. Utilizara el dinero del crédito, para una operacion, le ayudara mucho el prestamo, porque mejorara sus condiciones fisicas y se sentira satisfecho con eso, sus sueños son seguir en buenas condiciones de salud para seguir trabajando; a futuro desea que sus hijos sigan sus estudios hasta graduarse y ser profesionales.
texts.en:
José is 69 years old, married, and has a second grade education. His wife is a pensioner and is responsible for the household chores. They have two children who live at another house with his mother, who he supports financially. None of the children studies or works.

José’s activities involve raising poultry and milking a cow. He will use the money from this loan for an operation. The loan will be a great help because his physical condition will improve, which will make him feel better.

His dream is to remain in good health so that he can continue working. In the future, he wants his children to continue their studies so that they can graduate and become professionals.

loans.use: to pay for an operation.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with six children, four of whom attend school and two who are adults.  She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past five years, she has operated a fruits and vegetable business, selling to her neighbors and passersby.  She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenge.  With the loan, she wants to purchase potatoes, tomatoes, vegetables, onions for resale.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase potatoes, tomatoes, vegetables, onions for resale.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is 56 years old and an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is a mother of 6 children and her husband is a mason by profession.  He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of entire family. Parveen has also been doing her business of selling clothes for many years and contributes her income with her husband's to manage the household.

Parveen needs to buy different types of clothes for reselling purposes, but due to insufficient financial means she is not in the position to buy these clothes for her business. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan she can purchase the clothes easily to fulfill her business needs, so that she can earn more profitable income to support her family and business.

For this financial assistance, Parveen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different types of clothes in bulk for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a generator and to renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
As a way of generating income, Sonia engages in buying and reselling clothes within the public market. She aims to make her business profitable in order to earn sufficient income. Despite problems and difficulties in life, she has the determination to improve her business. 

Sonia is asking for additional capital of PHP 30,000 to buy more stocks of pants, t-shirts, ladies' wear, jackets, short pants, skirts, and baby dresses to sell. Through this loan, she believes that, someday, she will be able to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of pants, t-shirts, ladies' wear, jackets, short pants, skirts, and baby dresses to sell.

loans.name: Paradise Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of five members who are part of the group called Paradise. It is made up of members who get on very well and work hard. They all live in the same neighborhood, and are into selling secondhand clothing, belts, onions and plastic bowls..

Vicent, (standing in the middle of the photo) is forty-five years old. He is married and has children. He will use his loan to buy a bale of secondhand clothing from the market to sell to customers in Dansoman. He has been doing this job for ten years. This his 12th loan cycle with ID-Ghana, which indicates that he is very loyal, because all his previous loans have been paid successfully. He uses his earnings to take care of his family expenses, and ensure the smooth running of his household.

loans.use: to buy a bale of secondhand clothing from the market to sell to customers in Dansoman.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fish, rice, oil, meat, onions, etc.

loans.name: Khosiyat

texts.ru: Хосият  жительница села района Шахритус. Ей 61 лет. Хосият вдова. Она потеряла своего мужа и ребенка она поставила на ноги сама. Хосият умная и энергичная женщина.  Дома у себя она работает на грядке, Хосият выращивает сельскохозяйственные культуры. Она занимается земледелием на отлично, потому что такой длительностью она занимается с юных лет. Благодаря кредиту Хосият сможет посадить ежегодный урожай и увеличить поголовья скота. Вы можете помочь ей!
texts.en: Khosiyat is a village resident in the Shahrituz District. She is 61 years old. Khosiyat is a widow. She lost her husband and got her child on his feet by herself. Khosiyat is an intelligent and energetic woman. She works in the garden beds at her house, growing crops. She does crop farming very well, as she has been practicing it since childhood. Thanks to the loan, Khosiyat will be able to plant an annual harvest and increase her number of cattle. You can help her!

loans.use: to plant an annual harvest and buy the essentials for sowing.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a divorced woman with five children, all attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor running water. Her greatest  monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Monica operates a fruit and vegetable business to sell, from home, to her neighbors and passers-by. She faces stiff competition from other vegetable operators.
 
With the loan, she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruit and vegetables to resell.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruit, and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes du groupe Benkadi vivent toutes dans des familles polygamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 41 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de Bounou dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la Républiques du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village. Elles font le petit commerce de farine, d’habillement, de condiment et la restauration. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3éme   cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Hawa (1ére femme assise de la gauche vers la droite dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de pâté et de la farine sucrée dans le village de Bounou et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter un sac de farine pour satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle. La vente se fait au comptant  et souvent à crédit à une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Hawa espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 16 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour des frais de scolarisation de ses enfants et augmenter  son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The ten women of the group Benkadi all live in polygamous families, and they average 41 years of age and four children each. All the women live in the village of  Bounou, in Région de Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through ties of community, kinship, marriage, and their revenue-generating businesses in the village. They have small-scale businesses involving flour, clothing, condiments, and food service. 

With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their third solidarity loan cycle. 

Ms. Hawa (first woman sitting from the left in the photo) is a major vendor of pâté and of sweetened flour in and around the village of Bounou. She intends to use her loan to purchase a sack of flour to meet the customer demand. Sales are made to a mixed customer base paying with cash and often on credit. 

With this loan, Ms. Hawa hopes to make an average monthly profit of 16,000 francs CFA that will be used to cover her children's schooling costs and to increase her capital.

loans.use: to purchase flour

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saaumu is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past five years, she has been selling goats at the market to the general public. The main challenge for her business has been unstable market prices. 

She joined Yehu in order to gain access to funds. She is requesting a loan to purchase more goats for resale.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase milk, oats, juice, and spaghetti for her business,

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a hardworking 44-year-old man. He is married with children. He and his family live in Ghana, Accra-Dansoman . His wife takes care of the home. In order to support the family, Richard works hard. His wife also helps him when she can. 

Richard joined ID-Ghana in 2011. He used his previous loan to buy shoes and sold them to successfully repay his loan. He receives a good income from the sale of shoes. Now he would like to increase his business to earn a bigger profit. He is requesting 2,800 GHS.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.es:
Virgilio tiene 63 años d edad, desafortunadamente no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar en la escuela, ahora él está casado y su esposa no trabaja, solo hace los oficios del hogar, tiene 3 hijos pero solo dos viven con Virgilio, además de un nieto que estudia en la escuela.

Virgilio se dedica al trabajo en la agricultura como jornaleros de campo, actividad en la cual le ayudan sus hijos, cultivan la tierra, siembra maíz y sorgo, en la época de verano trabaja con sus bueyes halando las cosechas de sus vecinos en carreta, este oficio lo aprendió de sus padres que fueron agricultores y le enseñaron desde niño el oficio.
La tierra que él cultiva le queda en la misma propiedad de su casa, ahí también siembra pipianes en invierno para consumo familiar, además cuida una yunta de bueyes y una vaca, lo más complicado para el cliente es la compra de insumos agrícolas, el transporte es un obstáculo pues deben esperar carros que pasen para poder salir a la carretera principal, de lo contrario debe caminar aproximadamente 3 kilómetros en una calle polvosa para poder tomar el autobús

El préstamo que él está solicitando a CrediCampo, lo necesita para comprar 6 quintales de fertilizantes, algunos herbicidas, esta será la base para realizar la próxima cosecha que asegurará el grano para el consumo de su familia y la alimentación para sus animales.

Sus sueños a futuro son mejorar su casa y ayudar a sus hijos a construir sus hogares por si deciden casarse, este préstamo es el capital de trabajo para su cultivo y le dará la oportunidad de comprar más barato.
texts.en:
Unfortunately, Virgilio, 63, did not have the opportunity to go to school.  He is now married and his wife is a homemaker.  He has 3 children, but only 2 live with him, as well as a grandchild who attends school.

Virgilio works in agriculture as a field worker.  His children also do this work, cultivating the land and planting corn and sorghum.  In the summer, he works with his oxen, pulling the harvests of his neighbors on a cart.  He learned this work from his parents, who were farmers who taught him to farm when he was a child.

He also cultivates land that is on the same property as his house.  There he grows green squash in the winter for the family's consumption.  He also cares for a team of oxen and a cow.  What is most difficult for him is to buy agricultural supplies.  Transportation is an obstacle, as he must wait for cars to pass so that he can go out in the main road.  Otherwise, he must walk about 3 kilometers on a dusty street to get to the bus stop.  

Virgilio is requesting this loan from Credicampo because he needs to buy 600 pounds of fertilizers and some herbicides.  This will be the basis for the next harvest that will assure him the grains for his family's consumption and to feed his animals.

Virgilio's dreams for the future are to improve his house and help his children build their own homes in case they decide to get married.  This loan will serve as working capital for his crops, and will give him the opportunity to buy his supplies at a lower cost.

loans.use: to buy 600 pounds of fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy used clothes and blouses, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es: Dominga tiene 32 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a sus dos hijas de 15 años y 7 años de edad. Con el el fin de mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales hace algunos años su compañero de vida se vio obligado a emigrar al extranjero dado que los ingresos que percibía dentro de su localidad no le permitían cubrir los gastos del hogar. Dominga se encarga del hogar y también colabora  con la economía del mismo. Dominga se dedica a la venta de tortillas desde hace más de cuatro años. Dicho negocio es muy importante dado que las exigencias de sus hijas son muchas y con lo que percibe de su compañero de vida no es suficiente para paliar todas las necesidades. Como toda mujer visionaria desea mejorar sus condiciones de vida por medio de la instalación del servicio de energía eléctrica que por las condiciones económicas no ha podido tener. Con la llegada de FUSAI a la localidad de Dominga es posible que su realidad se vea trasformada ya que puede ser sujeta de crédito aun que sus condiciones no le permitan en el sistema financiero tradicional. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para pagar el derecho y la instalación de la energía eléctrica que tanta falta le hace para  el buen desarrollo de sus hijas.
texts.en:
Dominga is 32 years old and lives in her own house with her two daughters aged 7 and 15 years old. With the goal of improving their living conditions her life companion felt obligated to emigrate to another country a few years ago, given that the income he made in their community did not cover the household expenses. Dominga took charge of the household and also contributes to the household finances. Dominga has been selling tortillas for more than 4 years. This business is very important since her daughters want a lot and what she receives from her life companion is not enough to pay for all of the necessities. 

As any visionary woman would, Dominga wants to improve their living conditions by installing electricity something she has not done due to economic conditions. With the arrival of FUSAI to her community it is possible for Dominga to achieve her dream as she can get a loan that the traditional financial system would not consider. So she has requested a loan from FUSAI to pay to connect to the electrical grid, something that has been missing in the development of her children.

loans.use: to pay to connect and install electricity.

loans.name: Bahrigul

texts.ru: Бахригул живет в районе Хуросон. Она 45-летняя замужняя женщина, мать четверых детей. У нее двое сыновей и двое дочерей. Муж Бахригул наемный рабочий. Сама Бахригул образованная женщина. У нее среднее специальное образование. Она работает учительницей в сельской школе. Одновременно в свободное от работы времени Бахригул занимается выращиванием крупнорогатых скотов. Этой деятельностью она занимается в течение 12 лет. Бахригул в своем скотном дворе сейчас имеет только пару скотов. Она запрашивает кредит, чтобы закупить еще пару скотов и увеличить поголовье скота. Таким образом она хочет увеличить прибыль от деятельности и улучшить условия проживания семьи.
texts.en: Bahrigul lives in the Khuroson district. She is a 45-year old woman and the mother of four. She has two sons and two daughters. Bahrigul’s husband is a contract worker. As to Bahrigul, she is an educated woman. She has finished junior college and works as a teacher in the village school. In addition, in the time free from her job, she grows cattle. She has been in this business for 12 years. Bahrigul has only one pair of cattle on her farm now. She is requesting a loan in order to buy another pair of cattle and increase her livestock headcount. In this way, she would like increase the revenue from her business and improve her family’s life conditions.
