loans.use: to buy cattle and increase her livestock.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a married woman with one child who goes to school. She owns a house without electricity and running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past two years, she has operated a retail shop to sell to her neighbors and passers-by. She mentioned weather conditions and theft as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase maize flour, soap, sugar, rice, beans, and cooking  oil to resell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, soap, sugar, rice, beans, and cooking  oil to resell.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is married and has been blessed with one child. She owns a house without electricity and running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past year, she has operated a retail shop to sell wheat flour, rice and cooking oil. She sites theft and competition as her major challenges to her business. 

Nancy requests a loan to boost her kiosk and purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking oil. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and tea leaves

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. For over five years, she has operated a business selling fruits and vegetables to her neighbors and passersby. Hadija’s major business challenge is seasonality. She owns a house without electricity or running water and her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. Hadija decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

Hadija is requesting a loan to purchase green vegetables, fruits, tomatoes, potatoes, and onions. In the future she dreams of establishing a grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, fruits, tomatoes, potatoes, and onions

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is a 29-year-old woman residing in Taxila, Pakistan. She is a mother of five children. Her husband owns an import and export business; he is the guardian of the family and is responsible for fulfilling the need of all of the family members. Shabana has been running her own beauty salon for the past five years.  She also contributes her income with her husband's to manage the household.
 
Shabana needs to buy different types of cosmetics, such as creams, hair brushes, and other accessories for her beauty salon, but due to financial constraints she is not capable of buying these items for her business. Therefore, Shabana has applied for a Kiva loan in a group with other two members. This loan will help her to buy the relevant items for her business purposes so that she can provide better services to her customers.  It will also help her to earn maximum profitable income to fulfill the needs of her business and family.

For this financial assistance Shabana is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different types of cosmetics and other items for her business.

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en:
Pov, 33, is married with four children residing in a rural village of the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province. To support the family, she has been farming rice for almost 10 years while her husband works as a garment worker to supplement the income. Together, they can earn about KHR 28,000 per day and can save about KHR 9,000 each day for future needs. 

Pov’s group consists of five members and she is the second cycled client with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. Pov will use her portion to build a proper latrine for her family. She hopes to have a clean latrine for her family to use.

loans.use: to build a proper latrine for her family

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Don Antonio vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el se dedica a la crianza de ganado de doble propósito desde hace varios años, comercializa en los diferentes mercados sis productos, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Don Antonio esta solicitando un credito para la compra de ganado de doble propósito para poder continuar con su crianza y asi poder obtener mejores ganancias y darle a  su familia lo que necesita sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Antonio lives in his own house with his wife and two children. He has been raising cattle for both their milk and meat. He sells his product in various markets and with what he makes he manages to pay some of the household expenses. Antonio is requesting a loan  to buy cattle for both milk and meat to continue with his work. Then he can generate more income and provide his family with all they need.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Union Progreso Group

texts.es: “UNION PROGRESO” es uno de los grupos que está conformada por mujeres trabajadoras y empeñosas. Eyda  tiene 65 años de edad es viuda. Ella hace 05 años implemento su bodega en su vivienda. Y a la vez se dedica a la venta de ropa sobre pedidos hace muchos años.  El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de más arroz azúcar aceite y  bebidas. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado.  Eyda es la segunda persona sentada del lado izquierdo.
texts.en: The “UNION PROGRESO” communal bank is composed of hard-working and persevering women. Eyda is 65 years old and is a widow. For the past 5 years she has had a store in her house. She also has been selling clothing by request for many years. She will invest the loan in buying more rice, sugar, oil and drinks. The members are grateful to the lenders at Kiva for this loan. Eyda is seated second from the left.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil and drinks.

loans.name: G/s Bendicion De Dios Group

texts.es:
El g.s Bendición de Dios está conformado por cinco integrantes cuatro mujeres y un hombre, madres y padres responsables, con diez hijos bajo su responsabilidad, se caracterizan por ser trabajadores, responsables, con ganas de superación personal.  Son originarios de León, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudieron cursar una carrera y se vieron en la necesidad de trabajar desde temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. 
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es Karla y tiene por actividad económica la venta de frutas y verduras, como plátanos, yuca, bananos, naranjas, melón,  quequiske, remolacha, papaya. Ella dedica a su negocio unas diez horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en un mercado de la localidad, y en su casa de habitación. El g.s  Bendición de Dios agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan  a personas de escasos recursos y  países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The solidarity group named “Bendición de Dios” (Blessing of God) consists of five members, four women and one man. They are responsible parents who look after the 10 children among them. The members are known for being hardworking, responsible, and having the drive to succeed on a personal level. They are originally from León, a place that is located in the western part of the country. Unfortunately, due to the lack of financial resources, they were not able to study for a degree. Therefore, they had to work from an early age and help with the household expenses.

Thanks to her efforts and her desire to move forward, Karla was chosen as the group coordinator. She has a business of selling fruits and vegetables such as plantains, cassava, bananas, oranges, melons, “quequisque” (a tuber similar to taro root), beets, and papaya. She works at her business about 10 hours a day by offering her products. Her business is located at a market in her town, but she also sells from home.

The solidarity group “Bendición de Dios” is grateful for the assistance that Kiva lenders provide to people who have limited resources and come from poor countries, such as Nicaragua, so that they have a means of earning a decent living.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy spare bicycle parts

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.

She asks for a loan to buy clothing material, fabric, and thread for her business. 

She is grateful for the new support she has received.

loans.use: to buy clothing material, fabric, and thread for her business.

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en:
Mwanaidi is married and has five children who attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

She has operated a business of selling dumplings for the past three years. She sells from her home to her neighbors. She dreams of incorporating charcoal into her existing business in the near future.

With the loan she is requesting she plans to purchase wheat flour, cooking oil and sugar for making dumplings for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, cooking oil and sugar for making dumplings

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is hardworking and she works tirelessly to make both ends meet.  She appreciates the support from Kiva and Yehu.  

Once more, she comes to you to request another loan, this time to buy bunches of firewood to sell in a new business.

loans.use: to buy bunches of firewood to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, soap, flour, sugar, onions, etc., to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more milk, biscuits, oats, and spaghetti for her business,

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy foot wear and clothing items to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fifty additional bags of charcoal for her business

loans.name: Mare

texts.en:
This is Mare, a villager, who is pictured at her newly built family home. She is married and the mother of four. Mare and her husband are farmers and they have a greenhouse where she plants veggies such as tomatoes, cucumbers, spinach and lettuce. They also have eight goats and, during summer time, her husband takes the goats every day to graze in mountains very far from home. He complains that he is exhausted by walking for hours with the goats. Mare’s husband has now decided to stay away from the family during grazing months and build a little shack not far from where the goats graze to avoid his exhaustive up and down wandering. 

Mare is requesting a loan to purchase a vehicle to carry the goats to the mountains. “It will be a recovery for my husband and I will very much appreciate lenders’ financial help” said Mare.

loans.use: to buy a vehicle for her husband to transport goats to the far mountains for grazing

loans.name: Ramo

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in the Kampong Cham province’s Ponhea Krek district, Ramo is 23 years old and is married with one kid. She earns a living through farming rice and growing cassava. Together, she and her spouse can earn about KHR 56,000 per day from the current business and can save about KHR 29,000 each day for future needs.
 
Ramo is just with VisionFund for one cycle. Now she is asking for a loan to buy hairdressing supplies and barber equipment in order to run a hair salon shop. She hopes this loan will enable her to run a new shop successfully in order to earn more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy hairdressing supplies and barber equipment in order to run a hair salon shop

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Mayasa

texts.en:
Mayasa is a hardworking and enterprising woman who appreciates Kiva lenders for her previous loan that improved her living standards.

In addition to her food stall business, Mayasa sells coconuts to her neighbors and passers-by.

She requests a loan to purchase sacks of coconuts to resell.  She joined Yehu to boast her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts to resell.

loans.name: Mapenzi

texts.en:
Mapenzi is very grateful for the support of the previous loan, which helped her to support her family.

Here again she comes to you requesting a loan to buy bundles of firewood for sale. She appreciates the support.

loans.use: to buy bundles of firewood for sale

loans.name: Njira

texts.en:
Njira is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. For more than two years, she has operated a business selling vegetables from her home to neighbors and passersby. Njira’s major business challenge is seasonality. She owns a house without electricity or running water and her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. Njira decided to join Yehu to access loans and boost her business.

Njira is requesting a loan to purchase stock of green vegetables to resell. She dreams of establishing a grocery store in the future.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables to sell

loans.name: Mwari

texts.en:
Mwari is a married woman with nine children who are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

For the past two years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentions seasonality and theft as her major challenges. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase maize flour, cashew nuts, soap, rice, beans, and cooking oil for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, cashew nuts, soap, rice, beans, and cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cassava and coconut for her business,

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase oil, water, rice and coal for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase dishes, cups, bowls, plates, and buckets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing, footwear, and blankets.

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Srey, 51, is married with four children residing in a rural village located in the Kampong Cham province’s Kampong Siem district, Cambodia. For the last 30 years, she has been farming rice and raising pigs as primary sources of the family’s income. The current business earns her about US $15 per day.

Srey is just with VisionFund for one cycle. Now she is applying for a loan to buy a plot of farmland. She hopes to extend her rice-farming business.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Muborak

texts.en: Muborak is 53 years old. She is married and has 4 children. One of her children is non-adult. Muborak tries to offer her children all necessary things. She has been busy with animal husbandry and food products sales more than 10 years. She feeds 4 cows and 70 sheep now. She has a big cowshed in her house. Muborak has a good opportunity to develop her business with animal husbandry as she lives in a rural area. She is going to develop her business further. Her husband will help her to realize her plan. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy cattle for increasing working capital. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle for increasing working capital

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself as polite. 

She operates a retail business where she sells eggs. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in an area good for business and her primary customers are of all types. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of eggs. Her business goal is to be selling eggs wholesale within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will improve her living standards. She will use the anticipated profits to invest in the business.

loans.use: buy more stock of eggs to sell.

loans.name: Kalume

texts.en: Kalume is a thirty-one-year-old married man. He has three children ranging from six to thirteen years old. He operates a retail business where he sells charcoal. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a busy area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low capital. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more charcoal stocks. His business goal is to expand within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will improve his living standards. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM. He will use the anticipated profits expand the business.

loans.use: buy more charcoal stocks

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is a 44-year-old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 14 years to 18 years old.

Hadija operates a retail business where she sells groceries. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are reliable customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low capital.

She will use the loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to buy more stock of groceries. Her business goal is to expand within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards. She will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of groceries.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a resident of the Nkubu area of Eastern Kenya located on the slopes of Mt.Kenya. He is married and has 5 children. He loves horticultural farming because it brings in enough money. He has been doing it for 18 years with his primary income coming from selling horticultural crops, milk, and eggs.

Peter chose Juhudi Kilimo because it reaches farmers in rural areas. During the training, he learned planning and budgeting which helps him as a farmer to minimize costs and maximize revenue. This loan will  help him purchase water pipes for sufficient water for the farm and this will cause his crops to produce more and thus bring more income. This will help improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase water pipes.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is married and has children that attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has owned a food stall business to sell to neighbors and town-dwellers. She faces a major challenge of a fluctuating customer base, which leads to spoiled goods and losses.

With the loan, she wants to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour, wheat flour, and cooking oil.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour, wheat flour, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Jumwa

texts.en:
Jumwa is married woman with nine children who are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

For the past two years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, Jumwa wants to purchase groundnuts, sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, beans, and cooking oil for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase groundnuts, sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, beans, and cooking oil for resale

loans.name: Tabu

texts.en:
Tabu appreciates her previous loan that improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.

She would like to apply for another loan to restock wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and sugar. 

She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase soap, body cream, and tissue paper for her business,

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Milka

texts.en:
Milka is a 24-year-old woman from Nyahururu. She is married to John and they are blessed with three children aged eleven, seven and three years old.

She is a farmer, a business she has been running for the last five years, and to enable her to buy a dairy cow for milk production, she has applied for her first loan of KES 60,000 from VisionFund Kenya.

Her monthly income right now is KES 15,000 and she has plans to use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to educate her children and to pay her loan back to VisionFund Kenya. In the future, she hopes to be a successful farmer.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Marial

texts.en:
Marial is a 23-year-old married woman. She has three children, with ages ranging from 2 to 6 years. 

She operates a retail business where she sells kanga (african garment). She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a good area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low capital. 

Marial will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of kanga. 

Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her  living standards. 

She will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of kanga (african garment)

loans.name: Petronilla

texts.en:
Petronilla is a hardworking and enterprising woman who appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards, enabled her to expand her business, and helped her to earn a higher income.

She requests another loan to purchase bales of clothes to sell . She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 28 years old and from Nyahururu. She is single and blessed with two children ages 12 and 5.

She has been running her business of selling fruits and vegetables for the last five years. 

To enable her buy more stock of vegetables and fruits to sell to her customers, she has applied for her first loan of KES. 20,000 from VisionFund Kenya.

Her monthly income right now is KES.10,000. She has plans of using the anticipated profits from her expanded business to educate her children and to pay her loan back to VisionFund Kenya.

In the future, she hopes to be a successful business lady in the region.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables to sell to her customers

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is married and has four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past three years, she has operated a butcher selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. 

Regina  is requesting for a loan to purchase two cows for slaughter in her business. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two cows for slaughter for her business

loans.name: Felister

texts.en:
Felister is married with four school-going children. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family.

Felister has operated a clothes selling business for the past four years. She sells from home to towndwellers, passersby and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of inflation in her business. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase bales of clothes to sell. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes to sell

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is 31 years old and is the sixth born in a family of nine. Currently, Henry is engaged and lives in Lusaka, where he operates his mobile money transfer business. The business not only provides for himself, but also his siblings.   
 
Henry likes to describe his business as the service of sending and receiving money from one location to another in Zambia.  He started operating the business as a way to provide for his family.  Henry enjoys the business because it is an opportunity for him to provide much needed financial services within the community.  He enjoys interacting with all the customers from different walks of life that do business at his outlet.  

Henry requests a Kiva loan to purchase a trading booth to expand his mobile money business to serve more customers who need to send or receive money.

Henry is grateful for the opportunity to be connected to Kiva lenders. He explains that access to financing as a small business owner in Zambia is very difficult.  With his loan, Henry plans to grow his business by opening a new outlet.  This is the first step in his goal of continuing to grow his business.

loans.use: to purchase a trading booth and increase the money he uses to service his customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more kitchen supplies and accessories and to renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a carton of milk and candles for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his son's college expenses.

loans.name: Las Espinozas Group

texts.es: María es la  coordinadora del grupo tiene  34 años de edad, acompañada y madre de   5 hijos de las edades de 11, 10, 8, 4 y 2 años, ella  se dedica a vender verduras, frutas existentes en la temporada y en esta temporada desea invertir en cosechas de tamarindo, jocote, mango, tomate, etc. También realiza venta de fritanga (enchiladas, tacos, maduro con queso, pollo asado, carne asada, entre otros), ayudándole principalmente la hija mayor a despachar la venta de la fritanga. Entre las otras socias tenemos a la señora María con 39 años dedicada  a vender leña y  la señora Petrona hace y  vende tortillas y tiene  60 años de edad.
texts.en:
María is this group's coordinator. She is 34 years old and has a partner and five children, aged eleven, ten, eight, four and two years old respectively. María works selling vegetables and seasonal fruits. This season she wants to invest in tamarinds, jocotes, mangoes, tomatoes and more. María also sells hot foods (enchiladas, tacos, plantains with cheese, roast chicken, roast meat and more). María's eldest daughter helps with selling the food. 

The other members of this group are 39-year-old María - who sells firewood - and Petrona, 60 years old, who sells tortillas.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruits such as jocotes, tamarins, mangos, tomatoes and more.

loans.name: Tavakal

texts.ru:
Эту активную и трудящуюся женщину зовут Тавакал. Она из района Рудаки. Тавакал в свои 52 года все еще занимается тяжелой земельной работой. Она начала заниматься растениеводством 12 лет назад и по сей день продолжает эту деятельность. У Тавакал имеется небольшой участок приусадебной земли, на котором она выращивает огородные культуры. Ей помогают один сын и невестки. Тавакал имеет двух сыновей и одну дочь. Она разведена и сама воспитала и поставила на ноги своих детей. 
Сейчас Тавакал готовит землю к весеннему посеву. Она хочет посадить картошку и по этой причине просит кредит для купли семян картофеля. С помощью кредита она сможет во время провести посевные работы.
texts.en:
This is an active and hardworking woman named Tavakal. She is from the Rudaki District. Even at 52 years old, Tavakal still practices labor-intensive field world. She started crop farming 12 years ago and continues this business to this day. Tavakal has a small garden plot on which she grows garden crops. One of her sons and her daughter-in-law help her with this. Tavakal has two sons and one daughter. She is divorced and raised her children herself and got them on their feet.

Now Tavakal is preparing her land for the spring sowing season. She wants to plant potatoes and for this reason is requesting a loan to buy potato seeds. With the help of the loan, she will be able to carryout the spring sowing on time.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds to carry out the spring sowing season.

loans.name: Joses

texts.en:
Meet Joses, a farmer who hails from the Nkubu area, found along the slopes of Mt.Kenya. He is married and has four children. He has been farming for the past 17 years and he loves dairy farming the most because it provides him with enough money to take care of his family. His primary income source is from the sale of milk, eggs, bananas, and vegetables. His biggest challenge is insufficient water, which leads to insufficient animal feed.

Joses chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because it offers favorable interest rates. During the training, he learned how to plan and budget which helps him as a farmer. Through this loan his livestock will produce more and this will lead to more income. He will be able to raise more school fees for his children.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed.

loans.name: Mónica Patricia

texts.es:
Mónica, a sus 40 años de edad, es casada y madre de 3 hijos a los que ha sacado adelante con esfuerzo y dedicación.
Desde hace más de 9 años, ha trabajado como comerciante independiente, vendiendo mercancía y de manera complementaria, recibía el dinero del arriendo de un local que tiene en la plaza de mercado del municipio, el cual estuvo ocupado por 8 meses. Actualmente el local se encuentra desocupado, esto la motivó a comenzar con su propio negocio de venta de comestibles y licores en compañía de su esposo (ver foto), con el fin de aprovechar el espacio que tiene disponible y generar mejores ingresos para su familia.
El crédito que solicita será destinado para la compra de surtido e insumos al por mayor (mecato, gaseosas, cervezas, licor, dulces, alimentos fritos), esto le dará la oportunidad de iniciar su nuevo proyecto productivo, con el que espera satisfacer los gustos de sus clientes, en la misma medida que genera recursos para solventar los gastos familiares.
Mónica manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es fortalecer y acreditar bien su negocio, para lograr reconocimiento y darle permanencia en el tiempo; de esta forma tendrá la capacidad económica de dar mejor educación a sus hijos y continuar velando por el bienestar de los que ama.
texts.en:
At 40 years old, Mónica is married and a mother to three children, whom she has helped to get ahead with effort and dedication. 

For over nine years Mónica has worked as an independent businesswoman. She has been selling merchandise and, in order to compliment her income, rented out a space at the local market for eight months. This property is now vacant and this has motivated Mónica to start her own business selling food and alcoholic drinks with her husband (as seen in the photo) in order to make the most of the space and to earn a higher income for her family.

Mónica is applying for a loan in order to buy stock and supplies (snacks, fizzy drinks, beers, liquors, sweets and fried foods) in bulk. This will give her the opportunity to start her new project. She hopes to satisfy her customers' tastes and earn an income to cover household costs.

Mónica tells us that her biggest desire is to establish and strengthen her business so that it will become well-known and will remain active for a long time. If this happens, Mónica will have the financial resources to be able to give her children a better up-bringing and to continue to looking after the well-being of those whom she loves.

loans.use: Comprar surtido e insumos al por mayor (mecato, gaseosas, cervezas, licor, dulces, alimentos fritos)

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is married and  lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and water. 

For the past three years, she has operated an agriculture business to sell produce to her neighbors and passers-by. She faces a major challenge of crop disease which leads to losses. She dreams of expanding her business to generate more income. 

With the loan that she is requesting,  she wants to purchase more seedlings and pesticides.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more seedlings and pesticides.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more dried fish for her business,

loans.name: Naziran

texts.en:
Naziran, age 29, is a married woman.  She deals in the business of animal sales. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells butter and cheese to generate an extra amount of income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. 

For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase more cattle. 

She is very experienced, and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle.

loans.name: Aibazar

texts.ru: Айбазар 56 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 детей. У Айбазар - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Айбазар занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 19 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Айбазар, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 1 лошадь, 20 овец, также выращивает картофель на 0,50 ГА, морковь на 0,30 ГА и пшеницу на 0,40 ГА. Ежемесячный доход составляет 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айбазар обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Айбазар планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Aibazar is 56 years old, married, and together with her husband, is raising five children. Aibazar has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, Aibazar practices livestock breeding and crop farming. She started this business 19 years ago with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Aibazar's hard work, she currently has 2 milk cows, 1 horse and 20 sheep on her farm. She also grows potatoes on 0.50 hectares of land, carrots on 0.30 hectares of land and wheat on 0.40 hectares of land. Her monthly income is 20,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Aibazar turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy sheep to increase the size of her herd. Aibazar plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta, shown above at the second-hand items market in Korca city, is a member of the vulnerable ethnic minority of Egyptian Albanians. 

The Roman & Egyptian thrifty items markets are the largest and only ones in the cities. She buys used shoes and/or new ones with some defects from production manufactures and sells them to local community.

Loreta divorced very long ago and has custody of a young daughter.  She lives with her married daughter.  She worked two jobs to raise her daughter. In addition to selling, she works as a janitor with the municipality.  

The city where they reside is known for its cobblestone streets and  romantic ballads, unlike any other city in Albania.

loans.use: to buy used and/or new damaged shoes from producers to resell.

loans.name: Robeena

texts.en:
Robeena is 34 years old and a married woman. 

She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of PKR 45,000 to Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread in different colors, along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons. It will allow her to stitch up more dresses on time to generate a healthier source of income.  

She is in her 4th loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors, along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en: Kousar is 41 years old, married, and has four children. One of her sons is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Kousar requested a loan for 50,000 PKR, which her son will use to buy new tires and some auto spare parts for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Kousar is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her son and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to purchase new tires and auto spare parts for her son's vehicle.

loans.name: Turganbu

texts.ru: Турганбу 64 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 7 детей. У Турганбу - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Турганбу занимается животноводством, стартовав 39 лет назад, с покупки скота на 500 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Турганбу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 11 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Турганбу обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Турганбу планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку нового дома.
texts.en: Turgunbu is 64 years old, married, and together with her husband, is raising seven children. Turgunbu has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, Turgunbu practices livestock breeding. She started this business 39 years ago, with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 500 som (KGS). Thanks to Turgunbu's hard work, she currently has 1 milk cows and 11 sheep on her farm. Her monthly income is 12,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Turgunbu turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy a cow to increase the size of her herd. Turgunbu plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money to build a new house.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Jazgul

texts.ru: Жазгул 36 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Жазгул - высшее образование, работает преподавателем английского языка в местной школе. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Жазгул вместе с мужем занимается животноводством, стартовав 14 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Жазгул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 1 лошадь, 5 коз, 10 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жазгул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку лошади для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Жазгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en: Jazgul is 36 years old, married, and together with her husband, is raising two children. Jazgul has a higher education. She works as an English language teacher at a local school. As a source of additional income for her family, Jazgul practices livestock breeding. She started this business 14 years ago, with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Jazgul's hard work, she currently has 3 milk cows, 1 horse, 5 goats and 10 sheep on her farm. Her monthly income is 15,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Jazgul turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy a horse to increase the size of her herd. Jazgul plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money for her children's future education.

loans.use: to buy a horse.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cassavas, coconuts, and peanuts

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Víctor tiene 52 años de edad, solo pudo estudiar hasta sexto grado, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica  a los oficios domésticos, tienen 3 hijos de los cuales dos ya están acompañados y trabajan. 

Victor tiene mucho tiempo dedicándose a la agricultura, el trabajo le queda a 30 minutos de su casa y todos los días debe irse caminando.

El crédito que él está solicitando, lo necesita para comprar ganado, ya que siempre le ha gustado cuidar animales y además le genera ingresos para su familia. 

Él desea seguir trabajando duro y dejarles a sus hijos un capital propio, casa y ganado.
texts.en:
Víctor is 52 years old and was only able to study as far as sixth grade. He has a partner and she does domestic work. They have 3 children, two of whom have partners and are working. 

Victor has worked in agriculture for a long time. His work is 30 minutes from his house and he has to walk there every day. 

He needs the loan he is requesting to buy livestock, since he has always liked looking after animals and this also provides him with an income for his family. He wants to continue to work hard and to leave his children capital of their own, house and livestock.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Qurbongul

texts.ru: Курбонгул 50-летняя женщина родом из района Кубадиён. Она живет там с мужем, детьми, невесткой и внуками. Старшие сыновья в данный момент находятся на заработках за пределами страны. Курбонгул и остальные члены ее семьи занимаются животноводством. На протяжении более двух лет семья Курбонгула разводит крупный и мелкий рогатый скот для продажи. Это их семейный бизнес и главный источник дохода семьи. Сейчас Курбонгул обратилась за кредитом с целью увеличения поголовья скота. Она хочет закупить крупнорогатый скот и ожидает поддержки.
texts.en: Qurbongul is a 50 year-old woman from the Qubadiyon district.  She lives there with her husband, children, daughters-in-law and grandchildren.  Her older sons are currently working abroad.  Qurbongul and the rest of the family members are involved in animal husbandry.  Qurbongul's family has been raising cattle and small livestock for sale for over two years.  This is their family business and the primary source of income for them.  Now Qurbongul requested this loan to increase livestock headcount.  She wants to buy cattle and awaits support.

loans.use: to buy cattle in order to increase livestock headcount

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
34-year-old Cecilia has continued to grow her mobile money business. She explains how the business has given her a lot of opportunities and the financial ability to take care of her young child and 72-year-old mother. 
 
Cecilia is a very energetic and hard-working individual. She enjoys her business because she gets to interact with different people and help her community by employing youth and providing a needed service. She currently employs three young adults to help with the business's day-to-day operations.

Cecilia is grateful to all her Kiva lenders for the financial support. She would like to let them know that her first Kiva loan helped her to serve more customers at her business by increasing her cash flow. With this additional capital she was able to increase her profits and is ready to expand the business by opening another Zoona outlet in the capital city of Lusaka. 

Cecilia is requesting a second Kiva loan to  purchase a trading booth for the new location. She will use the additional monies to help service her customers by boosting her working capital, which is used to serve the customers' money transfer needs. Cecilia is confident that once she begins to operate from the new location, she will earn enough profits to help her buy a piece of land so that she can build her own house for herself and her family one day to live in.

loans.use: To purchase a new trading booth to expand her mobile money business to serve more customers in need of sending or receiving money.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe TIESSIRI est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 33 ans, et 5 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Degui, commune de Marka-coungo, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de fruits, de chaussures, de l’igname, de la pâte d’arachide, de beignet, et de gâteau. Les femmes du groupe TIESSIRI sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
La cliente GNINE  la personne assise au milieu est analphabète, elle est actuellement de papaye. Elle compte acheter, 2 gros paniers de papaye sur place avec les jardiniers du village. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce à Marka-coungo à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 10 000Fcfa, qui sera injecté dans l’élevage de chèvres.
texts.en:
Tiessiri Group is made up of married women who average 33 years of age and 5 children. They all live in traditional families in Degui, a village in the municipality of Marka-Coungo, Dioïla Prefecture, Koulikoro Region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They got to know each other through bonds of kinship, community, and friendship. They sell fruits, shoes, yams, peanut paste, doughnuts, and cakes. The women of Tiessiri Group are seeking their third solidarity loan (group loan).

Eager to meet a very high customer demand, they are seeking support from Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso.

Gnine is the woman sitting in the middle. She's illiterate and currently sells papayas. She intends to buy two large baskets of papayas from local growers in the village.

She sells retail and for cash in Marka-Coungo, to a mixed-gender clientele. She intends to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 10'000 (ca US$ 21), to be reinvested in goat farming.

loans.use: to buy two large baskets of papayas

loans.name: Ezequiel

texts.pt:
O Senhor  Ezequiel vive na casa propria é casado tem 4 filhos e 3  andam na escola. Ele trabalha como instrutor da policia da república. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar materiais de construção (chapas de zinco, cimento, janelas e barrotes).
O seu maior sonho é tornar se um empresário de sucesso.
texts.en: Ezequiel lives in his own home and is married with four children, three of whom attend school.  He works as an instructor for the Mozambique Republic Police. With the present loan, he plans to buy construction materials such as sheets of zinc, cement, windows, and support beams.  His greatest dream is to become a successful businessman.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as sheets of zinc, cement, windows, and support beams.

loans.name: Nurzada

texts.ru: Нурзаде 30 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Нурзады - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Нурзада занимается животноводством, стартовав 7 лет назад, с покупки скота на 30,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Нурзады, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 40 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Нурзада обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом - на покупку овец для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Нурзада планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и намерена провести ремонт дома.
texts.en: Nurzada is 30 years old, married and raising 3 children together with her husband. Nurzada has a secondary education. To provide the primary income for her family, she is involved in animal husbandry, having started 7 years ago with a purchase of livestock with 30,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Nurzada's hard work, today her business contains 40 sheep. The monthly income amounts to 10,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Nurzada requested a loan from the bank "Bai-Tushum" to buy sheep for fattening up and subsequent resale at a market at a higher price. Nurzada plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing domestic livestock quantities and intends to make repairs at home.

loans.use: to buy sheep for fattening up and resale

loans.name: Sairakan

texts.ru: Сайракан 58 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Сайракан - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Сайракан занимается животноводством, стартовав 22 года назад, с покупки скота на 1,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Сайракан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 10 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Сайракан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Сайракан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку семейной автомашины.
texts.en: Sairakan is 58 years old, married and raising 2 children together with her husband. Sairakan has a secondary education. To provide the primary income for her family, she is involved in animal husbandry, having started 22 years ago with a purchase of livestock with 1,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Sairakan's hard work, today her business contains 2 dairy cows and 10 sheep. The monthly income amounts to 10,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Sairakan requested a loan from the bank "Bai-Tushum" to buy cattle in order to increase her livestock headcount. Sairakan plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing domestic livestock quantities and saving money to buy a family car.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Rosa

texts.pt:
A Senhora Rosa é casada e vive com o esposo, 3 filhos dos e um neto. Ela é comerciante. Vende produtos de primeira necessidade e material escolar.
 Com o presente empréstimo quer adquirir material de construção, tais como cimento, tintas, cimento cola. 
Tem como sonho, para além de ter a casa reabilitada e mobiliada, comprar uma viatura para o transporte pessoal e de  mercadorias
texts.en: Rosa is married and lives with her husband, three children, and one grandson. She is a vendor, selling basic needs items and school supplies. With the present loan, she wants to purchase construction materials, such as cement, paint, and mortar.  Her dream, beyond having a renovated and furnished house, is to buy a car for her personal use as well as for vending.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials, such as cement, paint, and mortar.

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.ru:
Насиба трудолюбивая и жизнерадостная женщина в возрасте 44 лет. Она замужем и имеет 3-их детей.  Насиба живёт со своей семьёй в сельской местности в небольшом доме. Она не имеет высшего образования. Чтобы иметь доход на пропитание, Насиба занимается своим бизнесом. Она торгует на рынке различной женской одеждой. Для этого у неё имеется собственная лавка на рынке.  Она обратилась в Арванд впервые, когда узнала, что есть возможность получить финансовую поддержку.

Муж Насибы также не имеет образования и занимается частным извозом  и воспитанием детей. Также Насиба подрабатывает вязанием. Вяжет разные женские платки для продажи. От данного бизнеса она получает хороший доход. Сейчас Насиба хочет увеличить количество товара для расширения своего бизнеса. Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить кредит, чтобы закупить партию весенней женской одежды. Насиба верит, что её бизнес будет процветать и приносить ей достаточный доход. Она очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Nasiba is a hardworking and happy 40 year-old woman.  She is married and has three children.  Nasiba lives with her family in a small house in a rural area.  She does not have a higher education.  Nasiba is involved in her own business in order to have income for food.  She sells various women's clothing at a market and has her own storefront there.  She came to Arvand for the first time after learning that she could obtain financial support.

Nasiba's husband also does not have education and is involved in private transportation and raising the children.  Nasiba also earns an income from knitting.  She knits various women's scarves for sale.  She earns a good income from this business.  Currently, Nasiba wants to increase the quantity of merchandise in order to expand her business.  This is why she came to Arvand and wants to obtain a loan to buy an inventory of women's spring clothing.  Nasiba believes that her business will flourish and yield her sufficient income.  She hopes very much for a positive result and thanks Arvand for the support in advance.

loans.use: to buy an inventory of women's spring clothing

loans.name: Jairo Lorenzo

texts.es: Don Jairo es originario de la comarca Tomatoyita en la ciudad de Boaco, casado y padre de dos hijos. Tiene 31 años de edad. Es de oficio Agricultor, se dedica a la siembra de Maíz, Frijol y Trigo. Inicio su negocio hace varios años con la ayuda de su papa y su familia y poco a poco ha ido obteniendo ganancias para la compra de algunas vacas que le ayudan en sus siembras. Su meta próxima es preparar su terreno para la nueva siembra que realizara. Solicita el crédito para comprar Abono, Urea refrescante y dos terneros. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá realizar la siembra de forma rápida y de buena calidad. Su plan futuro es comprar un ternero.
texts.en:
Jairo is originally from the Tomatoyita region of the city of Boaco and is married with two children. He is 31 years old. He works in agriculture, growing corn, beans and wheat. He started up his business several years ago with the help of his dad and his family and gradually has made profits which he has used to buy cows which help with the crops. His next goal is to prepare the land for the next sowing he plans to carry out. 

He is asking for the loan to buy manure and fertilizer and two bullocks. He thinks the loan will be a great help to him as he will be able to carry out the sowing quickly and with optimum conditions. His plan for the future is to buy a bullock.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and urea and two bullocks.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la clienta de 20 años de edad vive en casa propia con su madre, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, el negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues las personas saben que todo es de calidad, a precios accesibles y con un servicio inigualable siempre a la orden y al gusto de los clientes; la clienta es una joven emprendedora, dedicada a su labor y muy luchadora día con día se esfuerza al máximo para ganarse una vida mejor y un gran éxito para el futuro, en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para una nueva inversión, pero no posee de suficiente capital que la respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ropa por mayor, ella tiene buenas referencia de parte de sus vecinos y una moral intachable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene la esperanza que tendrá una mejor vida junto con su madre.
texts.en: This borrower is 20 years old and lives in a privately owned house with her mother. The borrower makes a living selling clothes and has had the business a number of years, which has given her experience and allowed her to make higher profits. The borrower runs the business out of her home. She has many customers as people know that she offers good quality products at accessible prices, and with unbeatable service catering to the tastes of all customers. This borrower is an enterprising young woman: she is dedicated to her work and very plucky as she puts in the maximum effort every day in order to have a better life and be a great success in the future. In the last few weeks demand has increased and so this borrower want to take advantage and invest more in the business. She does not, however, have enough capital to do this and so is applying for a loan from "Apoyo Integral" in order to buy more clothes. This borrower is, according to her neighbours, reliable with repayments, and has impeccable morals. She assures us that she will be able to pay off the debt and, at the same time, she hopes that she will be able to have a better life with her mother.

loans.use: to buy clothes in bulk.

loans.name: Gs Emprendedores Group

texts.es:
Nahum, tiene 30 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja con quien tiene 2 hijos y reside en una aldea que pertenece al  municipio de San Pedro Sula, Cortes.
Desde muy joven se ha dedicado a la agricultura cultivando maíz y frijoles, estos granos son vendidos en la misma zona en los mercados locales. Ha solicitado un préstamo por 6,000 lempiras en forma grupal para comprar abonos y dar mantenimiento de limpieza al cultivo de maíz y frijol  para lograr una mejor cosecha. Su objetivo es mejorar las ganancias para ayudar a su familia.
El grupo se llama GS Emprendedores, esta integrado por cuatro miembros que se dedican a la agricultura de granos básicos, viven en la misma comunidad. El préstamo que solicitan en grupo es por 23,000 lempiras para darle mantenimiento al cultivo. En la foto se identifican de izquierda a derecha. A la izquierda esta don Paz, José Elder, Marlen y Nahúm a la derecha.
texts.en:
Nahum is 30 years old and lives with his partner and their two children. The family lives in a village which is part of the San Pedro Sula municipality of Cortes.

Nahum has been growing corn and beans since he was very young. He sells the grains in the local markets. Nahum has applied for a loan of 6,000 Lempira - as part of a group loan - in order to buy manure and to look after his corn and bean crops. He can then have a better harvest. Nahum's aim is to increase his profits in order to help his family.

This group is called "GS Emprendedores" and has four members, all of whom work growing basic grains. They live in the same community. This group loan of 23,000 Lempira will be used to look after crops. In the photo, from left to right, are Paz, José Elder, Marlen and Nahum.

loans.use: to buy manure and to look after his corn and bean crops.

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru:
Махбуба жизнерадостная и очень ответственная женщина. Она замужем и имеет 3-их детей.  Махбуба живёт со своей семьёй в маленькой деревушке. Она не имеет высшего образования, так как сразу после окончания школы её выдали замуж. И сейчас она старается самостоятельно работать, чтобы иметь доход на пропитание. Махбуба занимается своим бизнесом. Она торгует на рынке детской одеждой. Она обратилась в Арванд впервые, когда узнала, что есть возможность получить финансовую поддержку.

Муж Махбубы также не имеет образования и работает пекарем в цехе по изготовлению лепёшек. Также Махбуба подрабатывает выпечкой кондитерских изделий. Выпекает булочки, пирожки, торты и другое для продажи. От данного бизнеса она получает хороший доход. Сейчас Махбуба хочет увеличить количество товара для расширения своего бизнеса. Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на приобретение продуктов для выпечки. Махбуба очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Mahbuba is a cheerful and very responsible woman. She is married and has three children. Mahbuba lives with her family in a small village. She does not have a higher education, as she got married right after she graduated from secondary school. Now she is trying to work self-sufficiently to make an income to live on. Mahbuba has her own business. She sells children's clothing at the market. She turned to Arvand for the first time when she realized that there was the opportunity to receive financial support.

Mahbuba's husband also does not have a higher education and works as a baker in a shop that makes lepyeshka (Central Asian bread). Mahbuba also earns extra money baking pastries. She bakes rolls, small stuffed patties, cakes and other pastries for sale. She receives a good income from this business. Now Mahbuba wants to increase her number of goods to expand her business. This is why she is requesting a loan from Arvand to buy groceries needed for baking. Mahbuba really relies on a positive outcome and thanks Arvand in advance for their support.

loans.use: to purchase groceries needed for baking.

loans.name: Kassim

texts.en:
Kassim is a 29-year-old single man. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are reliable. He describes his biggest business challenge as low capital. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy motorcycle spare parts. His business goal is to expand within 5 years. He hopes that, in the future, he will improve his way of life. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM. He will use the anticipated profits to buy another motorcycle.

loans.use: buy motorcycle spare parts

loans.name: Labasse

texts.fr:
LABASSE  est né 1990 à KEBILA, commune de KEBILA, une des sous- préfectures de la 3ème Région administrative du Mali .Mr LABASSE  est monogame et a un enfant. Il réside à KEBILA.
Mr LABASSE s’est vite intéressé aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat et vente de céréales et d’articles divers .Sa vente se fait à KEBILA.  
Fort de  ses 2 années d’expérience dans le domaine, il collabore avec Soro Yiriwaso pour augmenter  son fonds de commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cesse de grandir et est à son  premier  prêt.
Mr LABASSE compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 5 sacs de maïs et 5 sacs de mil et un carton d’articles divers. Il s’approvisionne à KEBILA et environnants .Il effectue ses ventes au comptant et quelques fois à crédit au marché et chez lui à la maison. Sa clientèle est composée d’hommes.
Mr LABASSE espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Labasse was born in 1990 in Kebila, one of the subprefectures in the third administrative region of Mali. He lives in Kebila, is monogamous, and has one child.   

Early on, Mr. Labasse got interested in money-earning businesses, particularly in buying and selling cereals and other products. He sells in Kebila.

Building on his two years of experience in this field, he collaborates with Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, in order to increase his working capital and meet an ever-increasing customer demand.

He is seeking his first loan, and he intends to use it to buy 5 sacks of corn, 5 sacks of millet, and one box of various products. He gets his supplies in Kebila and its surroundings.

He sells for cash, and sometimes on credit, at the market and at his home. His clientele is made up of men. He hopes to turn a monthly profit of XOF 40'000 (ca US$ 85), to be used to provide for his family's needs, repay the loan, and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy 5 sacks of corn, 5 sacks of millet, and various products

loans.name: Mwanamkasi

texts.en:
Mwanamkasi is married, with three school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family.

Mwanamkasi has operated a cafe business, making consumables for sale to passersby and neighbors, like rice, tea, beans, chapati (flat bread). She cited seasonality as her major challenge.

With the loan, Mwanamkasi wants to purchase stocks of goods for the business, like maize flour, wheat flour, rice, and drinks. She joined Yehu Microfinance Trust to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of goods for the business, like maize flour, wheat flour, rice, and drinks.

loans.name: Nthamba

texts.en:
Nthamba is 49 years old and married. She adopted three children whom she is taking care of. She has been making sisal ropes for sale for the last four years and she also does livestock farming, which earns her a total of KES 15,000.

This is Nthamba's fourth loan with VisionFund Kenya and she intends to buy sisal, for making ropes, and animal feed.

She will use the anticipated profits to repay her loan and make some savings. Nthamba hopes to improve her living standards and also to educate the children she is taking care of.

loans.use: to buy sisal for making ropes.

loans.name: Manantial De Vida Group

texts.es: Dirigido por la coordinadora señora Scarleth con 26 años de edad, acompañada con dos hijos de las edades de 9 y 10 años, dedicándose a la compra-venta de cosechas, con el crédito piensa invertir en compra de cosechas de  tamarindo, jocotes, mango y aguacate ya con 4 años de tener el negocio permitiéndole estabilidad al conocer mejor su negocio. El grupo también lo conforma la socia Zeneida con 33 años vendiendo frutas y la señora Ana con 23 años comercializando pan en la localidad y municipio cercano.
texts.en:
26-year-old Scarleth is the group's coordinator. She has a partner and two children aged 9 and 10. She makes a living buying and selling harvests. 

She plans to use the loan to buy tamarind, jocote [type of plum], mango and avocado harvests. Now she has had the business for 4 years she has stability from knowing her business better.

The other members of the group are Zeneida, aged 33 years, who sells fruit, and Ana who is 23 and sells bread locally and in the nearby town.

loans.use: to buy seasonal harvests such as tamarind, jocote, mango and avocado.

loans.name: Asmat

texts.en: Asmat is 41 years old, married, and the mother of four children. For 16 years she has been running a business with her husband selling milk. (He is also shown in the photo.) She initiated her own business to support her family. With the passage of time her business increased and also her income. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters, as well as financial matters. She has some savings and has applied for a loan of 50,000 PKR. She intends to use this loan amount to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She is in her sixth loan cycle and has good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Mavguda

texts.ru:
Мавчуда трудолюбивая и жизнерадостная женщина. Мавчуда живёт со своей семьёй в сельской местности. Она замужем  и воспитывает 2-их детей.  Она не имеет высшего образования. Чтобы иметь доход на пропитание, Мавчуда занимается своим бизнесом. Она торгует на рынке детской одеждой. Для продажи она имеет свой прилавок. Она обратилась в Арванд впервые, узнав, что есть возможность получить финансовую поддержку на ведение своего бизнеса.

Муж Мавчуды военнослужащий, а по вечерам занимается частным извозом.  Также Мавчуда подрабатывает шитьем. Шьет  различные детские и женские платья для продажи. От данного бизнеса она получает хороший доход. Сейчас Мавчуда хочет увеличить количество товара для расширения своего бизнеса. Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить кредит, чтобы закупить партию детской одежды. Мавчуда очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Mavguda is a hardworking and cheerful woman. Mavguda lives with her family in the countryside. She is married and has two children. She does not have a higher education. In order to have an income to live on, Mavguda has her own business. She sells children's clothing at the market. She has her own market stall to sell out of. She turned to Arvand for the first time when she realized that there was an opportunity to receive financial support to help her run her business.

Mavguda's husband is in the military. In the evenings, he offers his services as a private taxi driver. Mavguda also earns extra money as a seamstress. She sows various children's and women's dresses for sale. She receives a good income from this business. Now Mavguda wants to increase her amount of merchandise to expand her business. This is why she is requesting a loan from Arvand to buy a shipment of children's clothes. Mavguda really relies on a positive outcome and thanks Arvand in advance for their support.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: G.s. Señor De La Misericordia Group

texts.es:
El g.s  el Señor de la Misericordia está conformado por tres integrantes  madres solteras con seis hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarias de León, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de  occidente del país. Se caracterizan por ser trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre les gusta disfrutar de la compañia de sus hijos. Lamentablemente no pudieron terminar sus estudios básicos, por la necesidad económica que tiene y se vieron obligadas a trabajar desde temprana edad.
Gracias a  su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es  Justina y tiene por actividad económica una pulpería, es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, detergente, jugos, galletas, verduras, chiltomas, fósforos, jugos, gaseosas. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El g.s el Señor de la Misericordia agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a  personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The solidarity group “El Señor de la Misericordia” (Lord of Compassion) consists of three members who are single mothers and are responsible for six children among them. They are originally from León, a place that is located in the western part of the country. The members are known for being hardworking, responsible, and having the drive to succeed on a personal level. In their free time, they enjoy being with their children. Unfortunately, due to the lack of financial resources, they were not able to study for a degree since they were obligated to work at an early age.

Thanks to her efforts and her desire to move forward, Justina was named the group coordinator. Her business is a small grocery store where she sells products such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, detergent, juices, cookies, vegetables, peppers, matches, and sodas. She works approximately 12 hours a day at her business by offering her products. Her business is located in her home. The purpose of her loan is to invest it as operating capital so that she can restock her business of buying and selling groceries. In the near future, she would like to generate more income.

The solidarity group “El Señor de la Misericordia” is grateful for the assistance that Kiva lenders provide to people who have limited resources and come from poor countries, such as Nicaragua, so that they have a means of earning a decent living.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, detergent, juices, cookies, vegetables, peppers, matches, and sodas.

loans.name: Delia Del Carmen

texts.es: delia de 35 años de edad vive en casa alquilada con sus esposo y sus tres hijos, ella se dedica desde hace varios años a la venta de dulce artesanal comercializa de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, posee mucha clientela por la calidad del producto y los buenos precios, Delia esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas dulces por mayor y poder seguir con sus ventas que le generan buenas ganancias y darle a su familia o que necesitan sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Delia is 35 years old and lives in a rented house along with her husband and children.  She has been selling handmade sweets for several years.  Delia works as a street vendor and travels to different neighborhoods near her home to sell her products.  She has many customers because of the quality of her products and the good prices she offers.  

Delia is requesting a loan so that she can buy more sweets in bulk.  This will allow her to continue her sales so that she can generate good earnings and provide for her family’s needs without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy sweets in bulk to sell.

loans.name: Torokan

texts.ru: Торокан 51 год, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Торокан - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Торокан занимается животноводством, стартовав 30 лет назад, с покупки скота на 4,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Торокан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 дойные коровы, 16 коз. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Торокан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Торокан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en: Torokan is 51 years old, married, and together with her husband, is raising four children. Torokan has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, Torokan practices animal husbandry. She started this business 30 years ago, with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 4,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Torokan's hard work, she currently has 4 milk cows and 16 goats on her farm. Her monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Torokan turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy cows to increase the size of her herd. Torokan plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money for her children's future education.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Zyinat

texts.ru: Зыйнат 44 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Зыйнат - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Зыйнат занимается животноводством, стартовав 14 лет назад, с покупки скота на 4,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Зыйнат, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 1 теленок. Ежемесячный доход составляет 11,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Зыйнат обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Зыйнат планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en: Zyinat is 44 years old, married, and together with her husband, is raising three children. Zyinat has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, Zyinat practices livestock breeding. She started this business 14 years ago, with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 4,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Zyinat's hard work, she currently has 2 milk cows and 1 calf on her farm. Her monthly income is 11,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Zyinat turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy sheep to increase the size of her herd. Zyinat plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money for her children's future education.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Carmen Isabel

texts.es: Carmen de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos. Ella posee una tienda donde vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, frijoles, leche entre otros, últimamente se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues siempre tiene lo que las personas necesitan con productos de excelente calidad a precios realmente accesibles y con un servicio inigualable; Carmen es una mujer emprendedora con muchas ganas de salir adelante, quiere sentirse ganadora y para lograr el éxito sus mayores secretos son la constancia y la dedicación, esta dispuesta a hacer crecer su negocio es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, producto instantáneo, embutidos, golosinas, bebidas etc. carmen tiene la confianza que con su dedicación podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Carmen is 45 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and two children.  She owns a store where she sells basic necessity items like rice, beans, and milk, among others.  Lately, she's gained a lot of customers because she always has what people need, offering high quality merchandise at prices that are actually accessible and with unequaled service. 

Carmen is an enterprising woman with great ambition to get ahead in life.  She likes to be a winner and her biggest secrets to success are persistence and dedication.  She's in a position to grow her business and that's why she's seeking a loan from INTEGRAL.  This loan will allow her to buy staple grains, instant meals, deli meats, candies, beverages, etc.  Carmen is confident that with her dedication she will be able to make a better life for her family.

loans.use: to buy staple grains, instant meals, deli meats, candies, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Camino Al Exito Group

texts.es: Coordinado por el señor Jerald de 30 años de edad, casado y padre de un bebé de 18 meses, se dedica a distribuir cosméticos ( perfumes, pinturas labiales, pinturas de uñas), además vende de ropa nueva, éste es un nuevo negocio que está impulsando, motivo que le anima a invertir en variedad de ropas de niños, hombres, mujeres y adolescentes, también en invertir en cosméticos como perfumes de damas, perfumes de varón, lociones, cremas para manos, cremas para cuerpos, maquillajes, cremas faciales etc. Los otros integrantes del grupo son Martha de 49 años dedicada a la venta de cosméticos, la señora Dulce de 52 años dedicada al negocio de la zapatería y el señor Pantaleón de 55 años dedicado a la construcción de casas.
texts.en:
30-year-old Jerald, who is the group's coordinator, is married and has an 18-month-old baby. He makes a living selling cosmetics (perfumes, lipsticks, nail varnish) and also sells new clothing. This is a new business which he is starting up, for which reason he is keen to invest in a variety of clothing for men, women, children and adolescents. He also wants to buy cosmetics such as men's and women's perfumes, lotions, hand creams, body creams, make-up, face cream etc. 

The other members of the group are Martha, who is 49 and sells cosmetics, Dulce who is 52 and sells shoes and 55-year-old Pantaleón who build houses.
