loans.use: to buy cosmetics, such as men's and women's perfumes,  body lotion, lipstick, nail varnish, and new clothing.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 24 years old. He is married to his wife Penina, and they are blessed with one child.

David has been doing farming for the last two years and earns a monthly income of 10,000 Kenya shillings (KES). This is his first loan with Vision Fund Kenya and he intends to use it to purchase fertilizer, seeds, and animal feed in order to improve his farming activity.

Paul will use the anticipated profits to pay his loan and increase the number of livestock in his farm. He hopes to provide better living standards for his family.

loans.use: To buy more farm inputs, such as fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy  2 doors, 2 sets of security bars, cement, sand, and gravel to lay down a concrete floor  and make her home safer.

loans.name: Neamat

texts.en:
Neamat is a 57-year-old, married woman. She is a very talented woman and she excels in her work of stitching. She has gotten a lot of appreciation from her community. She accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to meet the expenses of their household or the educational needs of children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Neamat has now requested a loan of PKR 50,000 to purchase more reels of thread, along with packs of buttons, zippers, and laces in various colors. In this way, she will be able to consistently meet the increasing demand. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Neamat expects a boost in her earnings.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of thread, along with packs of buttons, zippers, and laces in various colors.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe BENKADI ont en moyenne  24ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à DIALAKORO/SEGOU (la quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente de chaussures et divers. 
 Les femmes du groupe BENKADI sont à leur  1er  prêt solidaire. OUMOU, 3ème femme à gauche  sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour  acheter 40 paires de chaussures en cuir et 80 paires de chaussures en plastiques. Elle s’approvisionne à SAN. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 16.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, et l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women who make up the Benkadi group are, on average, 24 years old and have an average of five children each.  They all live in extended traditional families in Dialakoro/Segou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

These women, who know one another through family ties, are involved in buying and selling shoes and other various items.  This is their first solidarity loan.

Oumou, the featured borrower, is planning to use her loan to buy 40 pairs of leather shoes and 80 pairs of plastic shoes. In the photo, she is third from the left.  She stocks up in San and sells to both men and women who pay her in cash and also often on credit.

She is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 16000 CFA francs which will be used to take care of healthcare and education costs, and to buy food and clothes.  The rest of the money will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Yagoubou

texts.fr: Monsieur yagoubou est un homme âgé de 39 ans qui est marié et père de 5 enfants qui ont entre 12 et 3 ans. Il est employé dans une agence de la place et a une expérience de plus de 17 ans. Il commence sa journée à 8h pour descendre à 18h. Il demande ce prêt d’un montant de 500.000 F pour construire sa maison. Il gère les charges quotidiennes de sa famille et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants.  Il voudrait aussi à l’avenir ouvrir une ferme agricole pour augmenter ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Yagoubou is 39 years old, married and father to five children between three and twelve years old.  He works in a local agency and has more than seventeen years' experience in his profession.  His working day starts at 8am and finishes at 6pm.

Yagoubou has requested this loan of 500,000 francs CFA to build a house.  He already provides for the day-to-day needs of his family, and the school fees of his children.

In the future, he would like to start an agricultural farm to increase his income and, as a result, improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy cement and iron to be used in the construction of his house.

loans.name: Bora Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mare est trésorière du groupement d’affaire Bora. Agée de 37 ans, mère de 5 enfants scolarisés; elle est mariée a un homme sans profession.Vendeuse des souliers, elle imstalle sa marchandise au marché central. Ce nouveau prêt va l’aider à acheter 15 paires de souliers. Elle souhaite scolariser ses enfants et prospérer dans ses affaires. Ainsi, elle remercie fortement Hekima de son soutien en microcrédit dédiés aux femmes entrepreneurs.
texts.en: The client Barhalengerwa is the treasurer of the business group Bora. She is 37 years old, the mother of five schoolchildren, and her husband is unemployed. She sells shoes at the central market. This new loan will help her buy 15 pairs of shoes. She hopes to educate her children and prosper in her business. Finally, she would like to greatly thank Hekima for its support of female entrepreneurs through microcredit.

loans.use: to buy 15 pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Mark

texts.en:
Mark is requesting this loan because his daughter has been granted a scholarship, due to her high GPA, to study abroad in Canada.
Mark works as a culinary chief in a town that is visited often by foreigners. It is the town where national hero Skanderbeg's body was put to rest on the 17th of January, 1468. Albanians speak very fondly of him; Skanderbeg whose name at birth was George, or whose Turkish name was given ‘Iskender bey’ was the youngest of nine children whose father had been a vassal of the Turkish Sultan since the end of 14th century, and, as a consequence, paid tribute and provided military services to the Ottomans. George was sent by his father to Sultan Murad II’s as a servant boy. Later he came to his homeland to release it from the Turkish army. His helmet and sword are preserved at the Kunsthistorisches_Museum in Vienna, Austria.

loans.use: to send his daughter to Canada, where she has been granted a scholarship from a Canadian university

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 51 years old, is married to Ruth and blessed with five children.

He has been farming for the last 20 years and earns a monthly income of KES 45,000. This is his first loan with VisionFund Kenya and he intends to purchase fertilizer, seed and animal feed to improve his farming activity.

Paul will use the anticipated profits to repay his loan and increase the number of livestock in his farm.He hopes to provide a better living standard for his family.

loans.use: To buy more farm inputs such as fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase supplies so that he can build new machines and expand his welding workshop
